I have found Ozempic to be fantastic for weight loss. I lost more weight with Ozempic than having lap band surgery. If I inject more than 0.5mg each week I have nausea and lethargy. I also experience vision loss (about 30% loss), whatever amount of Ozempic I take. I have not read anything about Ozempic causing vision loss. Please let me know if anyone else has had this issue. I have been to an eye doctor and he couldnât find any major issue with my eyes. As soon as I go off Ozempic my vision is back to normal. My main concern is whether this loss of vision could become permanent.

Ben on one pic 2 months. Iâve lost 19 lbs. I started with .25 for one month. It wasnât enough. Up to .5. I do get constipated but no nausea, vomiting etc. the day after injection I feel very tired but since I am retired I deal with it. Itâs been good. I do still get hungry sometimes. I have changed my diet. Iâm not eating processed foods I am cutting down on my carbs. Trying to eat only meat and vegetables but thatâs almost impossible. I think if it doesnât work for you maybe itâs your diet. Iâm staying on it for now. I will check my A1c next week . All in all I feel 100 percent better than when I was 20 lbs heavier.

Started with the .25 dose and experienced constant nausea for four weeks.  Worked my way through that and stated the .5 dose injection.  Into the first week of that dose I woke up with severe pain in both my hands.  It felt like my fingers were going to explode.  Pain spreading across my shoulder blades and severe pain in both of my knees.  I can not even wring out a wash cloth without being in severe pain.  I have tried everything to relieve the pain, ice, heat, and braces, nothing helps.  I am taking everything I can get my hands on for the pain but I will not take my next dose if this doesn't let up.

The pens keeps breaking, follow all directions, but 3rd one in a row jammed, using up cartridges to try to fix. Pharmacy doesnât supply new pens, just the package which isnât covered by insurance off cycle. Spoke to customer service, offered to replace ONE of the three in 5-7 business days. In the meantime, I go without medication I need.
I have taken 2 doses of the semaglutide injection. But it  didnât work in my case. I hv not seen loss of 10 grams of weights.

I stated at lowest dose to 1ml.
I've loss 13-15 pounds and today started with 2ml. I get nauseous but take phengren only. My A1C was stuck on 8.2 for the longest now it is 6.9!
The greatest thing is it's lowered my sugar & definitely curbed my appetite. With excersize (swim)I eat two yogurt 0 with fruit everyday and a protein at night with some veggies. I'm finally going to reach my goals  with this Ozempic! 
??????
So many digestive issues, pain, vomiting, constipation

Ended up in ICU with my blood sugar around 400. Discharged with an A1C of 14. Weight 267#. Started taking Farxiga and using both quick acting and long acting insulin. I cleaned up my diet and eliminated all sugar and processed foods, with a focus on veggies and white meat chicken. Stopped drinking alcohol and limited drinks to coffee, unsweetened iced tea and water. 3 weeks after leaving the hospital I was prescribed Ozempic. Took .25 for 2 weeks, then .5 for 2 weeks, then 1mg for 3 weeks, and just started taking 2mg today. Only side affect I have had is mild constipation. 4 weeks into taking ozempic my A1C fell to 11.2â¦ at this time I stopped using my quick acting insulin with meals. 3 weeks later my A1C came back at 5.7â¦. My weight is currently at 224#.

To combat constipation I began consuming 2 cups of black coffee each day. Usually 1 in the morning and 1 in the afternoon. I didnât like it black initially so I would add ice to it to cool it down so I could chug it fast. Over time Iâve come to like black coffe and enjoy it hot now. I also eat 1-2 sugar free greek yogurts each day. Iâve been doing this for 6 weeks or so now and I have little or no constipation. Oh, I also have found that if I fail to eat I become constipated so I feel that making sure I eat small food potions a couple times a day works. I also bought an Apple Watch and make sure that I walk 10k steps per day. Thatâs my journey so far with type 2. Hope my journey continues on this positive track.

I have been taking ozempic for 3 months for type 2 diabeties. I started on o.25 for 8 weeks as i had trouble with bad nausea. U then progressed to 0.5mgs, after taking it for just a couple of weeks i started with vomiting and watery diarrhea, had to sleep on towel and incontinence pads. It was worse at night time. I have been taking gastro stop which has started to helo me, but still do not feel very well, i cant eat very much now, so just have to wait for the ozempic to get out of my system. My sugar has drpped down to 7.8 from 10, so it does work for sugar. Will not be continuing with it as side affects are to lethal.

I have multiple sclerosis and was recently diagnosed with type two diabetes. Doc placement on Ozempic. I took my first dose of July 1.  Immediate negative reaction to the drug. BP off the charts, racing heart, face numbness. Today my stomach is not right, and I simply cannot eat. Not a way to live. I wish others well on this medication but I ended up in the emergency room and even my ER doctor agreed. This was a risky medication at best. I threw the rest of it out, and Iâm just going to make more diet modifications and lower my numbers on my own.  Good luck to all :-)

I have been on Ozempic 2mg for awhile. With that said,  I have lost the weight from 320 lbs to 200lbs, I'm 6'4". The problem with this medicine is that it does irritate the nerves in my feet. A burning prickly sensation for the first 3-4 days. Horrible headache and no sleep until it's absorbed in the body. Does anyone have a problem with the nerves in your body? Nerves in your feet? Overall I feel like crap for the first 2-3 days after weekly injection. I'm thinking about stopping ozempic.

I live in Canada. I have had Type 2 Diabetes since 2008. I wanted to wait and review it after a few months. I have now used Ozempic for five months as a result of my family doctorâs recommendation. He was quite concerned because my A1c had risen to 9.4, which is far too high. In the last five months, with gradual increases of Ozempic from .25 to .5 to 1.0, my A1c is down to a much more acceptable 7.6. My doctor is delighted with that improvement over a relatively short time. Iâve also lost 12 pounds so thatâs a bonus. In terms of side effects i sometimes feel a bit yucky, especially the day after my injection. I have very occasionally vomited but not lately. My appetite is suppressed although I never had a big appetite. Iâll definitely continue on with the medication.

I started having chronic headaches since last year. They started right after my sinus surgery so went back to surgeon. He said everything looked good but suggested i see a neurologist, which i did. Neurologist said i do not have migraines but ordered an MRI, which showed no problems. Have since seen 2 more ENT's, a "specialist" ENT, and an allergist. No one can find anything. I do have one clue: i started Ozempic and Ingressa (for tardive dyskinesia) about the same time. Have since discontinued Ingrezza due to side effects but the headaches continue. I say all this to ask: Has anyone experienced ongoing headaches with Ozempic? Thank you for your response!

My doctor gave me a one month sample and I could not get past shot #3.  The bloating, constipation and severe reflux made me realize that these meds work by triggering gastric paralysis, which for me, got SO bad I was nauseous and sick with reflux and IBS from shot 1 to shot 3 and for weeks after. So, Is it wise to introduce gastric paralysis to a Type II diabetic where the disease itself has some negative effect on motility? I want to lose wt and applaud those of you who stuck it out, but I failedâ¦again.
My pen stopped in the middle of a dose, like it was blocked! What to do?

I have only been on Ozempic at the low dose for three weeks. I am 5'2" and 209 poinds. I began the treatment at 211 pounds. So I seem to be losing a pound a week. This suits me just fine since I probably have been this heavy for over 15 years when my gall bladder removal got me gaining weight over time. The very first injection gave me a head ache and a slight bit of nausea. Oh great, I thought I will lose weight by feeling ill? But after the second week and now the third, I feel fine and still this weight loss is happening. I know I am just into the process, But so far so good. My goal is 20 pounds off with medication help and then to do it on my own. I figure maybe 4 to 6 months may be enough.

Was on Trulicity for a while and didnât like the side effects so asked my doctor for Ozempic. Biggest mistake or my life!! First off, he started me on 2mg per week. Didnât know he shouldâve started me on lower dosage and raise it weekly. First week, I thought I was dyingâ¦. The nausea, constipation, heartburn, nasty belches, severe fatigue, and vomiting. Couldnât eat, drink, or get out of bed until 4 days later. Second week, same symptoms, the fatigue, nausea, and vomiting is sickening. But lost 12 lbs in two weeks, appetite is non-existent and has been since the first week. Week 3, finally thought my body was used to the medicine because the side effects, except for the indigestion and nasty burps. Took my 4th dose this Sunday, 6/4/23, and I think Iâm dying. Canât even drink water. Stomach hurts and burns, watery diarrhea and vomiting at the same time. If I drink a sip of water, it comes out on the back end right away. Iâm writing this on Tuesday, 6/6/23, havenât been out the bed or eaten anything since Sunday. Iâm stopping this drug because the side effects outweigh the benefits for me, or maybe my doctor screwed up by starting me on the highest possible dosage. Not cool at all

Gave me stomach pain. Every morning! 
After a while I was sluggish and tired all day certain parts of the day, I felt pain in my heart, and I just didnât like this rug at all

Suffered from nausea while taking for 5/6 weeks. Nausea occurred every 2 hours after eating nearly every meal for the entire time. Never lost any weight. Heartbeat increased 10 bpm.  At times, I I felt extremely hungry (but did not give in). Isnât this the opposite of what should occur? I finally stopped the medication nearly 6 weeks in, after having a very violent 2 hr session of vomiting. Withdrawal was easy and negative side effects of the med disappeared almost immediately.

66 Male 5'10 190 lbs (+/-) My doc prescribed Ozempic to continue addressing my blood sugar (I was on Metformin for about a year, and my numbers improved significantly but I had diarrhea all the time and asked about Ozempic) which I started a month ago.I have not had any noticeable side effects from Ozempic, no rash at injection site, no nausea, or discomfort. I have experienced a bit of constipation, although that's better than the alternative. I'm waiting to see from my first labs if my numbers will continue the positive downward trend. I haven't noticed any real weight loss yet. I should also acknowledge that I significantly reduced my alcohol intake during the last month. I only have my beloved vodka martinis on Saturday nights.now.

once on 1mg dose starting december 2022 till april 2023, l lost 23lb and dropped from 42" pant waist to a 38" waist. My A1C dropped from 8.4 to  6.0, lantus shot dropped from 30units to 18.  
the side affect l have is burping for 3 days after taking shot.

I have been taking Ozempic for about 5 months now. NO results what so ever. I'm on the highest dose. It hasn't helped with my cravings or helped reduce my appetite. It's like taking Nothing. A waste of money for me. I stayed on it for a while because my doctor encouraged me to do so. I'm getting off now.

I have been on Ozempic for years, I did lose weight, went from 208 down to 172.  Was on 0.25 for a long time than .50 now on 1.0  I do have itchiness behind my arms, small bumps under skin, only one other person on here mentioned that.  Also bloating, terrible acid reflux and constipation.  But overall, it lowered my A1C and weight.  I am very tired, don't know if that is related to the Ozempic.

I have been on Ozempic now for almost 2 years. I now on the maximumu dose of 2Mg per week. My A1c is at 6.3 and continues to go down. I have lost 25 # and if I quit drinking I would lose more. 
The downside is the Constipation. I will eventually have a large poop, but it is accompanied by dibilitating gut cramps, where I know I have to find a toilet quick. 
The only effective strategy I have found is using a old fashioned enema when I miss a bowel movement for 2 days. All the laxatives just cause worse gut cramps.
I just took my first injection this morning. I felt like I didnât get any of the medicine, but Iâm feeling good just a little more tired. Iâm hoping to lose about 35-40 pounds.

Easy to use excellent results. Surprised at the reduction of alcohol went from a daily user to a drink every couple of months. Simply have lost all desire to drink and this was not expected or intentional. Got to be the medicine no other changes.

I've been on O for 4 weeks now to lower A1C and lose weight that has been impossible to lose having Hashimoto thyroid/auto-immune disease. I have lost 6 lbs so far. Appetite control is somewhat there since I can't eat the portion I used to, but I feel more hungry than usual and need to continue to eat frequent small meals to keep level headed. I have mild constipation the first 3-4 days after the weekly does that gets eased with Miralax once or twice a week, occasional dull headache, muscle tightness has been happening the last week, heartburn is a guarantee if I eat more than my stomach will allow or processed foods, I get mild tremors around my face from time to time. I've taken a trip to urgent care thinking I was having a stroke and facial tremors and it was actually my bodies mental and physical response to having a bs lower than I've experienced in a few years (124). I chose to keep going for another week, but cautiously since I seem to be showing possible signs of severe side effects (working closely with my doctor of course). It works if you can tolerate it and the side effects don't overtake you. I'd say proceed with caution.

Started in january 2023, first few weeks i experienced nausea and constipation. Then severe upper abdominal pain began at about week 4. Pain lasted for approximately 2 weeks. Thought i was going to stop if it continued. Took omeprazole and pain stopped. A1c went from 9.4 to 6.6. Sugars were 130 ish and below. Noticed that benefit each week only lasted about 4 days until ozempic seemed to fail in helping levels to stay low. I also take insulin, and require much less than I had prior to ozempic. Havent lost much weight, but not the reason i am on it. Inspite of my numbers being lowered, i see maybe 4 days of good numbers before the ozempic seems to wane before the next injection, which then takes about a day to begin working. I dont believe the cost of this medicine makes it worth taking because of its waning properties.

In terms of weight loss, this has definitely worked for me. I was 200lbs when I started and after 4 weeks I am now 192lbs. The first few weeks I didn't have any side effects and my appetite was slightly reduced. Having suffered from BED for 15 years, it's been such a relief not to obsess over food at all! I have had no desire to binge eat either. However, as I began week 4, my appetite is now so reduced that I barely eat anything at all. I have to force myself to eat a meal, and even then I feel sick after a few bites. I have found that having a mouthful and waiting 5 minutes helps somewhat, but even so, I have little energy from eating so little. The worst side effect though has to be the burping... I was not prepared for how gross it would be! I also have a very bloated stomach after eating or drinking anything. I'm not sure if the weight loss is worth having to deal with gas, bloating and feeling sick...

If you're looking to lose weight, you will still have to follow an eating plan that's balanced and deliberate.  That being said, Ozempic is making the diet plan manageable and for me, that's a big plus. I am averaging about 1 pound loss per week.  That's just something I couldn't seem to do using the diet plan alone.  I am on week 9 and have just moved up to the 1mg dose.  Side effects have been minimal.

USED FOR WEIGHT:
Used semaglutide one time only (one shot )on my thigh to lose weight, lower glucose levels and lower cholesterol levels. Well it did take some appetite away. I did not feel like doing number 2 at all so I turned to Mr Laxative for help. It did gave me brain fog and I told my self ok I can work with this but then my hair started falling like crazy. People I only I had one shot I was eating healthy. I was glad I stopped snacking candy at night but the side effects are worse. It's been 3 weeks no shots my hair still fall. I hate this med. I don't recommend it. But everyone it different. Take it at own risk. AND I had diarrea after the shot clear from my body. I had to run for my life. Yes people. Many times. 
God Bless!

I've taken my 4th dose.  I haven't had any side effects yet.  I've lost 19 pounds, and will increase the dose to 0.5mg next week.  My appetite has been decreased to the point where I've forgotten to eat a couple of times. I couldn't be happier.

40 y/o female, BMI 29 and prediabetic. I was placed on ozempic as it is impossible for me to lose weight due to an extremely low metabolic rate. 
Iâve been on 0.25 weekly for 4 months. Iâve lost 30 pounds. Purely based on weight loss, I never needed to up the dose. â so that has been great. I inject into the outside of my upper thigh. 
The side effects however, yikes. Even on the lowest dose, they have been no joke for me to the point where I have to stop the medicine. Iâve eaten so little, and even at that level I get explosive diarrhea, severe severe abdominal cramping from both gas and muscle convulsions, vomiting. Itâs like my stomach is constantly tearing itself apart, even if the only thing I ate was 6 saltines. Itâs basically been 4 mos of diarrhea, so I take Imodium and multiple gas x every single day. Iâve taken vitamin b6 and b12 as well as unisom to help with the nausea (same treatment course that helped my morning sickness). 
This med is wild and impacts people so differently. Most everything says .25 doesnât do much, but I am the case study in that not being accurate. But feeling like a fork is twirling around my intestines like spaghetti isnât a way to live. My last dose was 8 days ago and the last thing I ate was a dinner roll and banana 2 days ago and predictably Iâm having horrific stomach rolling pain and diarrhea today. I canât wait for this med to get out of my system.
I'm on day 5 of taking g ozempics. I can't the food I normally love. Ice coffee, donuts, pasta, soda. Make me quesy. So I drinking water and eating healthy. I'm bound to lose weight!

iâm on . 2 now. have lost 2 pounds. but iâve been so nauseous and acid reflux is so bad I canât sleep even with medication. lots of burping and hiccups..now I have no appetite. anyone else experiencing these side effects?? thank you for any helpb
The med made me feel very sick, cramping, nauseous,  bloated and an overall unwell feeling but I was determined to stick with in order to lose the weight. I had very minimal weight loss.

absolutely terrible stomach cramping, diarrhea, and vomiting for hours at a time. The next day would be better, and the day, following, I would have the stomach spasms, diarrhea, and vomiting again, I couldnât get off the medicine, fast enough. Unfortunately, it stays in the system for five weeks! Be very careful if you have IBS-D - this can wreak havoc on your system.

This medicine does work for lowering your A1C but I took it for 7 weeks and had to get off of it as it caused me vision problems and hair loss. Not to mention all the stomach problems you can think of and headaches. Also once I got on the 0.50 dose it called me to have a flush when I would take it where my face and arms would get red.
Don't know what all the hype is about because it had done NOTHING for me.

I want to give Ozempic high ratings but I can't because for me it has been a miracle...a miracle I briefly had and is now gone. In the 3 weeks I have taken it my blood sugars have gone from the mid 300 range to the mid hundreds range and I have lost 8 pounds. I love what it has done for me.
SADLY...after next week I will no longer be able to use it. In March I  was 64 and with my insurance  I  paid $25 a month. In April I am 65 and now have medicare with a  separate prescription insurance.  Now Ozempic will cost me $579 a month and  the word "medicare"  keeps me from  qualifying for a company reduction in cost.
So now I am one of America's elderly who no longer matter. I  shouldn't qualify for a medication that can help me live longer evidently. 
As far as I  am concerned Ozempic, companies like it, and medicare consider elderly throw away citizens!! We are the ones who really  need the savings plan but we are the ones who don't qualify. Good luck to each of you when you become one of us at 65!

My Health Provider Is A Genius! No Side Affects- Its in the Dosage and add B-12 Injection! I am one week in- start at .05 (higher dose) he added the B-12 injection at the same time. I eat small meals- lean protein- veggies stay under 1200 calories- low sugar- just have fruit. Bottom line donât blame the medication ( some people will get sick based on your medical history) most are still eating the same diet that contributed to the initial weight gain.Lifestyle change, you will begin to feel full- not obsess about eating- you will forget to eat. Double chin almost gone- pains leaving. This is life changing for me! First week! Rip the bandaid off- get tired of your current condition- start eating healthy- move 1/2 more everyday- Find a gifted doctor who understands the best way to administer the drug( I will go every Monday) start at higher dose/B-12- Get angry and determined- Good Luck!

The gates of Hell have been unleashed in my gut... I have never been so sick even in my life. I am happy for those that can take this drug and it has worked for them but sorry it hasn't for me. I was looking forward to it. 65 years old and 5'9" and 175lb my A1C is 7.5, not too bad. To be honest until the Dexcom came out it usually ran in the 9 and 10s since I was 30. So here come Ozempic to get me in the 6s. Bad move. After day 2, the thrusting vomiting begun.. so hard it left my stomach in pain.. Eat crackers Ozempic website says, drink soups and lots of water... sure it all come right back out. Called the Doc. got me some meds for that, oh more meds for the meds I'm taking. Then next comes the diarrhea with no end in sight..  So I got some pills for that too.. Now week 2? Do I dare go on? Well so many people have, why can't I? It's only .25. So I did. Big mistake! Everything got worst with the wrath of Ozempic inside me now, I started to get severe headache, fogginess, dizzy and was tired all the time with depression. Depressed 'cause I've been sick so much. So enough is enough.. No more for me. So after loosing 17lbs in 2 weeks mostly from being scared to eat anything and if I did.. well you know. I'm done with this beast.

Just started taking this new med and it's been super easy to handle. The only sucky thing is I got constipated, which I never got before. But I've been chowing down on more fiber and taking some laxatives to deal with it. On the bright side, it's really killed my appetite - I used to pig out like six times a day and still feel famished, but now I'm good with just two small meals. So yeah, this med is totally doing the trick for me! The worst thing is that it's very expensive, but luckily i was able to use a telehealth service (semalean) and get it prescribed that way instead of through my GP

I took one dose ...not for me way to many side effects..headache..dizziness..nausea..acid stomach...liver pain..constipation..
can't sleep...not taking this again...
iâve been ok ozempic for 8 weeks lost nothing. very nauseous and tired. I work out 3 days a week. donât understand why iâm not losing. I only need to lose 18 pds
Every time I take a dosage I am sick for 4 days throwing up.

I was prescribed Ozempic for weight loss...I was barely in the obese category. I helped me lose about 14 lbs. Along w exercise but I have hit a plateau. Trying other means to shake plateau. Biggest negative effect is the day after my weekly injection I have been tired even a little shaky. Usually goes away in 24 to 36 hrs so I have to remember to take at start of weekend otherwise I'm like a zombie at work.

Just started recently i find it easy to take and only side effect so far is constipation, which i never had was always very regular so i use laxatives and high fibre diet to overcome this, find it really suppressed my appetite i am only eating 2 small meals a day now i use to eat 6 a day and still be hungry so it is definitely working for me

I started with the normal dose of .25mg.  It had little effect; I was still quite hungry all the time.  Increased to .5 and started to get bouts of nausea, but nothing to terribly uncomfortable.  It would quickly subside.  Now at 1.0 is started to really feel sick.  Severe vomiting and nausea and diarrhea; left me sick for days and eventually in the doctors office for fear of bad side effects/reaction.  I lost about 10lbs and could probably continue to lose another 10lbs, but vomiting and nausea was just too much for me to handle.  Kept me in bed a lot, and off from work; plus, my libido just disappeared overnight when I began treatment which is way out of the norm for me.  I decided to stop treatment.  Side effects are not worth it.

I have no appetite. When I do eat it's a small amount. I also have no taste buds. Also have had headches/stomach but I Also have chronic migraines and gastroparaesis. But headaches are more frequent. I'm also irritated. My right leg shakes alot or moves alot. It's hard to put up with.

I started taking this medication due to very high cholesterol and being overweight. Within 8 months,  my cholesterol and A1C are perfect and I have lost 130lbs. I went from a size 18 to a size 2!  I am extremely happy and I recommend it.
I do not have side effects my problem is administering the medicine. I feel the liquid running down area injected into. Not sure I am getting the dose I need.

Ozempic has worked so well for me. With a family history of diabetes and continued weight gain I was prescribed Ozempic in August 2022. My starting weight was 237 and now March 2023 Iâve lost 40 lbs. Yes, some mild side effects but ALWAYS due to eating a poor choice of food, in my experience. I read all the reviews before starting and was really worried so thought I would share my experience and how helpful Ozempic has been both in weight loss and insulin resistance. For me, the weight loss has been gradual with some weeks showing nothing but have averaged 3-4 lbs per month. My cravings for sweets and snack foods has diminished although I do eat treats and lean into some mild cravings. I also seem to have lost my desire for red meat?!. Everyone has a different experience but all of my bad side effects were the direct result of eating greasy food/fast food/rich food/etc. Yes, there is some constipation but fibre made a big difference. My rings fit, Iâm 4 sizes smaller, I sleep better, food is fuel not an addiction for me and the journey has been rewarding. I walk daily and try to make good food choices. Hope this help someone ??

Iâve been on ozempic for 5 weeks now. Just moved up to the .5 dose.  Iâm down 26 pounds. However, in those 5 weeks Iâve missed 4 days of work due to extreme vomiting & diarrhea. I take my shots on Saturday. Today is Thursday & I havenât left the house because of the vomiting & diarrhea. Yes Iâve lost weight but itâs probably water & muscle. Not fat. I feel wretched. Iâm happy itâs worked for most people. Apparently not for me. I canât push through the side affects. Iâve tried everything Iâve read & every day is worse than the day before. Itâs just not worth it for me. They are so bad I canât get off the bathroom floor.  Iâm stopping the medication & I pray these side affects go away sooner than later.
The first month was difficult. Nausea, vomiting and extreme stomach pain but the side effects diminished after that. I've lost 60 lbs using ozempic. I'm very satisfied.

On it for 3 weeks now and I am using it for type 2 diabetes. I also have had some weird skin irritation, where there is no rash or apparent Irritation to look at. It feels like when clothes rub on sunburned skin like skin is slightly burning or something has continuously rubbed creating a burning or prickly sensation. This feeling started after the second week on it and it is on the back of my arms, front biceps, legs, and chest. From everything I've read this does not show up as a reaction.

Just took my fourth dose two days ago. Feel full faster but no weight loss at all. Some constipation but Metamucil fixed that. Really sleepy. Fell asleep at a stop sign! I wonder if the weight loss will ever kick in?

I am 59 years old, at a weight that makes it almost impossible to lose weight. I have lost 9 pounds in 18 days, I'm EXTREMELY SATISFIED. The side affects are day of injection, nothing, second day a little nausea, 3rd day, am nausea. After that very tolerable. You get full super fast. That's the best side affect. AMAZING drug!! I highly recommend for people who struggle with weight loss.

Began this medication in September, and while my A1c did drop. I have not lost any weight. I am up to a 1 mg dose. At the beginning, I did have burps that tasted like bad ham, and horrible heartburn, but those have subsided. I also have had some strange skin irritation, where there is no rash or apparent Irritation to look at it, I will get spots that feel burny, and feel like something has rubbed, and rubbed in the same spot. This, too has mostly subsided, but I had it on my hairline and the side of my head, on the outside of one thigh, and the back of one arm , no other real side effects, I exercise regularly and still no weight loss hoping a 2 mg dose will help with that.

I have been a type two diabetic for 20 years. I had been on insulin and metformin to controlled my blood sugar. I hated having to eat when on insulin. I hated having to eat when I wasnât hungry to avoid hypoglycemia. 
My doctor prescribed ozempic. I do have nausea and vomiting, depending upon what I eat. I must eat small meals no fatty foods and little sugar. I have lost 20 pounds in one year. My A1c is good. My fasting blood sugars range from 100 to 120. Overall I will put up with the side effects for the control of my blood sugar and weight. I have fucked with my weight for much of my life. Itâs very nice to finally be the right BMI.

There is no comparison between Mounjaro and Ozempic. Mounjaro is more effective and the pen is ready loaded ready to use. The ozemic pin is a disaster trying to put it together to test it to use it I had product all over my hand so I'm sure I missed at least two to three doses out of that pen and it cost me almost $600 for one month. Extremely disappointed. I am not taking this for weight loss I am taking this to lower my a1c. Frankly the manufacturer needs to reimburse me some money on this because it is such a poor mechanism to use. Let me add that I am a nurse and I know how to use injectables. For a layperson it has to be a disaster.

My endo started me on this 4 months ago and I am type 1. My husband had been reading about the new meds available for type 2 and wanted me to ask if any of them could help with my bs ups and downs. She started me on the Ozempic .25. Immediately, it curbed my appetite. Side effects? Yes, but I have had irritable bowel off and on for over 40 years and and the side effects were similar to that. My dose has gradually increased to 1 mg. I have lost 25 #. but the best part is how my bs has evened out. I am on a pump and cgm so I can see how my numbers are and they have really improved! That, alone, is worth the side effects. Throw in the weight loss and I think this drug is amazing!  I am still on private insurance but will probably switch to Medicare sometime in the future. I am unsure about coverage then. I will keep taking this as long as I can.

I started ozempic in August of 22'. I have since lost 66lbs!. My A1C went from 10.75 to 7.5. I have been able to get off of two other diabetes medications I was on. I feel so much better than I used to. I had the initial stomach issues others have described, but those have gone away completely. I definitely cannot eat what I used to eat but I am happy with that. I am at 2mg right now. This medication was life changing for me.

I have been on Ozempic for 2 weeks now and I have lost 10 lb in the last 6 days. A little bit of back history first I am pre-diabetic and severely obese. I started with trulicity and lost 12 lb in 5 weeks, however I was having severe leg pains and I slept almost 24 hours a day.
 Then I was on victoza which I liked but I was gaining weight and I couldn't get past the lowest dose without feeling sick. I have severe IBS issues and both medications seem to completely eliminate the IBS that I normally experience. However the side effects and the sleeping was too much for me. 
Next I went on Rybelsus while I was waiting for Ozempic to be back in stock at my pharmacy. It is basically the pill version of the Ozempic. When I was finally able to fill Ozempic my doctor told me to take 5 mg because I'd already been Rybelsus however I only started with . 25mg. I had quite a bit of nausea along with IBS symptoms. The second week I took .5mg and I felt okay for the first couple days except for I felt like I had motion sickness. Then suddenly I was running to the bathroom with severe cramping and diarrhea along with vomiting at the same time. I literally could not eat anything for 3 days and like I mentioned I have lost 10 lbs in a week. By day 6 I started to get a little bit hungry but I'm still experiencing pretty bad cramping. The cramping feels like severe bloating which is just so uncomfortable. Seeing the number go down on the scale was exciting and I'm not sure that it's going to be worth all of this sickness that comes along with it or the triggering of my IBS. I have been unable to basically leave my house for days. I think that I will do today's injection as 0.25 mg and then in a couple days inject the other .25mg in hopes to ease some of the symptoms. I've been stuck at the same weight for so long that I'm just really hopeful that this will eventually subside and continue working on the weight loss and lowering my a1c. I can tell you that when I stopped the Rybelsus, I immediately gained weight back and I felt more hungry than I did before I started any of these medications. That is something I worry about, if I end up stopping Ozempic will I gain it all back. For now I just really need to work on the foods that I'm eating and changing my lifestyle and not just relying on the injection. I'm feeling very hopeful and excited at the possibilities of this medication can do for my overall health. Best of luck to everybody that's on it. I hope that you are able to succeed with whatever goal it is that you're reaching for.

I came on here looking for people that have zero side effects and it looks like I'm the only one...WOW I must be the chosen one because I feel nothing, no nausea, no shit cramps, no diarrhea. I feel like I have lost probably 7pounds in the last 3 weeks as I was prescribed this medication for type 2 diabetes. Now maybe the tables will turn once I go up to .5 mg in a couple of weeks but till then absolutely zero side effects folks ;))))

My problem is not with the drug, but with the pen!!!  After about 4 doses, the pen jams and I have to open another box for the pen.  Then, I am behind.  My insurance wants the deductible up front, so I need to pay $2,100 for 2 boxes.  In order for me to get another pen, after it jams, I need to pay another $2,100 even though I don't need the meds as of yet.  No help on this!!!
Effective to control blood sugar compared to other oral medications but hard to deal with side effects of frequent heartburn, acid reflux, occasional nausea and vomit

I suffered from IBS from the removal of a gastric band failure when I was 45 until I was 63.  My weight gain and loss was like most of us...fast loss and more gain over and over.  It is that I am now having a severe episode of IBS cramping about 48hrs after injection but it seems to taper off over a day or two.  I am reducing stress and exercising more to compensate and hope all will go back to normal in a few months.  The self control I have on Ozempic is nothing short of a miracle and impulse eating is way down.  Ozempic has convinced my Neanderthal genes that my body is no longer starving to death just because food is "scarce"

I am obese and pre diabetic. My Doctor recommended this to lower my A1c and lose weight. I had some side effects. Fatigue,  nausea, rash. For the first 5-6 weeks I was feeling fuller longer and lost about 7 pounds. Then it just stopped working as an appetite suppressant/weight loss. While moving up to .50mg I gained the 7 pounds back within 3 weeks. Surprisingly it cured my IBS. Well actually I went from diarrhea all the time to being constipated.  I am not sure which one I prefer.

I'm very happy with Ozempic. It's been about a year now and my A1C went from 11 to 7.8. My labs were all perfect except my sugar still a little higher than where I need to be. Started with .25, then .5 and now I'm at 1 dosage. When I first started I got bad constipation. You don't eat much and I drank a lot less water then u used too which I think was the issue. That subsided. Occasionally I will get diarrhea from taking the meds now, its usually the day after if it happens. I have had those nast Sulphur burps people talk about but not often. Anytime I have stomach upset I use some Pepto and it goes away. I will probably stay at the 1 dose and work on my diet and exercise. BUT I lost about 8 pounds and my appetite is extremely reduced which I'm happy about. Having diabetes you feel hungry all the time because your body doesn't convert the sugar to energy. I can't tolerate metformin, terrible terrible diarrhea so Ozempic is like a miracle drug for me. Highly recommend it.

I use it for weight loss. The first 2 weeks of injections I got waves of nausea for about 24 hrs. and was very tired. By my 3rd week all that resolved and no side effects. After 3 weeks I've lost 11 pounds. It really does reduce your appetite.

Am I the only one here who is gaining weight on this? This is my 6th week, the first 4 weeks , I was on 0.25 and last 2 weeks on 0.5. I did not have any side effects. I do feel full also. But not losing weight. I have actually gained 6.5 lbs in past 6 weeks!

The first time 0.25 it was really bad I feel nÃ¡usea, but then I feel really good, my sleeping hours are normal, I've been taking for 3 months and I am losing weight (not after all the diets and killing me doing exercise would work) I'm taking other med because I couldn't eat anything, barely eating and vomiting and my blood levels are pre diabetic, and still wasn't losing weight.. It makes me feel really good after take it, except nÃ¡usea sometimes, but then I fall asleep and next morning it's normal, I highly recommend not taking for losing just weight and your doctor super recommend it to you... It's expensive and you didn't take it seriously could be damages long-term, I was really scared of taking a shot, but after hours talking with my doc she convinced me, and I am. Really happy, actually my two doctors recommend it...

I have always been fit since getting out of the Marines. As I got older and gained weight, when I went to graduate school, the VA put me on Metformin and finally onto Insulin. Two years ago they started me onto Ozempic at 25mg. and then up to 50mg. Personally, I have not noticed any difference except now that everyone thinks its a miracle diet drug it's there are shortages of it. I suspect it's a fad.

I started ozempic about 6 months ago. I'm a type 2 diabetic and I was addicted to food. I started ozempic at 0.25mg for 4 weeks, then 0.5mg for 4 weeks, and now I'm at 1mg. I've lost 40 pounds and feel great. The only issue I have is nausea twice a day but it is usually because my sugar is low. I do have to watch what I eat (no greasy or fatty foods) and I can't overdue it on the caffeine/liquor or I will throw up. So far I am very happy with ozempic.

Iâm on my second week at .25 MG. So far no side effects outside of feeling full very quickly and having very little appetite.  I lost 3 pounds the first week which is great.  Next week I go to .5mg   I canât wait to see what I look like by summer. Iâm sure my pre-diabetes will be gone by then too.

I started out on 0.25 for 4 weeks. I had no side effects, lost a little weight. My first increase to 0.5 was fine, still no side effects and able to function as a normal person, at this point I was getting close to 30 pounds down. After 4 weeks, I was to increase my dose to 1mg. This is when the problems started...I've had bad reflux even with 40mg prescription Nexium, extremely painful stomach cramps, diarrhea (very bad, daily, about every 20-30 minutes, terribly disgusting sulfur burps, headache, weak/fatigue (likely from the inability to eat and barely drink liquids), if you do eat - you have to force yourself to eat because of the pain, dizzy spells (especially going from sitting to standing), stomach gurgles almost back to back all day, and did I mention how bad the diarrhea is? It's like giving yourself a virus that won't go away. I've taken the 1mg for 2 weeks now and can't tolerate this anymore. My doctor is putting me back down to the 0.5 dose as I had no side effects on that and took it for 4 weeks. However, the half life on this medication is very looooong, which means even though I have taken my 0.5 dose, it'll take a few weeks before anything balances out. My blood sugar levels have been so good it is unheard of. So far, I have lost 40 pounds but not without ridiculous amounts pain, did I mention the back to back diarrhea (don't leave home), and about 13 pounds of my weight loss came from the 1mg because you are so sick you don't want to eat or drink anything. Also, on the 1mg, you might want to just throw out your daily coffee or caffeine intake altogether as it makes it unbearable. Occasionally I will take ibuprofen for the stomach pain and does help (a little). I missed 2-3 days of work since going on the 1mg but thought I actually had a stomach bug until it was daily for the last 2 weeks. I am hopeful that going back to the 0.5 will stable me out. I love my BS numbers, and the weight loss is something I've never been able to accomplish (and haven not been this small since I was in my 20's (currently 38 years old). I'm actually able to fit into WAY smaller clothing and have even enjoyed shopping a little more. I have read in the comments about a lot of people feeling depressed after taking the medication. I have not noticed this, however, I have been on an antidepressant (Lexapro) for years. I could, however, see how this medication could make you depressed if you consistently experience the side effects that I have on the 1mg dose. Fingers crossed that going backwards will return me back to normal. Also, you may want to put 4-5 layers of underpants on when you go to sleep, trust me, to be on the safe side...did I mention diarrhea? If you can tolerate the smaller dose, stick to that, I personally do not recommend going to 1mg (the devil reared his head from the bowels of my stomach). Aside from wishing I never went to the 1mg (and perhaps being malnourished and dehydrated from upping the dose, I would recommend it but only to the level your body can tolerate it otherwise you will have zero quality of life. I functioned just fine with no side effects at 0.5 but still enjoyed the weight loss, 1mg will never happen again!

I had went into delirium, went to ER, BS 2029!!, went into coma, intubated, had NDE, awoke 5 days later. I didn't remember anything but the NDE. 
Was on 60u of Lantus insulin, then 30, started having seizures, then 15, 10, now 5. Was also taking Metformin twice a day.
Bcz my bs and A1C (5.8) are good started Ozempic .25 last week, completely asymptomatic so far.
Just saying...

All started for me being overweight and was told that ozemptic could help me loose some weight. I am going into my 4th dose am for my luck i have not experience any side effect except for yesterday felt a mild stomach ache and well another one would be constipation but took some stool softner and that worked well for me. Great thing of all is i have lost 7 pounds in these past weeks of using ozemptic and will go on till i reach my goal, oh and i am non diabetic nor have A1c.

DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG. I ended up in the hospital with an impacted colon. I could not have a BM for 10 days. Worst pain I have ever experienced. Don't be fooled by their ads. This is very scary stuff. And I only lost 3 pounds, probably because the pain was so bad I couldn't eat.

Started January 28th and been miserable since.  It's been 5 days and very little  change in symptoms.  Right after taking the shot I became nauseous then very quickly started having sour stomach.  Vomiting that night but not since. Nausea is a constant,  head ache for a few days. Now I am having diarrhea.  I have to take something for Nausea.  My first dose was 0.05. I will take my second dose, when due. Hopefully I will get over these symptoms soon.

I originally went to my provider out of desperation, to get help with weight loss. I have tried everything and nothing I did worked. I am a healthy eater and am moderately active. My Dr and I were surprised that my A1C was well above the normal or even pre-diabetic ranges indicating type 2 diabetes.  He started me right on .5 mg of ozempic 3 weeks ago and I have had only one bout of nausea and that was when I over ate. I do notice that my blood glucose levels begin to rise by day 5 a little higher than I would like. The first 4 days are well controlled.  I have lost about 6 pounds so far.

Prescribed for pre diabetes. Diet and exercise were not working. Took my first dose Sat night. Sunday morning had some nausea and diarrhea but not bad. I thought the worst was over. 6 pm Monday violet projectile vomiting, diarrhea and a headache that would spilt anyoneâs head into two. My body would involuntarily shake and every time I threw up my insides would shake and burn. Went to the ER couldnât hold liquids down. Sat for 4 hours and came home because the zofran kicked in and the Ativan helped with the shaking. Took 2 Tylenol PM and slept. Iâve called my endocrinologist and am waiting for a call back. In the meantime Iâm on the BRAT diet and sleeping and Iâm losing a day of work. I will not be trying the second shot.

Awful. Took this for weight loss. Wish I never did. First and only dose .25 - immediately my ears started ringing, but ignored it. Within a couple hours I was fidgety, anxious and had a weird brain wire fog. 2 days later and I am suffering. Heart palpitations, anxiety, I don't feel like myself at all. I'm not too nauseous, it's the brain weird feelings that scare me. I 100% regret taking this and will definitely not do a 2nd dose. I feel like I'm dying and contemplate going to the ER, but there is nothing anyone can do. You have to wait up to 5 weeks for side effects to go away. Don't take this unless you NEED to. I did it for vanity reasons and I regret it. I will stick to the gym and keto and just pray I will go back to normal. Not worth it.

I started Ozempic December 11th, 2022, weighing 165, today is January 20, 2023 , I weigh 148. Total weight loss so far is 17 pounds. Another 23 to go.

After gaining 40 pounds in 16 months, my blood sugar was unstable, I was always aIways sweating, fatigued and could not lose this weight no matter what I tried , which was a first for me. I am 5'6, slim build,  always weighing 118 to 125lbs.

I had tried metformin  but it did help. My Dr suggested Ozempic and mentioned it was not for the faint of heart.

My first .25 injection was in the stomach, the side effects came on strong, the next day, nausea, acid reflux, sulphur burping, throwing up bile, and loose bowels. 

It has not been easy, in terms of side effects but I now inject in my thigh and they are more manageable and have diminished in severity and occurrence.

A bland diet, has been working best, I make smoothies with protein powder, fruit and unsweetened almond milk 3 times a day. 
Meat has been hard to stomach, so has cheese, pasta, or anything heavy.

Grateful this is working!

I started on .25 the normal and I am currently taking the max does of 2ML. I have days when I have explosive diarrhea and some days my eyes sight is not that clear.  On a good note I went from a 13 A1C to 6 A1C.  Iâve also loss a significant amount a weight for my body type.  I went from 156lb to 133lbs, because I donât have an appetite and sometimes the thought of eating makes me nauseous.  Even when I feel hungry I take a few bites and I am full.  I feel low energy most days because I feel that Iâm not getting all the nutrients that my body needs.
lost 24 pounds.  Side effects include vomiting at random times of days, intense diarrhea, upset stomach

I started with 1mg week 1. I had some nausea at first which disappeared. I cut out carbs, had one meal daily around 2 PM every day ate 12 green grapes for breakfast and as a snack at 7 pm, and lost 20 lbs in 3 weeks.
 I went to a friend's for brunch, I didn't eat a lot but I ate differently, resulting in overnight diarrhea. It really works if you change your diet, as you stomach stays full for hours and not minutes. No headache or other issue. 
I was relieved to see that Dairy Queen and Ben and Jerry had not gone out of business due to my absence.
I have lost 20 lbs in three weeks, using Ozempic the with a healthy diet. My BMI was 34 now 31.

I was so excited to start on Ozempic...Started on .25 for 6 weeks, then went to .50.  Its been horrendous. Sulphur burps and gas have kept me awake all night. Feel sick a lot from nausea. Throwing up on occasion. Diarrhea and constipation. Ruining my days because I lay in bed not feeling good. 
Yes This stuff works excellent for curbing your appetite. I only eat like once a day because I'm not hungry at all. Finally after 35 years of battling overeating and food cravings, something finally stopped all that. I felt like I was a normal person. But the side effects are not worth it, because it says only 25% of people kept the weight off. I'm going off of this medication because the side effects. And it also causes pancreatitis, gallbladder issues, gallstones and has a black box warning. Not worth it!

My first time taking the medication it was a on Sun and by Mon evening I had a cluster migraine. And my stomach started running off a week later bad after everything I ate, all of a sudden I'm running to bathroom (The shot's gave me cluster migraines lasted 4 days and I to go get a shot). I've never known I could have IBS; I'ma let my Dr know to check me for that. Overall the shots did work, curbs your appetite.  Yes I stopped taking it because it was giving me migraine every morning.
Had my first dose at noon. Became extremely nauseous around 3pm. Vomiting began at 6pm and continued for 16 hours. No more for me!
Unfortunately I must have gotten every side affect, I was violently ill for a week and it has taken another week to recoupe. This is not for me.

I started Ozempic in August 2022 and I am thrilled to say I have lost 30 pounds. I started with. 05 for four weeks,. 05 for four weeks and 1mg since. No side affects till I started 1mg, with that said I only burp occasionally. First thing in the morning I inject into my leg, have a cup of coffee and water.
I have been intermittent fasting for years and I continue starting to eat at 1:00p.m and stop eating by 9:00p.m. I stay away from deep-fried foods, chips, cookies, cake and most junk food. With that said if I am feeling I want a desert I will take a tiny sliver of cake or pie. I've learned to eat slower as it takes 20 minutes for your stomach to signal your brain you are full. I drink five to eight glasses of water a day and endulge in a glass of red wine or two on the weekend.
Nothing worked for me until Ozempic! 15 more pounds to go....
I hope this has helped.

My may concern, and the side effect is unclear vision. Not only do I become sensitive to light, but my vision also becomes cloudy; I have to squish my eyes to see, which is a new onset since I am on the medication. I want to continue using it, but a vision change is one of the significant side effects. Thus, I have temporarily stopped using it until I discuss it with my doctor.

I am a 43 yo male.  Started Ozempic for weight loss on November 8th after hitting an almost all-time high weight of 236.  I just took my 9th dose this morning and am down 17 lbs.  Its always been hard for me to lose weight without incredible amounts of exercise or near starvation, so i am pleased.

So whats the journey been like?  At the .25 starting dose, all was well till between week 2-3 when i had about 2 1/2 days of aggressive diarrhea (essentially liquid form and almost uncontrollable).  Probably 20 times in that period. (That side effect led me to a blog like this where someone said they found less trouble when taking the shot in the leg vs the stomach.  I had taken the first two in the stomach and immediately switch to the leg for shots 3-9.  I have no idea if it actually helped or if my body just got used to the medicine - but i do know i wont be doing any more shots in the stomach. :))  Thankfully, in the 6 weeks since, ive only had that one time again.  Like some others, with my first ever dose i had no idea if i got any or not.  But alas, it seemed to work out.  After this initial box of .25, i was upgraded to a box of .5.  As the .5 box came to and end, my doctor was going to keep me at .5 for another cycle, but it was impossible to get the medicine at that dose so i successfully urged him to take me to 1.0.  This morning was my third shot of 1.0.  In the last two weeks i have a new symptom, with is mild vertigo.  Usually mostly in the morning after getting up quickly or after consuming sugar.  I can deal with it though, i just try to stay aware of it and what causes it.  Good luck to you all!

I was taking ozempic for a borderline diabetic. In three years time I lost 100 pounds going from 268 down to 164. Iâm very very happy I feel good. I look good Iâm confident and Iâm thankful for ozempic and I completely recommend it for anyone and everyone thank you ozempic.

After 6+ months of use of this my diabetes is controlled and I have lost almost 25 lb which was needed. However the negative side is I have no appetite and catch myself going days without a meal only existing on Boost protein drinks and fruit if I can stomach it and water.
I have actually lost more weight that I intended to and can't seem to make myself eat to pick my weight back up.
The biggest downside to this has been the nausea which is not nearly as bad as it was but I still have to use nausea medication within a week after my injection.
For anyone wanting to use it for weight loss it's a hell of a way to lose it as you definitely won't have an appetite but you also find yourself feeling weak because you haven't ate anything substantial.

Took for insulin resistance  and lost 12 lb but ended up getting severe, debilitating vertigo.  Spoke with 3 other people who had to come off of it because of vertigo but it is not listed as a side effect. Mine was so sever that I  was hospitalized! Vertigo only resolved once I came off of the ozempic.

I am on week 2 , of Ozempic.

I am 5â5, been 118 to 125 , throughout my late teens, 20âs, 30âs and early 40âs. I had a baby at 43, gained 50 lbs and lost it within a month and was back to 120, which I maintained until 15 months ago. I got 2 Covid vaccines, still got Covid and I ended gained 45 lbs in 15 months and my blood sugar , started climbing as well. 

metformin did not work, I have always been a healthy eater, slim and fit but the weight did not budge.

My previous 26 inch waist ballooned to 37 inches , my legs remained slim.

My Dr started me on ozempic Dec 11th.

Took .25 Sunday evening in the abdomen. I woke up the next morning with severe nausea, sulphur burps and diarrhea. I spent the day in bed, kept taking ginger gravol, tums and gas x. obviously zero appetite. 
I was sick for 3 days, then started feeling a little better. No cravings, reduction in hunger. Two days before my 2nd injection, my nausea went away.

Starting weight, 165, end of week, 159.

2nd dose was injected in my thigh, I experienced a little nausea , the next day and I have been feeling back to normal today. wondering if there is more appetite reduction with stomach injection because my appetite is back to normal.

I will try injecting into my arm next week.

After taking this for several months and I have developed debilitating headaches, nausea, light sensitivity, debilitating vertigo, whole-body weakness, a sense of and feel like I am dying, have become bedridden
I am on week 4 of the ,25 dosage and my weight is down to 288 from 305.  The only side effect I noticed was a little constipation in week 1 but my body adjusted.

Week 1, no weight loss, no side effects. I do not crave sweets anymore which is my most fav!  
Week 2 (2nd shot yesterday .25
No side effects. Iâm hoping the weight loss starts soon or Iâll be out of the program.
I have lost 12 lbs in a month but I feel sick all the time.   It doesnât make you feel very good!

I just took my 2nd injection yesterday. Week one was rough with the nausea but I had zofran for that but at times it didnt work. The nausea kicked in like day 4. I lost 7 lbs. My doctor weighed me last Thursday I was 265. I am currently 258. I am not really thinking about sweets like I use to. I dont get up at night for that 4 pack reese cup. When I eat I only eat a little because #1 I'm afraid to overeat and get sick. #2 I just don't have that desire to overeat. I really think it is working for me.

On my 4 th week of .25 injection. Unbelievable how this medicine makes me feel like I can stop eating when Iâve had a normal serving and donât go back for seconds. I snack off and on during the day and have a nutritious meal in the evening. Drink water and take fiber supplements. Try to eat low fat or I get acid reflux. Started at Nov 18 @289.9lbs. I was on Victoza (liraglutide) for 5 years and my DBII numbers stayed healthy for my age.  I remember noticing in the first 2-3 months of taking Liraglutide that my appetite went down and I did loose some weight.  But after that period my old appetite returned and so did my weight (180 +15 lbs).
When the study I was on for liraglutide was over I switched to Ozempic (about a year ago) The A1C numbers actually improved and my weight went down similar to the liraglutide.  However, after 1 year, I still maintain the 10-15 lb drop in weight and my appetite is similar to when I started on the medication!  For me, absolutely no side effects.  A matter of fact my ischemic heart condition seems to have improved too (physically I can do more exercise)  Thus for me, a 76  year old male, I can't say enough good for the medication!

I took this on recommendation of my physician. It screwed my kidneys! I took it for 3 years, my numbers were always in range irregardless, she told me it would help lose weight, hogwash! I changed my diet (to the zone) and lost 60 lbs. I quit taking all my diabetic meds as I felt so good. I weaned my self off this garbage and my doctor said I would gain all my weight back! Nonsense! I have even lost more weight! The whole time I was on this drug I felt it playing with my kidneys. Understand my numbers were never to the point of causing kidney problems and I know thereâs more to it than that. Just my experience!

Oh,Oh,Ozempic â¦ Taking this for type 2 diabetes and it was terrible!!!! 8 weeks in and I am able to eat 1 meal a day with nausea 1 week after my last shot of .50mg . 2 days after the shot sulfur burps and diarrhea. Everything I eat I burp up great feeling. I am not using  Ozempic to take off weight but it sure has done that. I just want to eat like a normal person again and have my life back. I can barely bike 10 miles I am burping most of time. This stuff should not be on the market. Good luck you will need it!!!

I am on Ozempic 10 weeks and I lost 30lbs. I canât believe it. I am at 1mg and having spouts of nausea and vomiting. I also have heartburn but it subsided. I am still learning what I can and cannot eat. If I have too much food it sits in my stomach I wind up throwing up. In the morning I am the most nauseous. Coffee makes me more nauseous. Using for weight loss and it is workingâ¦ 30 lbs in 2 months but i have another 70 to go. Im 62. I can now eat for simple enjoyment and not need to fill up, very freeing. The S/E though are a drag. My initial weight was 237lbs. I am down 65 lbs in 7 months to 173lbs. The medication was so effective that I stayed on .25mg and then .5mg for longer than typical and have been on 1.0mg for 6 weeks. No negative symptoms for me. I've had hypoglycaemic symptoms (low blood sugar) since I was a teenager (I'm 52), but no medical tests would affirm this. Since taking Ozempic these lows are now gone, and I cried because now I finally know what just being hungry feels like. I am paying close attention to hunger cues now as my trigger to eat. I don't eat a lot in a day, but the food tastes better to me than pre-Ozempic. I feel so much better - arthritic knees don't hurt, inconvenience gone, congestion improved. I have gone from a size 20 jeans to a 10. I know my results are not typical, but for me it is an absolute miracle drug.

I was in the pre diabetic range when I started to use this medication. It was given to me for two reasons. One to help me manage my sugars better and to help me lose weight. But personally it did not help me lose weight but it did help me bring my A1C from 6.0 to 5.9. My A1C was at 6.0 before I started Ozempic. I started to use this medication somewhere in July or August of 2021, and had to stop it July of this year because I have gallbladder stones and my doctor said Ozempic is known to cause that. 
Now here is where my worry and question comes in, I question how dependent does your body become on this medication. I say this because I stopped it like I said July of this year and my sugars were ok and my A1C in August was 5.9 but November came and my A1C spiked to 7.2. How and why did this happen in 2 or 3 months? I know I was in prediabetic range but I could probably expected a rise maybe of 6 or 6.1 but 7.2? So now they said I am diabetic. 
So has this happen to anyone else? I also am going to get my gallbladder stones checked and see if I don't need surgery. Thanks Ozempic.

I started three weeks ago, weightloss for overweight but not obese person, mostly to help with arthritis in my knees and for vanity. I also have high cholesterol but has been unaffected by my weight loss or gain (I have weighed from 52kgs up to 70kgs with no chance, also have been vegan for 7 years with no change - so I'm not hopeful here). Relatively easy to use although the syringe system is a bit fussy and having to buy the higher doses as the lower ones are unavailable in my country, and then adjusting the syringe hasn't been simple. First time I took it, in the evening and could not sleep that night, also very badly for the following 5days. Have returned to normal now. Very strong appetite supressant effects the first five days (on 0.25) then fell to relatively normal appetite again, so I was quite stressed. On my second dose, no 'nervous feelings' but the appetite suppressant effect has stronly diminished - I just don't feel like snacking, but can eat otherwise normal meals. Had diarrhea the first couple of days, nothing since. No palpitations, no nausea, no constipation, maybe a little more gas than usual. Have taken my third dose now, same feeling - no side effects but only a minimal appetite suppressant effect, let's say 20% less which is still great, but not as reported by others (not being able to eat fatty foods, not feeling hungry at all). Maybe I should up my dose.

I've been on ozempic since June I was wearing 278 lb and now I'm 210 I'm pleased with the results but the side effects are killing me the stomach pain the throwing up feeling full all the time taste buds change can't sleep at night feeling sick and tired all the time but far as the weight loss I'm pleased with that

This medication WORKS to reduce your appetite. Itâs certainly not immediate, but within 10-14 days you notice a significant reduction in cravings. By the 3rd week, I was having to convince myself to eat. I have been on every medication out there to reduce my appetite (Wellbutrin, phentermine, topiramate, etc), but nothing has helped except Ozempic. The first few doses definitely caused side effects like headache, nausea, general malaise and discomfort. I almost gave up because the side effects were overshadowing the weight loss, but eventually I got accustomed to it. This certainly works so I wouldnât hesitate to try it.

I began my weight lose journey in October. Trying to lose weight for my knee condition and my BMI was high .I read about all of the side effects so i keep my dose at 0.25 and stayed there - I have only lost 8lbs but my gut has shrunk considerably-my diet changed from a lot of bad foods to now enjoying Soups and salads daily -smaller portions and many restaurant items i take home for leftovers .I do get a bit backed up from time to time  but it usually corrects itself in a day -My entire got to for food has changed dramatically-Hard boiled egg for breakfast and canned tuna for lunch .Iâm staying on this at .025 for another 8 weeks and see where it takes me -If nothing else it taught me how to re eat at every meal and iâve gone from 2-3x clothes to xl - 2x ..So we will see where min dose takes me ??

Update from review posted on Sept 20th. It's been approximately 3wks since I last reviewed, and I said I would update as I'm not feeling as enthusiastic. I can't understand why I've been vomiting but I can only think it might be due to the food having a slow-release from the stomach and anything that hasn't had a chance yet to digest, goes bad and therefore you've no choice but to vomit. I've also noticed that my libido is now non-existant. I've read reviews on other websites and it looks like I'm not the only person experiencing this. This isn't listed as an official side effect so maybe the side effects list needs to be updated? As a result of the always feeling ill, I've become house-bound because I no longer have the energy to go for walks and meet up with friends and I know this is very unhealthy. Anyway, I'm going to give myself another week of this and, if things don't improve, I'm going to ask my doctor to reduce the dosage back down to 0.25mg for the foreseeable.

I began taking Ozempic at .25 mg and went up to .50mg. Minimal side effects at .25 mg. When I started .50 mg., I began experiencing lightheadedness, heart racing with palpitations and weakness. Went to the emergency room and the said I had orthostatic hypotension which is when you go from standing to sitting your body drops more than 20 pts. Told me to stop taking Ozempic immediately. Come to find out orthostatic hypertension occurs to 10% of people taking this. Thatâs a pretty high percentage and should be listed openly (not in small print) as a possible side effect. Stopped taking the weekly shot and the bp is back to normal as is the heart rate. If you take it, be aware this could possible happen to you. I did regulated my insulin and lost weight in the 4 months I took it, but itâs not worth it to me to continue this.

I am on my fifth week of using Ozempic. The first four weeks, I was on 0.25mg, and now I'm on 0.5mg. I will increase to 1mg in a couple of weeks and stay on that for the foreseeable. 

I have lost 14.5lbs so far and I am ecstatic about that! I have PCOS and so it's been very difficult for me to lose weight the traditional way but Ozempic makes it so easy for me. I have been feeling quite ill every morning. It starts in the early hours of the morning and lasts right through until about 10am. That's nausea, acid reflux, and an upset tummy. But, I think taking everything into consideration, it's not enough to deter me from continuing to take Ozempic. Seeing the reductions on my scales is enough to make me want to continue. 

To try and reduce the side effects, my doctor advised that I eat as low fat as possible because it's the fat the exacerbates the side effects. She's right because I can see the difference between if I eat really low fat vs. a "normal" meal.

Started June16 with 1/4 unit shot. Felt less craving for food within days. Noticed weight loss a week or so in. Continued weekly for 4 weeks, then went to 1/2 unit. Ongoing weight loss and eating a smaller portion makes hungry feeling go away so less food intake. Switched to 1 unit after 8 weeks. Had "heavy transit" for one day during week 9, then normal again. Also, in the same week, i had a really bad day = feeling very sleepy and skin that was feeling sensitive. Weight loss from day one till Sept 16 = 26 lbs. The weight loss in my case is like a seesaw it will be at a certain weight for 3,4 days or so, then go down a pound, then stay again for 3,4 days then go down again liek a seesaw stock market situation. My blood glucose numbers have dramatically gone down, monitoring with CGM. Following this development, some other diabetes indicators such as pain in hands and feet have disappeared without flare ups. It's been,and hopefully will remain, a positive treatment in my situation.

A few side effects starting with the 0.25 mL dose and, naturally, progressing with the 0.5 and 1.0 mL doses. The side effects (GI upset, fatigue, brain fog) can be devastating. I do believe the manufacturer recommendations regarding timing of step up doses, for most, is optimistic at best. But, here's the thing; there is no set standard, or real medical necessity, for the manufacturers step up dose timing. It is entirely possible to stay at the 0.5 mL dose for longer than a month if needed with no ill effect. My doctor agreed and prescribed me the 1.0 mL dose and recommended very incremental increased dosing. Just because you have a 1.0 mL pen, doesn't mean you have to use the entire 1.0 mL dose. From the 0.5 mL dose, I stepped up to 0.6 mL, then 0.7, 0.8, etc. This absolutely helped manage side effects and allowed a far more realistic adjustment period than the manufacturers recommended jumps of 0.25 to 0.5 to 1.0 mL.

So many serious side effects (January 2022 - September 2022), Headaches, er pain level abdominal pain radiating to back, crazy dreams fatigue and more  After 3 ER visits, Multiple GI and Endo visits not one Identified this drug as a potential problem.   After self research and discussing with my Primary I stopped taking and feel so much better so fast. I would never recommend this drug.

I started on .25 end of June beginning of July went to .5 after 4 weeks I just upped to 1mg todayâ¦ to date Iâve lost 25 pounds in just over 2 months without much effortâ¦I have nausea the day I take my shot and the day afterâ¦ Iâm super happy with the results so far!

I began taking this medication about 4 months ago. I started at the lowest dose of .25mg and then moved up monthly. I'm currently at 1mg and will be moving to 2mg next week. I'm so pleased with this medication. I've lost approximately 35lbs so far. I've been on a strict diet and also go to the gym when I can, as well. But, I attribute most of the loss to this drug because nothing was moving the needle, until I started using it. I have barely no appetite and have to force myself to eat. I never really realized how much my life revolved around food until I didn't depend on it for comfort anymore. The only side effect I have is constipation, which I take stool softeners for. You can't expect to eat large meals with this and feel well. You really have to pretend like you just got bariatric surgery and can only digest small portions and nothing heavy. I feel this is why a lot of people report getting sick with GI issues. They continue to eat like usual. This MUST be a full lifestyle change to be effective and if you can power through some of the side effects and make the necessary healthy changes, you will be so pleasantly surprised. This changed my life for the better and I feel like a new person.

I had no appetite. Wasnât a right fit for me. I donât have weight to lose. Canât have blood pressure dropping and have risk of injury or worse.
Started taking the 0.25 started feeling sick after i had eggs. So i'm going to see what food works best and skip one that don't work.

I have a BMI of 50.5 and am on the border of type II Diabetes.  A1c of 6.2.  I am taking Ozempic as a first line treatment for the impending diabetes and the obesity.  I have other issues related to auto-immune disease such as hidradenitis suppurativa, atopic dermatitis, and IBS.  I also have asthma, elevated cholesterol, and high blood pressure.

The first thing I noticed about taking Ozempic is that my IBS was immediately relieved but I started getting mood swings and irritability.  The effect of 0.25mg wore off within 3 days and I immediately got rebound diarrhea and felt lethargic.  After increasing to 0.5mg per week, the effect lasted 5 to 6 days and then began the IBS rebound and feeling bad.  On 1mg per week, everything seems normal and I only loose control of my appetite on the 6th and 7th days, no other effect noticed.

This medication actually makes me feel normal at a full dose.  I have a bowel movement every 36 to 48 hours and have good control over my eating habits.  The only thing I have a hard time giving up are the grains, especially wheat, that seem to cause a lot of inflammation in my body.  I notice that I feel good when I especially avoid wheat. But sadly, I like bread a lot.

The hardest thing to get over is psychological dependency on eating as a way to find happiness in life and to deal with my emotions.  I am free to enjoy other things now besides eating.  My whole life seemed to revolve around eating and the planning of meals.

My experience seems to be different from others I have read here but I hope this helps.  God bless you all.

Sunday Sept 4. Type II. Average blood sugar was running @ 180-220, weight 328. So I needed to do something to address these issues. Started Ozempic Friday morning. Immediate result was a decided lowering of my blood sugar, which read 149 Saturday Morning, and 128 this (Sunday) morning. Appetite gone. however this morning minor stomach cramps - and unusual number of Bowel movements, - usually 1, this morning 2 and diarrhea, but nothing major. Look, with these kinds of positives, I'ma stick with it through the (for me) minor negatives.
It did take a little while to get past some stomach aches but weâll worth the results. I started in 2020 weighing 230 pounds. Now with the help of ozempic I am down to 168 pounds and feeling great.

So many horrible side effects,  abdominal pain radiating into back, headaches, extreme fatigue, ... You may be one with no side effects, good for you!  If  one has nor taken I suggest the severity of these side effects are not worth the risk

It's a good treatment and looks good. Weight loss good  but not enough meds in the pen to last full month.  At first I thought I messed up becauee I was taking. 50 twice because doc had just upped my dosage.  But 1mg pen only lasted 3 weekd..pretty hard to screw up ..this is second pen to do this. My copay isn't cheap..I can't get discount.  Please help

I have been taking ozempic for about two months. I'm down 40lbs. Appetite is absolutely gone. I am never hungry. I also believe ozempic could be the reason I drink a lot less alcohol than I use to. The day after my .5 injection is still the toughest and I just feel weird for a day or two but then I'm back to normal.

I just finished 8 weeks on Ozempic and about to start week 9 with the 1.0 dose.  I started with .25 dose and lost about 5 pounds without really trying. Increased to .50 after 4 weeks and lost another 5 pounds. Side effect have been minimal.  Mostly troubled by constipation and acid reflux. Nausea not a problem. Not really thirsty so donât think I am drinking enough water.  Will make and effort next 4 week and getting ready to start an exercise plan.  I started at 170 lbs and today I weigh 156 lbs. Overall happy with drug.  Reduces my appetite and has allowed me to effortlessly reduced the amount of food I eat in a day.

I havenât been on Ozempic long, but Iâm not thinking itâs doing anything for me, beside the constipation, headaches, nausea, dizziness, and exhaustion.

Iâve been on it long enough to take 5 once-a-week doses now,  four at 0.25 and one at 0.5. Each week, Iâve had different side effects. The first week, there was mild nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, and exhaustion, Second week brought stronger nausea to the point of vomiting. Doc prescribed something for it, but it didnât really help. Third week, the nausea went away, but there was severe constipation. Fourth week, I had sharp abdominal pains (probably due to the continuing constipation) and some dizziness. Fifth week (upped dose to 0.5), I had the first migraine that Iâve had in years, along with more nausea again, and still with the constipation.

The reason that Iâve stuck it out this long is because the doc and my mom (who has been on this med for a while) told me that the side effects would dissipate and the weight loss would be worth it. I was also told that I would lose interest in eating and I would feel full almost all of the time. Neither has been true for me. I still have the same late-night snacking urges that helped me put on the weight. The only thing that Iâve noticed is that I canât eat as much, because I start feeling nauseous after eating about half of what I used to. The bad thing about that, though, is that I had a sleeve gastrectomy, so I was already eating about half of what a non-sleeved person eats.

I plan to try to stick it out until my next A1c (which was 9.3 at my last appointment), to see if it makes any change there. If it makes enough of.a difference there and I do actually see a dissipation of side effects, then Iâll stay on it. If the A1C doesnât come down significantly, then I donât see a point to the suffering that this medicine is causing me.

I had my first dose yesterday starting with 0.25mg. I read many scary comments here but keeping my fingers crossed and hoping I don't get any of those. 24 hours now, I can feel the hunger but do not have crave for food. I am hoping this will continue till I lose the extra 15 pounds.
