4 weeks at 0.25 dose; a bit of nausea and stomach bloating and acid reflux.  Manage it with pepcid and omeprazole; drink cold water.  YOU MUST EAT HIGH QUALITY PROTEIN AND VEGETABLES.  You will want to eat less, make sure it's proper building blocks.  I lost all sugar cravings! down 10 pounds in 6 weeks. Get your walking or biking in - read the insert!  do the 150 minutes per weeks exercise.  Ozempic works to support changes I have been making, nothing is a miracle cure - but this one helps nudge all your work in the right direction - you will lose weight.  If the nausea gets bad eat a graham cracker, use ginger ale with sugar.  Don't be afraid of foods any longer - just eat better since you will not feel like eating much.  Start tracking your calorie intake - you will be amazed.  If you are not motivated to lose weight then don't use the medication.

I started this med beginning of April 2022 and have lost 40 lbs. Here's the thing. I started on 0.25 mg for 4 weeks. Not realizing it, but I got so sick, I couldn't eat, had to force myself, dizzy, vomiting, diarrhea (which I have IBS, so was used to that) severe stomache pain, nausea. I missed 2 weeks of work, couldn't drive because I was so dizzy, didn't do anything around my house. At the end of 2 weeks, my husband took me to the hospital. My blood pressure was 66/55 (I have high blood pressure, and on meds for it) blood tests showed my kidneys were not happy (Doctors words) they gave me 2 bags of Saline and my blood pressure went up. I was very dehydrated. I went and seen my GI Doctor, she did some tests on me and my white blood cells were high, my potassium low, she actually called it Anorexic. After 5 months I'm happy that I've lost 40 lbs, but all of the symptoms are still there. I've missed way too much work. I have one more dose in my pen for 1.0 mg that I'm not going to take. My doctor has given me the lower dose pen. They suggest not to quit cold turkey so I will do a 0.25 shot tomorrow. But if I'm still feeling this way, I have come to the conclusion it's not worth it. My son gets married on September 10th and I want to enjoy myself. I just hope I don't gain much weight back and these symptoms go way soon.
Well tolerated medication with dose 0.25 4 weeks, then 0.5 4 weeks, then 1 mg till now, perfect levels of blood sugar, 8 months later HbA1c level of 5,6%, lost 25 kg weight.

I take for weight loss. I have other medical issues that make losing weight impossible. Was on Phentermine and lost like 50lbs (220 to 170) but then it stopped working. Over the course of a few months I got back to 198. Started ozempic at .25 doses... did this for 2 weeks...typical side effects (sleepiness, nausea and direahea) stayed at .25 for 2 weeks. As side effects were not that bad I moved to .50 on the 3rd week. Side effects were about the same. Today I'm taking my 3rd dose on .50 (5th over all dose)... I'm down to 170!! Woot woot! 20ish pounds in about a month. I am super happy and hope this continues. 

I am noticing that I'm barely eating.. like I'm technically anorexic based on my calorie intake... I'm just not hungry and if I do eat it's cramps and direahea.... I've also had a few instances lately were I felt something like hypoglycemia shock.. that is scary of course but when this happens I just eat some chocolate or something and I feel better. ?? 

I'm curious if anyone else has similar side effects?

I know those side effects might seem harsh but really I'm feeling pretty normal most of the time and the weight loss makes up for it!

Also my dog said I wouldn't even lose weight in the first 1 to 2 months as this is time for your body to get used to medicine and for the medicine to build up in your system, so I was very surprised to be losing weight immediately. 

I have not change the way I eat or added exercise either.
Started 2 weeks and 2 days ago and Iâve lost 21lbs.  But Iâve also made changes to my diet since being diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.  But Iâm happy with the results.

just started been two weeks at .25 dose. heartburn and acid reflex is my side effect but managed with nexium. I am very disappointed at how the medical field classifies this medication. covered under a drug plan if you are a diabetic but if you are not and medical need to lose the weight for surgery it is not covered. this is super expensive for the amount of months/years that I will be having to take this with no guarantee that this will be successful. I surely hope I am not wasting the $260. a month on this. feel like it will be another kick in the face. Put me back into depression and disappointment.

Pens do not last the full month as stated. Having to take Metamucil for diarrhea then sometimes Iâm constipated for days. I have Medicare part D and have been on ozempic for about 5 months and now Iâve used up all of my prescription money for the year so having to pay full price for all of my medication. My doctor did fill out a form with ozempic and they are going to give me 4 free months thank goodness because I cannot afford it. Iâve only lost 12 pounds since Iâve been on it and get very nauseas after taking it. Itâs working though so Iâm happy. Itâs frustrating though that other insurance companies pat ask but $25 and people on Medicare have to pay a fortune. I still think Medicare, deductibles, prescriptions etc should be free. People never work a day in their lives get free Medicaid we work and still have to pay. Good luck to all of those on it because for me itâs slowly working. I move up to 2mg next week.

As far as blood glucose levels no difference really . As far as weight loss none . Not sure it works at all . Started at .25 the upped to .5 now 1 . I would say this drug works the way advertised for very few people .

Used Ozempic specifically for weight loss. I lost 20 pounds in four weeks tapering from the .25 those to the .5 dose.   Extremely impressed with the results.  Only downside after stopping as I have the sense my thyroid levels have been tweaked or affected and Iâm having it tested.

4 weeks .25 dose on second dose @ .5 mg. A1C is better from 8-9 in morning to 7-7.5. As for weight loss,ZERO pounds!!! I exercise and eat healthy. Why NO weight loss.
Very annoying when will I see the weight loss?

I just went from .25 mg to .5 mg today so I've completed a full two weeks on this medication.  I've lost 5 pounds to date which doesn't feel like very much considering how little I'm eating.  I haven't felt hunger in two weeks and my cravings are significantly less.  I'm hoping that as I go up in dosage that my weight loss will accelerate. I take other medications that increase my blood sugar levels so I'm hoping that this medication will counteract that leading to weight loss.  overall I'm very happy, but hoping for better results with the increased dosage.  I'll post an update as I (hopefully) progress!

I used the .25 for 4 weeks then .5 for 4 weeks, I've been increasingly tired and fatigued as I increase the dosage. My wife has been insisting that I get off of the Ozempic shots. My glucose levels have not decreased since using the Ozempic shots. Ozempic has cost me a lot of money since I had to pay the Medicare Part D deductible.
Lightheadedness.  Diarrhea.  Dehydration.  Nausea.
Lost 20 pounds since may but lost most of my long thick beautiful hair. Not worth it. Very sad.

I'm on week 7 overall, 3rd week on the .5 dose. So far I've lost 6 pounds, which although nice to see...isn't impressing me. I eat very healthily, been vegan for many years and don't eat grains at all (no bread, rice, pasta...none of that.)
I've been lucky to have experienced  few side effects. The doctor's  goal is to get me up to a maintenance dose of 2.4. Hopefully  I begin to see better results by then.

I just gave myself the last .25mg dose. Next week I will move to .5mg. Overall I feel great. My appetite is drastically less. I do not snack between meals and am lucky to get in 2 meals a day. I have been doing some light exercise but nothing dramatic. As of today, I am down 9lbs. I do not have any side effects luckily. I highly recommend this medication to anyone struggling with weight loss or high blood sugar numbers.

Started on 0.25 for 4 weeks with the only side effect of fatigue.. than I was up dosed to 0.5 my taste buds have changed, vomiting and can hardly get out of bed that I am that exhausted.. I cannot stand the smell or sight of food at all.. I was taking trulicity prior to ozempic and comparing them both, trulicty had harsher side effects.. I have another 3 weeks of 0.5mg of ozempic and pray the side effects ease.. 1 cup of coffee and I am struggling to get through that .. will come back for an update in a few weeks time

Ozempic is worse than cholera. 2 weekly 0.25 doses = Liquid diarrhea for 15days and counting + extremely painful cramping & vomiting. 0/10. Make sure your doc knows how -exactly- it is affecting you in real time as there is no antidote. Antihistamines and corticosteroid can help per UCLA Med Center.

After 8 weeks still on .25 MG  stomach pain ,constipation and diarrhea. Have your stools changed consistency? I know that is a weird question  but I haven't had solid stool. Also what is the most weight lost in a month,  I seem to be losing fast which concerns me. I have lost 13 lbs in 2 months. Is this normal

Just started 2 weeks into treatment and I have to say no side effects. I was scared to start and held off due to all the reviews but as far as I am concerned  nothing noticeable.  I am on it to help get past a plateau lost 50 pounds and cannot seem to go any lower. I will update if anything changes but so far so good

I just started taking it 9beginning of July) and after my first dose I started having a heavy period, passing clots.  After week 4 I am still bleeding.  I had to stop taking it as I feel tired and drained.
2nd week of .25 and I Live on the toilet. Diarrhea and cramping. No appetite (which I don't mind) but is it worth it?

I finally found something that stopped the constant desire to eat . I never felt full. Iâm insulin resistant, obese on glycemic chart, always showed high glucose on blood work. Diabetes is hereditary in my family. I did ALL the diets . Started WW at age 12. Lost weight yes slowly plateaus for months and months then Iâd eat and gain back the weight. A friend told me about metabolic clinic through our hospital and she had tremendous success. I was psyched!
I qualified for the rx and my insurance paid for a lot of it but I paid $190. A syringe which lasts 6 weeks.
Painless injection. 
So nauseous like most here. Urge to eat gone. Maybe too gone. I couldnât eat. Was losing weight like crazy and that felt great. My dx prescribed zohran which is a life saver for me.( 4 mg maybe once a day or 5 days out of 7).
After a month I was supposed to go up to .50 but .25 was working and finally I was able to eat a little because not eating isnât the way i
Wanted to go. My doctor said if 2.5 is working stay on it so thatâs what I did itâs been about almost 3 months and Iâve lost 22 pounds I feel great weight wise but the nausea continues here and there. My doctor said to watch the carbs and sugar because that could activate the nausea and when I did that I less nausea but the thing is I really donât want to give up things like watermelon, blueberries and some other fruit. So Iâve been staying on .25 and it still helps me to tell me when Iâm full Iâm still eating a fraction of what I used to eat and the good part other than the weight loss is that my blood pressure medication has been cut in half and then actually then cut in half again so for me thatâs fabulous to have those meds tapered my heart doctor is thrilled with weight loss and sheâs OK with this Way to go to lose weight Iâd to have questioned whether I wanna keep living like this in order to stay sinner or less fat and I donât know how long I can do this itâs a nausea doesnât ever subside . Many days I feel just fine so I really have to probably start watching what Iâm eating to see what the reaction is and Iâm finding that if I eat watermelon at night and I feel fine I donât feel fine the next morning I am so thankful for this medication and somebody finally addressing the fact that we overweight people need some help as well I plan on going back to Weight Watchers only to get the camaraderie and Iâd like to listen to the strategies of a diet plan. sometimes though Iâm so tired I canât exercise itâs weird I have normal days and then days where Iâm just really tired. My doctors are taking blood frequently and keeping eyes on whatâs going on which makes me feel good I donât blame anybody for not being able to continue on this medication because it is a little rough but if itâs not that bad itâs a miracle drug I wish it wasnât so incredibly expensive and The drug manufacturers would stop overcharging us crazy prices if you find that your pen doesnât deliver the correct amount you can contact them which is what I did when my pen didnât give me the correct doses and they actually gave me a coupon for a free pan which was great because it cost me $190 a pen they said they would send me an envelope to get the pan to see whatâs wrong with it but I waited for weeks and they never sent it so I threw out the pen . One thing I donât understand is the pen clearly states that after six doses even if you have more medication left in the pen you must throw it out I donât understand why especially since it cost so much money why thatâs something that you have to do it makes me feel like maybe the company is just trying to get more money out of us and of course thatâs not right.

I've been on Ozempic for 4 months. My doctor tiered the dosage from .25 mg for 4 weeks, then .50 mg for 4 weeks, then increased to 1 MG for the remaining time. I've just gone in for a check up, and increased to the 2 mg dose beginning this week. 
Each dose I experienced some stomach knots, but they resolved after the first day of the adjustment. I did initially have some very mild nauseum but all I needed to do, was take a sip of cold water to take care of it. I stress, the nauseum was very very mild. I do have a bit of constipation, but I balance with stool softeners and strict keto (high fat). 
I've lost 21 pounds to this point and this medication is the first thing that's controlled my appetite. I used to feel hungry all the time but now I don't feel like I need to eat all the time. I don't snack all the time like I used to.
I was doing everything I was supposed to, I was working out and strict keto. But, I was stuck and couldn't lose any more weight. The medical community doesn't treat obesity like a medical condition, they just look at us like we can't control ourselves and we're lazy. 
I'm happy that I haven't had the severe side effects that others have, Ozempic has been a valuable tool in my weight loss journey. I hope to continue on it.
Iâve been taking Ozempic for a few months now & since I moved up to 5 mg/week I havenât had a single pen that has lasted through the full six doses. Has anyone else been shortchanged?

I have been on Ozempic for 6 weeks. I guess I am lucky because the only side effect I have had is maybe tiredness - none of the terrible problems some have reported. I am still on the .5 dose since it is still working for me. My doctor left it up to me to decide if I want to go to 1.0 dose. He told me to just watch carbs and keep them under 100 gm a day. I have had no problem doing that even though I used to be a carb addict. I have lost 20 lbs in the past 6 weeks. I log all my food on an app. I started this for weight loss -- I am a Type 2 diabetic, my A1C is 7.3 when I started. My finger sticks are now in the 90s.

If you don't mind constant nausea, and constipation so bad it causes bleeding hemorrhoids, and constant fatigue so you can't lead a normal life, plus getting sick because you are eating NOTHING and not getting nutrients, then this drug is for YOU! I stopped taking it after 5 weeks. Only lost 5 pounds. Not worth the terrible side effects.

My mother started taking Ozempic for her T2 Diabetes about 2 yrs ago and had a tremendous weight loss as a side effect with little effort, along with an excellent result in her A1C being lowered. I approached my weight loss doctor about the possibility of using Ozempic/Wegovy for weight loss (I have a BMI of 38, 240Lbs at 5' 4"). I have been on it for 4 months now with tremendous results. I have tried many other plans, including every diet imaginable, WW, Gastric Banding, Gastric Bypass, etc, with temporary success. But nothing would ever remove the feeling of being "hungry" and wanting to binge. Ozempic has done the trick. 

Yes, there are side effects that can be uncomfortable. If you are nauseous, ask your doctor for Zofran (an anti-nausea medication that really works). If you have gas, use simethicone 250mg. 

I realize I may need to remain on this for the rest of my life, but that is a small price to pay to reduce the risk of heart disease, diabetes & stroke, which all run in my family. Thank you, Novo-Nordisk!

I have taken Ozempic now for 5 weeks, I just up my dose 3 days ago to .5mg, and the last 2 injections within 48 hours I was waken through the night with the worst cramps in my life, the first time it lasted about 30 minutes and I spent that time on the toilet, and it wasnât prettyâ¦ however this time, which I am still recovering from, started around 4am, and the excruciating pain lasted for an hour or more, too the point I was ready to call an ambulance, I literally thought I was going to die, the pain was so intense that it made me vomit, Iâve never experienced anything like this before. After consulting with my dr a few minutes ago, we have decided I will no longer take this drug, as it is no way to live, even though I have seen some success weight loss wise, but the matter at hand regarding the amount of pain really is just unbearable. I am still laying in my bed, my husband had to take the day off of work to watch the kids, as I am in no way capable of doing so because of the aftermath of what I went through, my body is exhausted, and my stomach is still very sore, and my energy is depleted, I hope others have a more pain free experience, as I would not wish this on my worst enemy.

I have had nothing but nausea, excessive fatigue and heart burn with burping alot. I was only taking .25 and I had to stop it on my 3rd week as I truly felt HORRIBLE on it. Way too many awful side affects for me!

I started at .25 and experienced terrible nausea and vomiting. I increased to .5 and the nausea is worse. I have lost 30 pounds in the short amount of time but not sure if it's worth it. Going back to .25 before I decide to stay on it or not.
I had shortness of breath, literally could not walk! I blame it all on Ozempic but i have chronic Pneumonia!

I began taking .5mg in Feb 2019. A1c has been under control and I lost 30+ lbs. After 3 years, I noticed my numbers being higher and gaining 15 lbs. Increased Ozempic to 1mg and it's lowering my numbers and weight again. I've felt tired and had an upset stomach then I remembered those are side effects of Ozempic which should resolve in 2 or 3 weeks maximum.

I am T2 diabetic and in 2021 my Dr prescribed Ozempic to help shed some weight.  After one month I couldn't cope with the side effects any longer and told my Dr I wasn't taking them.  No weight was lost.  She then prescribed another diabetic drug.  That was in October 2021.  Since then I have had no appetite and when we go out for a lovely meal I get halfway through and cannot eat another bite, not even to force myself.  Breakfast is the only meal I am hungry for and can eat but come lunch and especially dinner I have no motivation or desire to eat or even cook for the family.  I'd love to know how to reverse this situation so I can go back to feeling "normal" again.  All my Dr can say is Oh really, that's no good.

I am now on week 6. I have followed the dosage schedule  0.25mg x 4 weeks  and now 0.5mg. Not one pound lost. Is this normal? Everyone I know on this medication has lost 8-10 klbs by week 6. I am happy that it brought down my HBA1C to a normal level. Has anyone experience no weight loss? Did moving up to 1mg assist?

Update... I am now on the 3rd week at the 1.0mg dose and I have been so very sick ever since I moved up to 1.0mg.
I was due to have my 4th dose two days ago, but am too afraid to take it. I've had no further weight loss, actually gone up a few pounds. Have been so sick, had to call into work and have had such pain and many sleepless nights because I have to stay in the washroom. I wanted this to work so badly, but I am going to give up on Ozempic now, as I cannot tolerate the 1.0mg dose.

I have tried two different times over a period of several weeks to get to 1ml. The sides effects have been horrendous. Ended up in emergency for prolonged vomiting and diarrhea. Lower left quadrant pain as well. Oh I lost weight. But it was not worth the decline in the rest of my health. It has taken me a long time to feel healthy again.

Started taking this medication due to insulin resistance, and I took the .25 mg for 6 weeks before moving up to the .5. Besides the occasional bout of nausea and fatigue when moving up a dose, itâs been fine thus far, apart from my most recent dose change. I took the .5 for 5 weeks, since on the fifth week I didnât have access to the 1 mg pen yet, and I took my first dose of 1 mg just the other day and I have been violently ill since. I just wish there was a .75 mg marking instead of it being strictly a 1 mg pen, because doubling your dose like that really sucks. Iâve gagged countless times, canât stay fully upright for long due to stomach problems, appear to have gastroparesis, and nearly all the contents of my stomach are liquefied, but havenât passed on to the intestines yet. Iâve also had gas pain through the roof and also have burped a lot more than normal, despite me having GERD regardless of the Ozempic. Because of the nausea, that burping nearly makes me throw up every single time. Iâve been stuck in a recliner unable to move because of surgery before, and had a laparoscopic gallbladder removal, but nothing has ever really affected me this bad, apart from COVID-19. Iâm seriously considering going to the emergency room if this doesnât let up. The 1 mg pen also isnât near potent enough; because of the sheer volume of the 1 mg dose, it pooled in the injection site and was extremely uncomfortable. I just wish you could get the same dose while injecting less fluid into yourself.

Help! I have a pen - administered two .25 doses and now on my third one nothing is happening. The .25 isn't going down to zero? Am I doing something wrong or is the pen malfunctioning? It's an expensive malfunction if so!

This is week 11 on Ozempic. I am 65, female, type 2 diabetic. My starting weight was 144, I am now at 136. Starting A1c - 6.5. I started with 2 weeks at .25, followed by 2 weeks at .50, then 4 weeks at 1.0, 2 weeks at 1.5 and now on 2.0 dose. My morning fasting numbers have dropped from the 140âs to the 110âs. I went from taking 2000 mg Metformin and 6.25  mg of Alogliptin daily to just the Ozempic. I have had some minor side effects, loss of appetitive, slight constipation, some fatigue. I have continued my daily walking which I have done for over 12 years and eat anything I want,(within reason as I still watch my carbs). I have found that eating small amounts of food several times a day has kept me from having any nausea and vomiting. I inject into my thighs. I do have occasional minor cramping in my intestines. Ozempic has taken me from the overweight range to the normal weight range and am looking forward to seeing the decrease in my A1c.
I been taking .5 once a week and getting real sick to the point where I can't function. Bad stomach ache and nausea

I started using Ozempic as I was showing symptoms of pre-type 2 diabetes and had elevated blood sugar levels. This medication has changed my life. I have dealt with weight issues due to PCOS since I was a teenager. Ozempic has helped curb my cravings and I have steadily lost 1.5-2 lbs a week. I did have side effects when I started but the ability to turn away food and know when my body was full far outweighs any discomfort. It is an injection which is a little unnerving but the needle is super small. 
I just had my lab work done and all my levels were fine. I have been doing a .5 ml but will be switching to the 1 ml next week. I still exercise everyday and eat right, itâs not a miracle drug, but Ozempic has given me that little extra boost to get my weight loss journey started.

Once on the 1mg dosage became very ill after a couple of months .Really bad stomach problems. First pain in stomach followed by constipation ,then really bad  diarrhea , then later in the  day vomiting. This was going on for nearly 3 weeks. Saw the  diabetic nurse and she agreed for me to stop taking it. Three or four days later felt better ,three weeks later right as rain .I feel this is a dangerous drug after my experience.

Switched from Wegovy due to supply problems making getting the script filled impossible. More side effects with Ozempic for some reason. A lot of belching and passing of incredible amounts of gas (not frequently, but each episode is enormous!). Easy to use.

I am taking this medication to help with weight loss, as I am not diabetic. 
I started with the usual .25 dose for 4 weeks and it didn't do anything in terms of weight loss or for hunger. I felt mild symptoms, mostly just tiredness but nothing too terrible. When I increased the dose to .50, the tiredness increased as well and I felt a little discomfort at times, but again nothing major. I did not lose any weight and it did not help with hunger. I am now on my second week at the 1.0 dose and my hunger is completely gone. I have no cravings for food and I find that I am for needing my tell myself to eat. I started a low calorie diet(Noom) on June 01/22 as well, and I am happy to say that in since then(17days ago) I have lost 13lbs. I think the combination for Ozempic at 1.0 dose and the low cal diet is the magic wand and is working for me. I have bouts of dizziness, still very tired but the lbs are melting off almost effortlessly. I encourage people to give it some time and press on through the ill effects, it gets better and I have much hope that this medication will help me towards my goals in weight loss. Good luck all, hope this helps?? 
I will try to post in the future with updates.
I started Ozempic on June 7, 2022. It is now June 15th and have lost 10 lbs. My 2nd injection was yesterday and I'm noticing a weird taste in my mouth. It isn't bad enough to cause concerns.

I have lost almost 60lbs, started at .25 increased to .50 and then to 1mg.  No real side effects to speak of other than constipation so I take Miralax daily. A1C went from 8.3 to 6.7, Dr. increased me to 2mg and I experienced nausea, so am going back to 1mg as that seems to be my sweet spot. Still steadily losing weight which is a blessing and I eat when I am hungry, but small portions as not real hungry and making better choices.
Started .25 for 2 months. Have been on .5 for 6 months. Started ozempic at 265 current weight 229. Extremely happy with results. Slim fast twice a day and 1 meal
im now up to 1mg on my ozempic and ive pretty much lost my appetite and the weight is just dropping off so easily

For reference, I really work closely with my endocrinologist to take control of my health and here are my results so far.  Just dosed 8th week on Wed.  First four weeks 2.5 now using.5.  Only problems I experienced at .25 was moderate bloat and foul burping.  Did not lose weight or experience any nasty nausea or constipation.  Past four weeks at .50, drastically different effects and results.  So nauseaus, throwing up frequently, like 2-3x per day, bad constipation which leads to more vomiting.  Or if i begin to heat up and start sweating.

I've read enough of these reviews to know what can occur so I'm roughing it out until my follow up next week with my Dr.  I've lost ~15bs these past four weeks.  My blood sugar went low for the first time in my life so I've discontinued Humalog 20 units x2 daily and I'm testing good range glucose-normal for 2 weeks now. Dr also took me off Januvia to start so I'm taking .50 ozempic and Jardiance only now.  Honestly I don't think I can keep this up unless the nausea and tiredness subsides which I hate to think of stopping since it is working.  Just some nasty nausea and constipation, very little appetite. My urination has drastically been reduced, too. I've read where people say that's because the sugar isn't needing to be flushed as frequently frequently and I know I'm not drinking enough water because I'm always full.

I started this medication in early February with typical instructions. Four weeks of 0.25mg followed by four weeks of 0.5mg and 1mg thereafter. It is now early June and I have lost 35 pounds. I am feeling more confident and and am relieved to not see the number on the scale steadily increasing anymore. I highly recommend trying it.

has done nothing after a few months, is a nuisance to use, will likely stop taking this
no weight loss
no reduction of A1C - I have stead 6.5
no side effects

I took my first dose. The day after I had a rash on my back, then stomach, around my eyes are swelling. My legs have a rash and on my upper inner thighs. Wound up in emergency room getting treatment for an allergic reaction!  Very disappointed! It took away my appetite and seemed like it would have worked for weight loss. I donât know about diabetes though, only took one dose and had the awful allergic reaction.

Zero side effects so far. I'm on 1mg a week now. My weight is steadily going down and I have lost 21 pounds with zero effort. I am unable to eat even a quarter of what I used to. Sweets have lost their luster and I have no desire to eat sweets like I used to. I don't obsess over food either. This is a wonder drug.

I have just taken my 12th dose and I am down 35 pounds. Easy to use and minimal side effects. I take vitamins also daily, b13, d3, c, biotin, collegan and fiber chews. I follow my dr direction for food intake. Low carb 50 grams per meal or less and water. Long way to go to reach my goal weight but Ozempic will help me get there :)

Ozempic has stabilised my blood glucose levels and increased my weight loss target to a better health since I commenced using it in conjunction with a healthy portion diet and exercise. Itâs an appetite suppressant as it slows down gastric function. I found constipation can be a side effect and no appetite.

Just started a few days ago. Had a lingering headache, and some constipation. My headache came back today -maybe because I ate a heavy-sugar snack?  As others previously mentioned, I have that "weird" feeling in my tummy. lol, it's not even something you can identify with to be honest, it's just weird. The feeling of not needing to eat is there, the mental part is the difficult part- I KNOW that Nanaimo bar tastes good... do I really want it-- or just recall that it tastes good.. weighing in whether to tackle it or not...yet side tracked in any way takes me away from the memory of good food. So that's good!
Gas-- yes biggest gassy noises ever- glad I can go outside quickly to pass. Needle is not worth mentioning- simple, no pain, just sit on skin, press button, count and release. Simple. 
I do not know of it's effectiveness yet, however I know my daughter lost 16lbs in two weeks. The cost is not covered for me, but it is so important for me to take the weight off my knees that it's worth scrimping for- plus I will buy less goodies! Win-win. I will touch base as my body decides what it's going to do.. Way too many diets, too silly to have surgery and risk my life- this could be a real God-send to so many of us that have been on the yoyo dieting train for too many years to count! Good Luck to all.

I have been using this drug for about a year now.  I had very mild nausea the first week.  No issues since then.  My A1C is now 6.0.  I eat pretty much what I want and I have lost over 50lb.  I might be a rare exception, but I am getting ready to talk to my doctor about reducing the dosage.  I am now losing unwanted weight.  I was 215 lbs and now I am 160.

I started on .25 m  and it was okay.  I went to .5 and I felt really ill and missed far to much work (2 days a week).  I dropped back to .25.  My symptoms were nausea, but also feeling extremely tired, and headaches.  I didn't vomit (phew) but I wasn't able to function effectively.  Dropping back to .25 has helped a lot, but it doesn't bring the sugars down as much as I would like.  I will keep trying to up the dose to .5.  In the meantime I'm sticking with .25.

I am on Ozempic 7 weeks feeling good except for the nausea , I have 16 pounds lost and I am very happy , I used to drink a lot of Coke Zero but I canât handle the taste anymore , , thanks for reading

Absolutely discusted it didn't work for me I tried 0.25 lost 11lbs then was put on 0.50 put on weight made Me very tired kept me awake used the toilet a lot at nite and for â¬150 pm it's a joke made me constipated too didn't supress my appetite so wasn't impressed waste of money at all am going to have gastric sleve

Iâm not going to lie, reading some of these reviews made me very scared to try Ozempic. Iâm so glad I took the plunge!  I have had zero side effects so far ab I just took my 3rd dose of .25. In 14 days I have lost 9.8 pounds and canât wait to loose more!!  I definitely donât eat nearly as much but with diet and a little exercise. Iâm finding Ozempic to be a life saver.

I have been a diabetic2 for 30 years, on the same medication, but doctor advised the meds were being phased out and put me on Ozempic .0.25 for 4 weeks.
I consider myself to me of very high tolerance, but the side effects were horrible, fatigued, nauseous, lightheaded, stomach cramps ,daily diarrhoea no matter what I ate, and just feeling off. My doctor said to persevere, it gets better, and I did just that ,it has now been 14 weeks, and still on 0.25. and I am still no better, not much weight loss, but sugars have lowered somewhat. I havenât been out of the house for weeks. I donât think this medication is for me..
I have lost 60 pounds in 12 months. Now Iâm afraid to stop using it. Any one else stop using and maintained wright?

I have been on this medication for weight loss, let me tell you, I immediately saw a difference in my thoughts of food and my need for food all the time! 

So far Iâve lost about 10lbs, my need for food is way less than it was and I can totally go without food for a while, and when I do eat I only eat a tiny bit then Iâm completely full!

The use of the pen is super easy and I like how it comes with the needles. 

Iâd recommend this to anyone who wants to lose weight as this is the best injection that Iâve come across! 

Very happy with Ozempic!

I was placed on this medication due to type 2 diabetes. Aside from finally having my blood sugars regulated and losing about 10lbs since starting this, i must say the constipation, stomach discomfort and sulfuric belching are terrible.

Besides having a weird tummy feeling, the medicine seems to be working.  I lost two pounds in one week, I'm never really hungry and have much better control over my eating. I don't craze sugar snacks as they tend to make me feel back so i stay away from them.

I have lost 17 pounds in less than 2 months.  This drug has freed me from constant hunger and thinking about food all the time.  I have had some stomach issues but nothing I can't handle.  It helps that I work from home so I don't have to worry about the stomach issues so much.  I was on .25 for 6 weeks - increased to about .33 for the past two weeks instead of going to .5.  The increase definitely made my stomach issue worse but it is better in a day or 2.  As an older woman, I felt it was time to take drastic measures but I prefer not to have any surgery so I tried this instead.  It is a miracle.  Never has losing weight been easy and this was so easy!  It is exactly what I need to take the right road back to healthy.

OMG its a magic drug, ive been on similar and got horrid side effect but this one just makes u full with in minutes of beginning to eat, im learning to only make half the size meal now.. the old me still wants the large. ive lost 7kg(15lbs) in 3 weeks and im not dieting.. im not even trying. sweet food taste too sweet and im happy after a few bites. im only on .5mg as not in a hurry to experience the side effects. soon i hope to be off insulin as well as its working so well.hope it lasts

I had all the side effects, and have not taken an injection for 2 months, and I still have a taste side effect. A numbness in my mouth and tongue. Very unpleasant. Make sure your Dr covers side effects with you, my didn't even thought she said she did in her notes of my visit, I guess that's CYA...

I have a terrible needle phobia but my Husband has done the injections for me and Iâve used numbing cream. Iâve lost 2kg in the first week (on .25mg). Iâve been really lucky and havenât had any side effects. Have zero appetite so have been a bit picky with what I eat but Dr not worried about that. Usually if I donât eat I feel nauseous and have headaches, but havenât experienced that either. Very happy and itâs much cheaper in Australia so feeling positive.

I have mixed reviews on Ozempic. It has made a significant impact on my blood sugar levels and my weight. I have gone from an average of 7.8 to 6.2 and have dropped from 216lbs to 188lbs in a matter of 5 months. Iâm currently taking .5. A disadvantage to being on Ozempic is the nausea, feeling of undigested food in my stomach, surfer burps and irregular bowel movements. Iâve had to lower my dose from .75 to .50 because the side effects outweigh the results of the drug. I am considering fully going off the drug if I continue to feel so terrible.
I lost 20 pounds in 6 weeks and my insulin medication dose dropped from 22 to 8 with better results on blood sugar levels.

Had my first .25 dose last Monday. Noticed a decrease in appetite and fasting numbers are lower. Have not noticed nausea, but definitely a weird feeling in my gut...almost like a minor burning sensation like indigestion. Not experience the constiparion others have shared.tried a piece of oven "fried" chicken! asparagus and brown rice for dinner and couldn't finish it. Just sharing my early  experience more than a review. Will check in after 1 month

I started Ozempic at 285 pounds (I had lost 65 pounds on my own) and newly diagnosed as a Type 2 diabetic with an A1C of 7.2.  Iâm down to 245 pounds and an A1C of 5.3 less than a year later.  I am at 1 mg weekly.  Itâs been such a success that I am going to try it for the weight loss component to see if I can lose the last 45 pounds I want to leave.  Iâm nervous because Iâm going from 1 mg to 2 mg right away.  I remember the bloating diarrhea and cramping from all of the previous increases in dosage.  Iâll post more as I go along!

Im on my 2nd week. 
Have had a horrible time using this dreadful instrument of torture.  Im ised to using a syringe and mixing my own meds for fertility treatments,which had a very logical flow and process.
The instructions for this unholy device are ridiculous anddo not have a logical flow.
I keep treating the pen like my hgh shots,which I mixed and measired myself.   Math ( eg measiring preciselh on one"s own) doesnt lie. This pen thing is a joke.
The instructions are obtuse. I wonder how much the team of engineers was paid to develop this piece of crap.
I took this to lose weight after 6 weeks of using i put on over 1kg so i tossed what i had left.  I had irregular heart beats when taking this.

My glucose levels started going down quite a but after the second week. My side effects were nausea and bloating for a day or 2 .first 2 weeks I took.25 second 2 weeks .5 . I am on my 4th week now. It has been a life changer.  My fasting level has been 5.00 or lower ( I am in canada) and after meals I never go over 8. And for me that's miraculous . I don't have the huge spikes anymore

I am in my second week of using ozempic and still at 0.25 mg dose and the results have been nothing short of miraculous. Itâs like someone turned a switch on in my brain that was accidentally shut off. I now feel full after eating even half a sandwich or a small bowl of oatmeal. I canât actually believe it because itâs so strange to just be able to walk away from food because Iâm full. I donât think Iâve felt this since I was a child. Iâve lost about 7 lbs. I have definitely experienced some vomiting but mostly at night which is similar to what I had from reflux. Definitely had some constipation and the burps are miserable- but again with my weight gain I had terrible reflux so I was sort of used to it- Iâm praying it keeps working because I finally feel like I can have a normal relationship with food.

I was on the trial for Ozempic.   Took one injection at LMC and took the second at my home.  Really back diarrhea and then stomach pains.  Stopped taking the injection because I felt worse than ever.  Two weeks or so later I broke out into a rash and welts all over my body.  Doctors at LMC said it was psoriasis and had nothing to do with the Ozempic.   I am 73 years old.  Psoriasis at my age?  Really?  Then my family doctor referred me to a dermatologis who said not Psoriasis but performed a biopsy to be sure.  Lab came back with not psoriasis and could not rule out Ozempic.   After 72 years of no allergies, I now have an allergy to semiglutide.

I thought once my breakout cleared up after medicating topically for more than 3 months, I actually have a worse reaction to Ozempic.  My Thyroid started failing.  Their list of side effects said Thyroid tumors or cancer.  They didn't say anything about Thyroid slowing down.  I now have to take medication to try and fix my Thyroid. 

What did Ozempic do for me?  It slightly lowered my blood sugar. It gave me an allergy to semiglutide.   Affected my Thyroid Stimulating Hormone and put it higher than it should be which now caused me severe weight loss; muscle loss; fatigue; extreme difficulty climbing stairs.  No strength at all.  Also, the Thyroid issue causes problems with swallowing.  Not just food, but water as well.

This was the worst experience I ever had with a drug.  It looks like I'm going to being paying for it for as long as I live.

ive been on Ozempic for 2 months. i start my 1.0ug dose this week. i have lost 30lbs and dropped my a1c from 5.9 to 5.4. Its been wonderful. I did have some nausea the first week. i do take omneprozole for GERD so im sure that helps. 
Im a mid 40s female who 60lbs in the last several years. ive always ate well, never drank sodas, but the weight started creeping on and nothing helped. This was a game changer. i am so very happy. I dont CRAVE anything. im not hungry. i drink lots of water and juices. i do eat small portions. that would be the worst thing, if i eat too much, oh my tummy hurts!

Iâm 5 ft 8 and starting weight was 256 lbs. Pre diabetic, my Dr prescribed Ozempic. I had 4 weeks of .25 with minimal side effects. Some tiredness, burping and constipation. I increased to .50 last week and within 24-48 hrs was violently throwing up and diarrhea. It lasted for a day then I started to feel better. Through the week I didnât eat much and felt full all day. I am down 15 lbs in 5 weeks. Iâm due to take my next .50 and am a little apprehensive as I donât want a repeat of last week. Iâm going to try injecting in my thigh to see if it reduces side effects.

This medicine is a game changer.  Been diabetic for 11 years.  Been on all the pills and only insulin for the past 6 years.  Up to 80 units/day of Levemir.  Look, the first 3 months on Ozempic is rough.  I've read ALL the reviews and yes, the nausea, bloating, belching, are there but once your body gets used to the drug you WILL be good to go.  This stuff changes the way food passes thru your system and emulates the GLP1 hormone and that's a phenomenal thing!   I am the leanest I've been in 25 years.  Lost 25 lbs which was every bit of my excess fat, the medicine has taken away my urge to eat all the time and when I do I feel full very quickly!  A great thing!  I'm down to 40 units of insulin and when I eat bread or cookies, etc my BS may go as high as 165!  That's it!!!  My A1C went from 7.9 to 6.5

I started this medication 5 weeks ago at a dose of 0.25 this week i moved to 0.50 (I hope I wrote those right) either way its the dose everyone starts with pretty much so im taking as directed.  The first month i didn't see a huge difference and until today I didn't start looking up side effects and reading reviews but the second day after my dose increase I had got to feeling tired and had a stomach ache even threw up but honestly I've not had my thyroid meds witch always makes me more tired feeling and a bit run down. The stomach ache and vomiting is unusual but I didn't link it to the meds because again I hadn't read any reviews or any info at all really,  but by the 4th day after dose increase (today) severe cramping in my stomach and vomiting almost immediately after eating,  burps that smell and taste rotten  i decided to look for some answers,  im not sure about weight loss yet but I haven't even tried to eat again,  im actually scared to so yeah im sure weight-loss would follow so I guess the question is weather or not I can handle this and of course how long it lasts , I know if I can lose weight and keep it off I would like to be able to hang in there but I guess time will tell, I will try to remember to update my progress on here and hopefully help someone with my story but in the end its up to the individual and what weight-loss is to them as in any diet witch is why some work well for certain people and yet not at all for others Good luck to all of u and God  bless
lost 1 kilo in 5 weeks.Might give it another go, but as the med is not subsidized, there's no way I can afford 1mg dosing weekly. Very disappointing.
I've noticed a very strong odor in my urine. Has anyone else notice?
I have been on Ozempic for 10 weeks. They up my dose every 4 weeks. I have lost 25 lbs so far. It also curbs my appetite. I am on it because I have Insulin Resistant-1. I am 36 years old.
I have been taking this for weight loss...in 5 weeks i lost 22 pounds...i have a little reflux sometimes..thats it ...great med

I started this medication on January 16th. I was 287lbs and today I am down to 258 lbs. I have some mild nausea off and on throughout the week but day 5 after injection is terrible. I have extreme nausea and violent vomiting. I can't eat or drink without getting sick. Terrible bowel issues on day 5 too. Then I'm back to normal. Down almost 30 lbs in 3 months so I'm dealing with the side effects. My HgbAIC is perfect now. Went from 9 to 6.2. The side effects from carrying extra weight are harder on my body than the side effects from Ozempic.

I took this for weight loss. Worst medication I have ever taken. Two hours after I took the injection I started vomiting every 15 min. I ended up in ER then hospitalized 3 days later. Please be careful. I learned my lesson and I am going to build a better relationship with myself and my body.

Hate the drug.  My diabetes is controlled avg daily blood sugar 149, 87% in range lost 10lbs no negative side effects.  Problem is No Hunger, can't eat. I Love to eat. One egg a day is not satisfying.

I've been taking it for 2months I haven't lost any weight. I'm 5ft at 185lbs. I wk out every other day.
I do get full faster but no weight loss my clothes still feel the same. I inject at 1mg. Not sure I want to continue.

I started using Ozempic in late January of 2022. I weighed 326lbs at the time. I started with 0.25 dosage, then moved to the 0.5 dosage and am now on my first week of the 1mg dose. I reacted very well to the medication and stay pretty active as well. As of April 13, 2022, Iâm down to 298lbs.Iâm so excited for the future as my doctor has been amazed and excited by my results. A low carb diet really is the difference paired with working out consistently. A good resource is to use the Carb Manager app, it helps to see to gauge how many carbs/fat/sugars you are intaking on a daily basis. The results take time, but keep going and stay encouraged!

I was 214 lbs and pre-diabetic. I have lost down to 188.  Using this along with trying to eat right and walk.  I am not hungry and get full quicker. My doctor actually started me on Wellbutrun and Naltrexone for about a month or so then added Ozempic 0.25.  It does cause bad constipation so I take a stool softener EVERY DAY.  I need to lose 25 more lbs and I will be at my goal.

I just took my 2nd dose a few days ago. I started on the 0.25 mg & 0.5 mg pen, with 0.25 mg dose. It is easy to read, I just move the dial to 0.25 mg. I am to take 0.25 for 1 month, 0.5 for a month and then move to the 1mg dose pen. Because I read hundreds of reviews first, I took it in the leg. I have had minimal side effects, if any. I started over 300 pounds and I am down about 7 pounds. Before taking this I had severe swelling in my legs for over a year that limited how I could move. The swelling in my legs has been gone now for about a week, and I feel so much stronger. I was able to stand on my feet so much easier for activities. I eat smaller portions because I feel fuller. I will keep in touch as I know more or after changing the dose. I am a little bit fatigued, but I was much more fatigued before I started to take it.

I have other complicated health issues that impacted my ability to walk, sleep, breath and resulted in being put on large doses of steriods. The steroids made me insulin resistant. I was on weight gaining medicine prescribed by a couple of my specialist for my other conditions that were helping me walk again and I didn't realize it. So my doc put me on Metformin and Ozempic for three and a half weeks. So my internist doc put me on Metformin for two weeks then added Ozempic.  Had to come off all insulin.  it was in three days of taking this Metformin I lost 3 lb. My doctor recommends .25mg  for the first 4 weeks and then I'll go up .5 mg for another 4 weeks then if needed the 1 mg. Which I think has helped with the manageable symptoms. She has found the combo helps to not need to go to high on the Ozempic. I think the slow dosing is the way to go for me. I am probe to whatever severe side effects are in meds.  But I've only had some nausea bloating, headache, constipation but all mild and tolerable. I take daily probiotics and eat a diet full of  foods that help with digestion like kimchi, cabbage, onions or yogurt etc. I also recommend magnesium supplement on occasion. I also significantly increase my water and got one of those 2.2 L bottles. I realize when I don't drink enough water the constipation occurs.  I have been eating paleo since 2011. So while while trying to lose weight, I've been keep my carbs moderately low like around 70 g and my proteins between 80 and 100; high in good fats. 5'11 and started at 340. I have noticed when I eat I really rich dish and I really have upset stomach afterwards. I had a decrease appetite and full wicked fast immediately after taking Ozempic. I get all my carbs from fruits, nuts and vegetables. If I eats sweets it's not with cane sugar  but paleo and keto kind when I have a craving. I can't tolerate most of the sugar substitutes so I use coconut sugar but don't really have a sweet tooth now. Gluten gives me inflammation. So when I do make a sweet it's usually with a nut flour/butter. So in three weeks I am down to 328 at my last weigh-in. Again I think so and study those wins the race. Changing my diet. Getting my body moving in some way. for me it was just minimal walking. 

I have been successful in loosing weight in the past but nothing was working. This Ozempic and metformin has been amazing for me after almost 1 year in trying to lose weight on my own.

I am a 29 year old female. I am 5â4â tall and starting weight of 230. I started Ozempic on 3/31/22 at the 0.25 dose. I had little to no side effects from my first dose. I felt a little tired and maybe a little bloated but nothing major. I did notice right away I wasnât hungry or craving sweets like before. I was full much faster and that feeling really surprised me as before i felt like I could eat eat forever and never be satisfied. I really like the feeling of being full and not constantly thinking about food. In my first week I have lost down to 226. I just took my 2nd  0.25 dose today 4/6/22 and so far no side effects just hopefull for more weight loss. My A1C is 6.4 and sugar in morning runs 140s. I have seen a slight decrease in morning sugars they are now running in the 130s. I have my follow up in 3 months with my A1C. I am hoping this med is a god send for me. I have been knocking at type 2 diabetes door for about 5 years and I have tried to lose weight on my own and have failed. Iâll update as I continue on my Ozempic journey.

I'm 3.5 weeks in heading towards my 4th injection at the end of the working week. Ive been put on 0.25mg for the time being, we found out i was insulin resistant so my doc wanted me to loose some weight.
Other than a little nausea and some constipation (nothing some raw probiotics can't fix) I feel fine. I do think starting on a lower dose has a huge impact on how severe your symptoms can get.
The scale fluctuates. I can't get a real reading on my weight loss. I'll be down 3 kgs 1 day, then up again in 2 days.
It's definitely helped with portion control. I get fuller much quicker now. Over all water retention has dropped I don't feel so 'puffy'. - my legs, ankles and feet were becoming so swollen for over 3 months - that's stopped now.
Over all I feel great to be honest. Let's hope there will be a little more weigh loss over the next few weeks....

I started ozempic for weight loss in February and I have lost 12 pounds so far.  I have hardly any side effectsâ¦ burps are the only thing I really notice.

I feel full quickly and I have zero cravings.  

Before I always had this uncomfortable feeling in my stomach â¦ and now my stomach is quiet.  It is hard to explain but it is such a great feeling to feel nothing. 

Obviously this medicine may not be great for everyone but it is fantastic for me.

Was on Wegovy for 8 weeks and did great! Insurance wouldn't cover it so my Dr suggested Ozempic, I was very hesitant and didn't want to take it. I amon my 3rd week of Ozempic and have minimal results. Some constipation and minor nausea. Overall, no side effects. I'm not at the same dose that I was on when I was on Wegovy so I haven't seen much results yet - hoping that when I move up in dose, I will start to see results. My eating is minimal, probably 800-1000 calories a day. I don't feel hungry. I have to remind myself to eat and drink a lot of water. I will write a update when I start seeing better results. I do miss the Wegovy!! Hoping my insurance company will put it on the formulary soon so it's covered and I can go back to it. Ozempic is easy to use once you get the hang of the clicks and needle thing.

I wish I would of read these reviews before I started this drug. A couple hours after I took the shot I had extreme nausea and couldnât sleep because of it. I e had nausea for the past 4 days with horrible heart burn and headaches. Just started throwing up tonight. Not worth feeling this miserable! Calling my dr immediately and not taking this drug anymore.

Iâve been on Ozempic for 18 days and am a few days away from injection number four of 0.25mg. In short this drug has been AMAZING. All the negative reviews had me terrified. There were some side effects. The burping, bloating, and nausea are mainly linked to what I chose to eat (and how much of it). Only eat half of what youâre used to.  Even if you still feel hungry, stop eating. In about 5â10 minutes youâll feel super full and if you keep going youâre going to feel so bloated and nauseous. I was an emotional eater, I craved things relentlessly. Now I hardly think about food. It gives you the chance to make good decisions because sweets and fast food just donât sound good. I havenât given up anything I want, I just donât want it.

I have taken ozempic for 10 months and have lost 52lbs. I have not had side effects except for not having a bowel movement but once a week. That is because it slows down digestion which makes you feel full longer... why it works for weight loss. I have found that if I eat poorly, ie: a diet high in fat or carbs, my stomach will feel a little upset. That keeps my diet clean. I started at .5mg and increased to 1mg weekly.

My MD started me on 1mg. It absolutely poisoned me. Horrible acid reflux so badly I came down with Gastroenteritis and Esophogitis. This drug is very dsngerous. Wiped me out for 21 days. I lost 15 pounds but the nausea and gas were beyond description. So bad.Never again . This should come with a major warning label.
I ended up in the ER a few days after taking ozempic and the doctor gave me a diagnosis of colitis. Some of my symptoms were bloody diarrhea, vomiting and nausea;  take at your own risk!

Started at .25 then moved to .5 tiredness , gi , severe anxiety , weight gain , and extreme hunger â¦ it does not work at like oxicontin âbreak through painâ ( fake ) , itâs setup to get you to spend more â¦. The diabetes clinic St Josephâs London Ontario staff offer terrible support . They try to down play everything you tell them â¦ after watching the tv show DopeSick I suppose theyâve been told what to say or Dave legal action from the company that makes it .

Four weeks in and have dropped 6kg. Pretty happy with that. No negative side effects. First injection gave me nausea for a day. That was it. No other problems since. Tried for years to lose weight and no luck. This seems to take away my appetite and I no longer eat such large portion sizes. Will stick with it.

Well I have been taking this medication for about 3 weeks now and Iâve had cramping. A little diarrhea. Lost of appetite which is good and I love it  because I loved food and food loved me. I started at 365 pounds and now Iâm at 348. Iâm impressed and convinced that it works. 
Iâve also been feeling kinda weak at times.

I began taking ozempic in October, by March I had hit my target loss of 4 stone. I did experience side effects, 2 days after each injection I would experience a few hours of diarrhea, I also experienced a couple days being constipated and had one instance of vomiting (when I had increased my dose) and a few days of sulphur burping (again after I had increased my dose). Despite all this I would highly recommend ozempic. I have pcos and have tried many 'diets' over the years and can honestly say this is the most effective thing I have tried. I did not change my diet (I followed the guidance by my supplier to continue eating as normal), the idea of this is to your train your brain to eat smaller portions of your usual meals, so I never ever felt deprived or that I was dieting - ozempic massively reduced my appetite so it has been so easy to adjust to eat smaller portions. The benefits of this has far outweighed the odd couple of days feeling a bit off.

26 years old - 5â2 in height. This drug has been a blessing yet a curse. Over the past 5 months I have lost 30 pounds, which is amazing. 10/10 for the fact that I have been able to achieve this with this medication. The only changes I made were to my diet, no more take out (rarely ate it and when I did I paid the price). Did barely any physical activity to lose the weight.  

I have been struggling to loose the weight and this really gave me the kick start I needed to get on track. Iâm now 25 pounds away from my goal weight. 

Pros: weight loss and feeling so much better about myself 

Cons: donât over eat or youâll pay. Crazy stomach pain, gross burps, vomiting. It was crazy. 


Yes, some times it was really bad. But the goal is to loose the weight and get off it and maintain. 10/10 would recommend to anyone who is obese and their weight is a concern to their health. But you must change your diet to be clean and not over eat or else you will have the worst experience. Eat salads!

Worst drug ever. Side effects were so bad I had to go to the hospital
 Stay away

Iâm on week 4 of easing onto Ozempic and so far great experience! 

Iâve done 0.25mg for 2 weeks, then 0.5mg for 2 weeks. So far Iâve lost about 2kg, but I didnât expect to lose much while I was weaning on. 

Iâve had pretty minimal side effects, just a little nausea & slugishness, kind of like an early pregnancy feeling. But itâs eased as times gone by. 

I inject into my thigh which a lot of people say reduce side effects. 

Itâs interesting because I have always struggled with eating, very much an all or nothing kind of eating disorder. But Ozempic has been able to help me regulate eating at a more appropriate balance. For example I can have a snack sized chocolate bar once a day and be satisfied, in the past if I was on sugar Iâd eat a whole Block of chocolate and thatâs all id want all day. 

I crave healthy foods too like fruit and veg. 

And even on the days where I havenât had great eating I havenât gained any weight. 

Iâm looking forward to getting to full dose next week!

Iâve been using this drug for around 9 months and have lost 2 stones 2 pounds (30 pounds) or (13.6kg)

Iâve been struggling to lose weight for 13 years since having my son. I finally feel in control and no longer obsessing over food and 14 pounds away from my target weight. Iâve had no adverse side effects either.

Stay away from Ozempic. Stay far far away. If you are not taking it for diabetes, and you are only taking it to help lose weight, the most common side effects can make you feel like you are going to die. I took my first dose at .05mg and six hours later I was so nauseous I felt like I had been given a dose of chemo. Five days later Iâm still nauseous, drowsy, constipated and experiencing stomach cramps. Upon closer reading of the package insert I discovered that these side effects can last up to FIVE WEEKS. Thatâs crazy. And the way I feel, they may very well last that long. Think long and hard before you risk taking this very dangerous drug.
I vomit about every other day but only in the morning during breakfast. I start to eat then my stomach rejects the food. I go throw up then finish my breakfast. This is not normal.

Worst drug I have taken besides Invokana as a supplement with Humalog and Tujeo.
Loss of appetite, constant nausea, loss of sleep because of constant gurgling, only eating child portions of food at meals...vomiting. No weight loss. Stay away from this drug. I was on it for 6 months. I did however, get my A1C down and good blood sugar levels...but it was not worth the side effects.
In the beginning I craved water and felt dehydrated, I also went through major heart burn. I have been on it 8 months and have lost 40 lbs.  My A1c is much lower and I feel 100% bettet.
I had severe stomach pain

I have been taking this drug for a few months. I started at .25 then .5 and recently went to 1. I have always had a slight nausea with Ozempic, but on the new dose of 1, I am miserable. This is my 3rd week. The first 2 days are the worst. In addition to nausea, there is a huge bloating, a going back and forth between running to the bathroom all the time, and constipation. There is a reduction in hunger which is great and has caused me to lose some weight. I think dosage is a huge key. I am going to ask my doctor to go back down to .5. Overall, if monitoring the side effects and you can deal with them in the beginning, I think it would work for some people. But I am sick of feeling crummy ;(

Iâve been taking Ozempic for 5 months and I have several side effects which are effecting my daily life. Severe constipation, nausea, stomach pain, gas, belching. I havenât lost any weight. Some days I feel very bloated and other days thinner. Iâve feel unwell the first day I give myself the injection then as the week goes on the side effects get worse then by the next injection day I feel 50% - 85% better.  Iâm disappointed with this medication and Iâm going to talk to my doctor about other options.
Appetite decreased, physical health increased

Luckily I had no side effects beyond several weeks of constipation. 
Has anyone else found they are irritable the day before the next dose, and feel immediately better in mood when they've had their dose?

This drug is the DEVIL. I was taking this drug to counteract the weight gain of Seroquel. I've tried for 4 months to make it work (at the encouragement of my psychiatrist). I've been nauseas the whole time and had vomiting about 3-4 a week. I have currently been vomiting for a week straight, just starting being able to keep liquids down yesterday. THe rest of the four months i could only drink maybe half an ensure and if I had too much more or drank it too quickly I would vomit. My last dose was a week ago and I literally have not eaten anything in a week. I'm done with Ozempic and I've found a new psychiatrist...one that actually listens.

I started Ozempic on 10/1/21.  The first 6 weeks were uncomfortable w increase in heart burn and tiredness.  In addition to the medication, I've walked 4 miles daily no exceptions.  The side effects have gone away and my energy has increased considerably.  I've lost 2.5 pounds per week since starting and my blood work has improved greatly.  I have more energy and feel better than I've felt in years.

I started this medication 6 months ago after I had gained about 50 lbs from medications I was on to treat my chronic pain. I was eating very healthy, exercising and doing everything I could but couldnât lose a pound. My dr suggested Ozempic and I was pretty skeptical at first but decided to give it a try. I was 190 lbs. I started at the 0.25 dose for the first 2 weeks but let me tell you that the day I did my injections I thought I was going to literally die that night. I was up all night with diarrhea, vomiting and severe sweating and abdominal cramping from hell. I decided to stick it out and see if it would get better and it did. I was actually terrified when I had to increase to my 0.5 dose but surprisingly it was much better. Within the first 2 weeks I had dropped 13 lbs.I had no appetite really and found I had to remember to eat at times, I had zero cravings and normally Iâm a chocoholic! I couldnât believe it! I continued to drop weight and at times it would plateau for a few weeks and Iâd be puzzled as to what was going on and then all of a sudden it would drop suddenly again. Iâve been on the 0.5 now for about 5 months and am down 38 lbs. Iâve just recently started experiencing some issues with low blood sugars, shakiness, excessive fatigue, sugar cravings and hunger again so after seeing my dr yesterday heâs suggested dropping back down to the 0.25 to see if it helps. I have found the pens very easy to use. My dr actually suggested I purchase the 2ml pens and taught me how to count the clicks(18 is 0.25 ml) and (36 is 0.50ml) and I just mark it with a sharpie. I have no coverage and this has helped with cost so just a little tip thatâs helped me. Hope this is helpful information. I would highly recommend this medication
Went from 220lbs to 198lbs and stable. Lowered my A1C from 8.4 to 7.2. No side effects that I can say are caused by the drug.

The first week I experienced a real FULL feeling. It was uncomfortable. Maybe I was eating too quickly? The third week after I was taken off of my other prescriptions and solely on Ozempic, I started getting a ringing/buzzing in my ears. The side effects donât state anything like that but found an article that semaglutide can cause medication tinnitus. Has anyone else had this issue or is it just me?
Been taking Olympic for a couple years. Works well. Last shot I got really sick with vomiting and diarrhea that night. 12 hours of this. Lost 7 pounds overnight. Was it a coincidence or the med?

I have type 2 diabetes and started taking ozempic 1 year ago. I started at the .25 dose and over a few months went up to 1 mg dose. At first there were no side effects but lost about a pound a week. After starting the .50 dose I began having major constipation which increased as the doses were increased. I tried many products and tips to ease the constipation but, unfortunately, it began to affect my mental health and decided to go off of the ozempic. My hunger was ravenous when I came off of it and I sadly gained most of my weight back. After a few months I decided to give it another try after my weight loss/diabetic Dr. contacted me with an idea of a drug to help with the constipation. I found it difficult to take because it was an hour before each meal and my work schedule made it very difficult to do so. I am now trying lactulose to try and help. So far, so good. I have lost a few of the pounds I gained back and my hunger is decreased significantly. I do like this product for its positive side effects of weight loss and lowering my A1c levels. I am crossing my fingers that I can stay on it with minimal side effects, as I was able to go off of Metformin and lose significant weight.
Ozempic had no weight loss for me and caused the following side effects: Headaches, Constipation, Major Fatigue, Moodiness, Constant Belching, Pain when Eating even bland foods in small quantities.

My Dr suggested Ozempic about 7 months ago, for obesity.  I had tried everything to lose weight.  I had gained a lot off additional weight during the first few covid lock downs.  My weight 10 months ago was 270 pounds.  I lost the first 30 pounds on my own and then in July, at 240 pounds, started with ozempic.  I've lost at a steady rate of close to 1 pound per week.  I'm now down to 196 pounds.  

I started with .25 and gradually increased dosage.  Amazingly, I almost immediately felt full after a few bites during a meal.  I had never experienced that feeling before.  In the past I could eat endlessly, and not realize it until much later that I was too full.  
I do burp, occasionally constipated  and experience some fatigue.  I also experienced heart burn. I've now become aware that my fatigue is related to my sugar levels dropping to low.  And the rest of the symptoms can be managed by eating less at one sitting.  

With ozempic, the food in my stomach is very slow to digest.  Hence the burping and heart burn.  It stays in your stomach much longer,  helping you feel full longer.  
My Dr warned me that rich, or oily foods could cause upset stomach and diarrhea.   So I was very careful initially with what I ate.  Now, my meals are do small, a few bites of something rich doesn't impact me.  Surprisingly though, I have very little interest in the desserts and snacks that I did in the past.  

I'm so pleased with how this has worked for me!
One word TERRIBLE!! Non-stop Vomiting and constipation. Pushed through 4 weeks of treatment and sickness got worse. I think snake venom may be a better choice. Not worth it.
Ive lost 20 lbs in 50 days i eat less get full faster. But you have to eat properly too watch your sweets and snacks 4-6 small meals a day.

I went on Ozempic to lose some weight.i was on it for 3 months with the normal progression. From the first dosage I had terrible nausea and vomiting. Everything I ate burned my stomach and came right back up. I kept taking for 12 weeks and had to give it up. 2 weeks after stopping, my stomach continues to burn, my nausea is still here, I still vomit and I am severely depressed. I lost 16 lbs. So not worth the experience. I am very concerned with damage it may have caused to my body. I would not recommend this product to anyone.

In the beginning,  I had horrible gas ie burning,  nausea and vomiting,  I have pushed through,  nausea and vomiting have improved,  my blood SUGARS have improved,  mostly below 10(Canadian results) . My endocrinologist told me the side effects would diminish. Also I have lost 5 pounds.

I've been on this med for 4 months now.  The first two months, I noticed no difference at all both in blood sugar number or in weight, but now, am beginning to notice  a slit difference in my weight, about 5 pounds lost, but blood sugar still remains at the same level
I'm not feeling less hungry. Am watching my diet and don't have any side effects on .25mg but it also doesn't seem to be working. Has anyone else experienced that?

I am two days into my first dose.  .25 dose, no side effects.  Glucose numbers not changed much.  When should I expect to notice a difference in my numbers??  Sorry to ask a question but hoped for some insight from users.

I have been taking this for about 7 weeks for obesity . After trying a calorie restricted diet of under 1200 cals for many years that had stopped working despite strict adherence, and daily exercise for 3 hours/8-9 kms walking for nearly a year now that did not result in significant weight loss. 
The first week was rough, in bed with migraine, nausea, heartburn and fatigue the third day. Constant nausea.  The second week I reduced the dose from 20 pen clicks to 17 (less than the starting dose of 0.25) and that reduced the side effects. At 6 weeks on the reduced dose, I still have a lot of burping, mild crampy abdominal pain, heartburn at times managed by Tums, and low grade nausea.
However, my previously constant ravenous hunger that distracted me so much I was actually misdiagnosed with ADHD at one point, is now a more normal hunger at mealtimes. I have not changed my low calorie diet and am still exercising 3+ hours daily. But after a year of no weight loss on that strict regimen, adding Ozempic even at this low dose, has resulted in a steady 1 lb per week loss or more. After 6 weeks, I am down almost 10 lbs and no longer in the obese category. But the miracle is that I am not tortured by hunger 24/7 anymore. My hunger used to wake me up at night, now I can sleep through and wait for a light breakfast. I am going to try going back to the 0.25 dose this week and hope the severe side effects do not return. I wrote this so others who may be more sensitive to the side effects can know that you do not have to start at 0.25 but the pen can deliver a smaller dose with fewer clicks and it still works.

Sick after 4 week, nausea, burbing, chills, stomach cramps, no sleep, runny stools, constipation, hemmroids back, stomach tender, headaches and a rash by week 6.stopping today. Not worth feeling like your better off dead.

I started on 0.25 felt OK went to o. 5 felt really rough never felt like this in my life phoned diabetic clinic who put me on this drug they told me to carry on I went on to 1.0 I never felt so ill in my life I never got any after care from the hospital this made me spiral in to depression now I'm on anti depressants please please don't take this drug its so so bad

So I started on this to lose weight.  Having struggled with my weight dâor zither best part of four decades decided I needed help and this seemed the crutch that could help me.  Started out well.  Some sleep issues and gas but nothing unbearable.  After 18lbs loss in 3 months and 2 progressions from 0.25 to 0.75 I started to experience a really negative side effect:  major hair loss.  I have a big mane and it was coming out from the root in clumps.   I went to see my dermatologist thinking it must be something to do with stress or some allergy and he asked me what I had started doing two to three months ago.   I told him I had started ozempic and he looked it up.  There they were - reviews of others who had experienced severe hair loss.  Nowhere on the box or on ozempicâs site was it mentioned.  So fat and hairy or slim and bald?   That was Sophieâs choice.  I had started to flatline and was feeling strangely âlowâ in mood  anyway so decided to come off it and try the old fashioned boring way, again.   My weight doctor wants to explore other options but I am inclined to forget the miracle aids for now.  I should mention that my dermatologist did say there was a chance that the body would adjust and the hair loss would cease.   Then again, there was a chance it would continue.   Just want to share this as it was a real concern.

At the end of April 2021 my A1C was at 19, I developed neuropathy in my left foot and my doctor and I decided to try ozempic. I was 267 lbs at 5'4" and felt like I would never lose weight or get healthy. Now at the end of October 2021 I'm at 209 lbs and my A1C is at 7.  There is some moderate nausea in the mornings but it's nothing compared to the confidence I'm feeling and the energy I now have. My BMI was at 46, now at 35 and dropping. I would highly recommend ozempic for type 2 diabetes and for weight loss.

I started this medicine eleven months ago. I started a a low dose.25 mg then gradually went up to 1 mg. It has not brought my glucose levels lower then 7 . Iâm always between 7&10 . My a1c is never lower then 7.6 . I have lost a lot of weight from over 200 lbs to now 135.5 lbs . From a size 20 down to 4 . Still losing to much weight. My doctor has now decreased my dose back to .25 mg . Donât get me wrong Iâm feeling okay. But lost to much weight to fast. I pray it is doing damage to my other organs.

My husband has taken 2 doses of this shot, the tiredness and stomach issues, getting constipated. The tiredness is unreal, his depression is terrible. Yes he fills full very quickly, but what good is that if your quality of life is terrible. I want my husband back how he was. Now he's just a unhappy tired grouchy man. No more of Ozempic for him.

I had been on Rebelysus for a month, no problem.  My doctor put me on 1mg of Ozempic, did not tell me of side effects. Started having diarrhea, & burping. This resolved after taking Imodium. Happened again one week later. Now on day 3 of diarrhea, even after Imodium. Going to BR every 30 minutes for watery stool. Have lost 6 pounds this week. My doctor finally told me that fatty food causes this interaction, which I wish I had known. Ozempic clinical trials showed 36% had diarrhea - wish I had known, would never had started. Half life is 1 week, but can stay in your system for 5 weeks. I have missed so much, not worth it!

Ozempic works very well for me without any side effects in the past 3 months. Before starting the medication, I read some reviews that injecting into thighs instead of abdomen prevent side effects, and it was true. I have lost nearly 20 lb with following a health diet and reducing calorie. My fasting blood sugar, which was around 7.5 has dropped significantly, often in the normal range. I anticipate my A1C is dropped to normal range based on my random reading. I feel great and energetic even though that I have reduced my eating. So give this a try but only inject into thighs and it works. I hope Ozempic would be covered with my insurance, but it is not. This is a game changer med, but I hope those side effects seen in animal studies (pancreas and thyroid conditions) would not be developed with long-term use.
INJECT INTO YOUR THIGH!!  My many side effects stopped after I changed injection from my abdomen to my thigh.  Huge difference!   Lots of weight loos too.  I rank Ozempic as a wonder drug.
