Been on ozempic now for five months, three months on full strength ( 1mg ), had no side affects at all from beginning to now, my blood sugar dropped slightly in the beginning,but quickly rose back to what I had before, it is totally useless at controlling my Hunger, and in all that time I lost 1 measley kilo

I was worried about starting Ozempic after hearing reviews and the fact that I have a job that requires me to go to other people's workstations.  I figured severe stomach problems wouldn't be good in that case.  But, I did not have the severe diarrhea that other people are listing (I'm constipated but I was constipated before I started Ozempic, but that is why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars on Ease of Use).  I started on the .25 mg two weeks ago, my morning blood sugar was around 150-160 when I was taking 1000mg ER of metformin, now they are down to 120-130.  I'm thinking they will go down more once I go up to the .5 mg.  I have lost a little weight, but weight wasn't an issue for me to begin with.  I love only having to take one shot a week (which I don't hardly feel at all) as opposed to two big horse pills that I was taking of the Metformin.  I'm not craving sugar anymore either.  I still eat my 3 meals a day but I no longer snack like I use to.  If you are nervous about trying it, I would say to give it a try.  Not everyone is going to have side effects that others have, I know I haven't.

I am 69 year old female, and my doctor just put me on ozempic, to help in lose some weight, and help with blood sugars, as I am facing cancer surgery Sept 14th.  First dose .25 nothing, second dose .25 started with just felling full, going to be doing my third dose Tuesday, of .25, will the dr increase the dosage or do you do it yourself.... I have not lost any weight, staying the same...no major side effects as of yet...hoping it will help with losing some weight...
On Ozempic for 4 days...4 pounds off....236 lb, to 232 lb.  zero hunger, zero side effect.  HAPPY.

I was very nervous about starting this medication due to some reviews I've read on other websites.  I started Ozempic this week due to Metformin no longer working for me.  The shot itself was painless other than a little tenderness after the medicine went in.  I don't have much of an appetite but I don't have the cramping or diarrhea that others are experiencing.  My sugar has already come down some and it's nice not having to take two big horse pills a day, just one shot a week is awesome.  So far this medicine has been a win win for me!

Took .25 for 3 weeks, first week just some gurgling noises.  Second week, severe depression and lethargy in morning, hard to wake up, nausea, breasts got tender, my favorite tea tasted like crap.  I usually intermittent fast, eat "breakfast" at noon, and then dinner.  I got so shaky from hypoglycemia in the afternoons I had to eat more than I usually do.  After the third week, all symptoms elevated even more.  No more for me!  No weight loss.  It did curb the feelings of hunger, but replaced them with nausea.
I have fullness in my upper chest with gas..windering if it goes with this product...seems I get fullness experienced in my esophagus
Difficult to use.  Twisting  to - then seeing if it squirts twist to inject needle that bends easily.  I always wonder to I got the dose.  Why not a quick injection.  Its the the worst.

I started taking Ozempic in July 2020 after many failed attempts with different medications to lower blood sugar. I agree with many of the comments about feeling ill and general upset stomach but I stayed with it in hope of my body adapting. After about 3 months the side effects stopped with the occasional nausea feeling (not often). Happy side effect was the loss of 18 lbs and the bonus was my blood sugar went from 7.7 to 6.2 within 6 months.  The side effects will pass and for me the proof is in the A1A levels dropping to levels I haven't seen in years. A quick poke every Sunday and I'm good.
Started. At 176lbs after first week down to 174 lbs still at .25 have 3 weeks before moving up to .50

This Ozempic made me very, very ill.  I had diarrhea and Gerd for two days after I took it.  I was out of commission for those two days for two weeks in a row I was bedridden and I was sitting on the pot all night long.  It made my stomach feel like it was filled with rocks and I was loathe to eat anything.  I then began having feelings of hopelessness and feelings that life wasn't worth living. I took it for two weeks and I told me doctor I wouldn't take it anymore. It made me feel like an old man and I could not go about my daily activities.  I'm still feeling fatigued but slowly getting back to homeostasis.  This is maybe for people who weigh 300 pounds and have sky high glucose levels.  I weight 160 at 5'8".  I'm good with insulin and diet and exercise. I would not recommend it for anyone.

Iâve been using this med for weightloss for 5 weeks and have lost 18 pounds so far. Iâm 6â tall, female, and was 270 when I started. The only bad thing is I eat so much less calories than I used to that I get fairly tired from not getting the nutrition I need. Still working that out. I donât crave foods, I make healthy decisions because of that and I am way less hungry than I used to be. No side effects other than nausea if I eat too quickly or too much. Some days worse than others. Over all what anyone should realize is weightloss isnât easy with or without a drug to assist. I want to be healthier and feel good in my body more than I care about a little nausea and fatigue. I would recommend this to anyone who has a problem getting into a calorie deficit or has uncontrollable cravings.

This is the worst medicine I've ever taken,  I've got the runs and GERD because of this.  Also I'm weak and fatigued all the time.  I can barely leave the house because I need to be near a toilet.  I was happy and healthy before I started this but now I'm fatigued and I have all kinds of aches and pains. I was walking everyday  but now I'm just house and bed ridden.  I'm not taking it anymore because if I have to live like this life is not worth living. I've missed events I was looking forward to because I was bedridden.  Ozempic makes me feel like I've got rocks in my stomach.  I can't sleep through the night because the GERD is constant and the diarrhea is constant.  I've got gas and I'm burping and farting like a monster. I've got aches and pains I never had before.  This isn't for me.

I started this medicine 5 weeks ago and about week 2 I started having ringing of the ears. Around this time I also did receive my first hearing for the ear that is ringing. So I am not sure if the ringing is from me having hearing lose of if its the medicine. Has anyone else had this issue but wasn't sure if its from the medicine but never said anything?

I have been on the medicine for 10 weeks.  started 2 wks at .25 and maintaining dose of .5.   don't know a1c effect due to not getting blood test til next month, but the overall use of the medicine has been positive.  I was 315lbs, now I am 303.  I find my appetite is not like it used to be.  no cravings, when I eat, after I eat 1/2 my usual portion, I am full.   Digestion is slower. I took a couple wks for the medicine to kick in to get my brain on board with the size of my portions and the first week I ate too much and it gave me the runs, and one day that I totally pigged out on mcdonalds and pizza i had both runs and nausea.  Have not had a recurrence since.  I am not hungry, I eat what I want, although, when I eat too much sugar, my glucose spikes...duh.  It doesn't stop you from making stupid decisions if you make them with smaller portions.   Overall i like how it is helping me with my weight and that can only have a positive affect on my a1c and blood pressure.   I have had to use prune juice a couple times but i am getting used to only 1x/day BM instead of my normal 2 when I ate too much.   I have no other side affects, I feel great, I have more energy and am hopeful that I can lose weight without even trying.  It feels like a miracle.  I have been in the 300's since 2012.  I have tried weight watchers and others but I always felt hungry and so sabotaged my diet or program.  I am so excited to be in the 200's soon.  I have a needle phobia so at first I delayed taking because I was afraid of sticking myself.  I put mine in the flab that is under my arm.  alternating one arm one week and the other the next. just put my arm on table with flab rolled forward and stick it press, hold and done. I don't feel it at all.  i picked arm cuz reviews showed those who use in belly have more GI issues.  could be imaginary, but i figured its easier in my arm anyway and I can do anywhere. I've tried Metformin, I had terrible side effects, I tried Bydureon, devloped nodules at each injection site. My doctor tried me on Ozempic, had a 3 month coupon, lost weight, A1C dropped. I was happy. Now I can't afford it. With insurance, it's over $600!!!

It has been a year ago since I started taking Ozempic. It was the final solution to a never ending problem with my blood sugar. I was already taking Metformin, Gliclazide and Invokana, but no matter how I tried to eat better, exercised, nothing was happening. My blood sugar was still rising. At one point my blood sugar went up to 11 and it has never been that high before. So my G.P. referred me to an Endocrinologist. The first thing he did was order a blood test and review all my medications. Finally, because I was taking the maximum dosage on all the other meds, he asked me to try Ozempic. At first I was hesitant because he explained that I had to inject myself once a week (and I hate needles), but that this was not insulin. He said try this medication or Iâll start you on insulin. I would rather try other medication before submitting to a life of insulin everyday.    He was very candid about the side effects of this medication, 3 to 6 weeks of uncomfortable side effects, but it will all go away eventually. He said if the side effects doesnât go away after 6 weeks, to give him a call and he can change it to something else.  Well, I persevered, but I will be brutally honest to whoever will be reading this review, you will be miserable and sick and wished to God it would end. I had nausea, vomitting, headaches, lightheadedness, diarrhea, and so many other physical discomfort that I kept telling myself it will be all worth it. I was ILL, so ill that at one point I couldnât get out of bed. So if you are willing to risk taking this drug, then make sure to take a leave of absence from your workplace because you will end up calling in sick A LOT! I was fortunate enough to be off work, so all the horrible side effects didnât affect my job.     Ozempic is my saving grace. The journey was not easy, but my results are shown on my blood test and urine test. To date my A1C is 5.2 and Iâve lost 39 lbs.My diet went from CRAP to healthy.
Terrible side effects that wouldnÃ¢??t go away. Had vomiting, constipation, diarrhea.  Never lost weight and blood sugar didnÃ¢??t improve much.  Awful experience.
I have lost over 80 pounds in 8 months. This helped jump start my weight loss. Along with changing my eating habits and exercise habits this has been great for me.

Having read many threads on this forum I havn`t read any from users who also suffer with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) so I thought it might be helpful to share my experience as I have had IBS since my late teens. I am 64 now. I started as most people do with a weekly injection of .25 mg to start my body to get used to Ozempic. I thought at first that I had no side effects. This was not quite correct though as I believed I was experiencing low level IBS which was not unusual for me. However I began to notice this was happening more often than usual. What actually seemed to be happening was that I was not having a direct side effect, but the Ozempic was actually triggering IBS events. This became much more obvious when I moved on to the next dosage level of 0.5 mg. The effects began between 24 and 48 hours and these were high level (severe) IBS events which lasted for 3 - 4 days when I got very severe stomach cramps constant diarrhea with fecal incontinence when sleeping requiring making a nappy out of a bath towel for at least 2 nights. On the 3rd week of the 3rd month the effect happened only hours after the injection. when I started the 4th month I had no IBS reaction, other than a few sulphur burps and this is how it has remained. It was a very unpleasant 3 months but I pushed on because of the promised benefits. Four months on and no unpleasant side effects. The results seem to be very good and I am really pleased that I stayed with it, I was getting near to the point of wondering if all effects were going to be worth it. So my advice if you also have IBS is stay with it as long as you can, for me it was hugely successful in the end, even though it was a very unpleasant road getting there.

I have been off it for 3 weeks now and my appetite is back as is my energy and vitality.  Yes the medication does what it claims but be cautious of the horrific side effects. One thing you have to learn about this medication is you should eat before you're hungry. I realized I could go half a day without eating and not notice it. Then when I was a little too behind on calories, I'd be hungry at night and couldn't sleep because I didn't eat enough. But you don't want to eat in the middle of the night because it can mess up your sleep a lot more because it may or may not cause nausea.

I am taking this with an SSRI because I have depression. So major factors I look for are hydration, mineral (salt/other electrolytes) intake, and quantity to avoid nausea symptoms. It's better to eat four 400 calorie meals or five 300 calorie meals a day to avoid all these aspects, and make sure you get fluids with foods. You will be generally full between 200-300 calories.

Avoid carbonated drinks, alcohol, too much marijuana, and some other drugs that mess with gastric emptying because they could actually be the things causing the side effects. Leafy greens really curb my nausea, I find. If the first day shot is really bad because of work stress or whatever/being too busy, I follow the BRAT diet for a day and a half, and eat my calories the same way. Make sure you get protein, because it's easy to lose muscle. Lower fats and less extremely sweet sugars (or sugars taken in very small bits) help avoid nausea, too, so lean proteins are great for this. Leave the last meal at least 3 hours before bedtime. It took a little nuance to figure this out. I definitely had to quit alcohol at 1 mg.

0.25 did nothing. 0.5 omg! Itâs like my body has become intolerant to ALL junk food! Even just 1 bite of junk food and my stomach is in knots. I now crave fruit and water! Iâve actually become repulsed by junk food and Iâm only on day 2 of 0.5. And in Australia it costs me around $200 for a month. I say definitely go for it. Iâve lost 4 kilos in 4 weeks so far.

This medication works.  I've gone from 184lbs to 155lbs in 19 weeks.  I'm pre-diabetic.  Dieting and exercise never worked for me.  I was miserable in my own skin.  I couldn't lose weight - even after months on a 1000-calorie /day diet. 

My side effects are minimal (occasional nausea) now.  I did have a lot of nausea to start with - but 'morning sickness' home remedies worked. 

The benefits are amazing!  I used to be so out of breath when I'd do anything strenuous - not any more.  I'm comfortable in my own skin again.  My BP is down!  I'm completely satisfied with small portions and have zero cravings. 

If this doesn't work for you - or if you have bad side effects - perhaps Wegovy isn't the right treatment for you.  

Perhaps the side effects are due to another medication you take?
After losing 20 lbs, I was lightheaded and dizzy.  It wasn't the Wegovy - it was because I no longer needed BP medication.      I stopped the BP med and immediately the dizziness was gone. 

I hope my review helps you!

I am one week in and down 3 lbs. I have only been eating chicken, veg and fruit and some crackers. As for negative side effects, once bit of a headache and OTC worked. I'm 46 years old and I was 89kg and I'm 166cm in height. Had appendix out and lost 3kg over that week. 
Started wegovy 13/08/2024. 
Easy to use. I recommend the thigh. Had a bit of a rush, slight headache afterwards.

Taking magnesium as side effects said constipation may happen and magnesium always helps me to go. 
It is Thursday and I have already lost 2.3kg. I'm now 83.7kg. 
I'm so happy and excited and can't wait to get back to 69kg where I've always been prior to having my son who is 2. 
Oh and once I heal, I'll be back in the gym again which I have not been in for awhile. So that will speed up the process. So far so good.
I experienced nearly all physical side effects listed as common but also had neck pain and sinus issues.

Starting taking this med back in February of 2024. Had to stop because insurance stopped paying for it. Now 6 months later I am having tingling in my hands and feet. All blood test are really good and nothing has shown up that has changed. Didn't have any tingling until I took Wegovy.  It's a shame because I lost 35 pounds in just that short time and stayed on the low dose. Tingling is awful.  I wouldn't recommend taking this med.

5 months on Weygovy, and down 35 lbs. started at .25 and worked my up to 1.7.  Have lost a lot of muscle and fat.  Having a hard time keeping my daily protein intake up. Have changed my lifestyle habits, better nutrition, drinking a lot of water.  Have a dry mouth, and get cold, my clues to rehydrate.  Have had nausea, the worst, constipation, manageable, and lack of interest in food, have to remember to eat at least 3 times a day, small, small servings. I am hyper aware of how slow my digestive system is working.  Most side effects lesson with a couple of days of shots.  On the plus side, I genuinely feel better, more agile, and down 2 sizes.  My taste buds changed and I donât like bland food any more, whereas before I wouldnât touch anything spicy.  I do have fatigue and this can also be from the extreme heat we are experiencing.  My dr is pleased, my blood tests(kidney) are fine.  My blood pressure is lower.  My regular blood pressure is 110/70, and now itâs 90/55-60.  That was scary, turned out to be normal.  Fluids are doubly important now to keep my blood pressure up.  At the end of the day, the results for me outweigh the side effects.  I donât know that Iâll go up to 2.4, maintenance for me might just be the 1.7.  Whatever hormone Weygovy is simulating has proven to me that I donât have it in my DNA.

My dosage may have been too high. I have been very sick with fatigue,  nausea and a horribe headache for 3 days after my first injection.  I wonder never take this medication again. My provider started me at a very low dose, .20, w/ slow gradual increases. I was supposed to go to .68 13 days ago, but decided to bump up to only .60 to save money. I have been on wegovy for one year now. Lost 75 lbs so far. No longer eat whites. (Bread,rice,potatoes) am on the highest dose still because the other doses are hard to get. Only get nausea and stomach pain when I eat more than I should.

Taking Wegovy for 4 months.  28 lbs. down.  I have had no side effects.  I check in with a doctor every 30 days for a check up online.  I follow exactly what she says: eat more protein drink water and eat.  When I am not hungry in the morning I go for a no sugar yogurt or an Atkins Plus protein shake.  I eat my heaviest meal at lunch now and very light dinner.  I drink lots of water.  If find Wegovy curbs my hunger and stops me from mindless eating.  I focus less on food.  I am finding it easier to stay on track and work on making better habits.  I also use the Wegovy website and have a free coach that chats with me every 2 weeks on my habits.  I think I am losing weight this time because I decided to get help from my doctor and the drug is helping me to pay attention to what I am putting in my mouth.  I will continue to take it till I reach my goals and maybe a little beyond that to wean myself off.  I have about 60 more lbs. to lose and feel I will reach my goal for the first time in 30 years (time I have been holding on to the extra weight).

I have been receiving semiglutide injections weekly from a provider that works with a local compounding pharmacy. These injections definitely have pros and cons. I have to take anti-nausea medication at least once a day to be able to tolerate any of the doses, and take it more frequently the couple days following my injection. I would not be able to get the injections without that. I never feel great or normal, but it is usually tolerable. I have definitely had a decreased appetite (which is the obvious goal) but can also be difficult, since most of the time nothing is appealing to eat and you can start to feel more sick from not eating enough. I have personally had a difficult time drinking water as it has become more unappealing as well. So I have to really push it. My acid reflux is a little worse and my stomach often feels tender. I go back and forth between constipation and diarrhea. I had a couple days of frequent sulfur burps. 
I haven't lost a lot of weight as far as the scale is concerned but have definitely gone down inches and my clothes fit more loosely. I am learning that a lot of other people have been having that same experience. That part of it can be confusing and discouraging at times, but you have to remind yourself you are actually losing weight. I think that side effect is actually somewhat common, but I don't think there are really any answers yet as to why, and that it isn't really a well known aspect outside of those of us experiencing that. Part of it may be due to constipation/fewer bowel movements, slower digestion and bloating.
While it has come with a lot of challenges for sure, I still feel it is tolerable enough for me to continue for now.

Only got to 0.5mg dose and whilst I did lose 4 kg in 7 weeks the side effects were horrendous. Nausea, heartburn and constipation I could almost deal with but had serious exacerbation of severity, intensity and frequency of migraines and had to discontinue. Also increase in stress and anxiety which was observed by my partner. As a health care practitioner I do have some concerns re the online availability of this medication.

I first started on a medication called Saxenda in August of 2022, that worked /ok/ but in December of 2022 I switched to Wegovy, was way more effective in my opinion. In August of 2022 I started at 435 lbs and now im at 289 lbs with minimal side effects. I will mention it cut my ability to eat food to literally a 1/4 of what I used to be able to eat.
horrible stomach, gastric issues, seeing doctors to help me, this is horrible and should be outlawed

I just finished my second tier dose of wegovy. So .5mg. So in those two months Iâve lost 20 pounds total! 8 this first month, and 12 the second. Iâm going up to the next dose (1mg) this week so Iâm excited to see the scale continue to go down. I do stick to the diet they recommended for the most part and I exercise 4-6 times a week doing cardio for at least 30 minutes. The only side effect that I have predominately experience is nausea. But because of this Iâve quit smoking cigarettes and drinking alcohol which is a huge plus. I canât even think about either without wanting to gag lol. I did have a really painful and intense menstrual cycle last month which can be a result of rapid weight loss. But Iâm willing to deal with it! So far Iâve had an amazing experience and looking forward to what happened next!

I am 53 years young and post-menopausal due to surgery (7 years ago) with high blood pressure and cholesterol. My weight has exponentially increased over time. I started Wegovy in March 2023 at 200lbs. Followed the recommended titration, slowly.  I started .25 and then stayed on .5 for two months. I lost 16 pounds in 3 months and was feeling amazing!! Yes, some acid reflux and then slight nausea on dose day but not worse than after a night out of drinking and eating greasy foods!  

Then, the "supply issue happened".  It was extremely difficult to locate the 1mg dose and my PCP refused to prescribe the 1.7mg. Most pharmacies I contacted didnt even want to discuss supply and I became frustrated. I tried intermittently to locate 1mg to no avail. I then gained back 8 pounds (but not the 16!). 

I FINALLY found the 1mg dose 2 weeks ago. My pcp recommended I return to .25mg due to possible GI issues but I went for it and took the 1mg as I had minimal to no side effects from the other two doses. Unfortunately, I ate a pretty big meal that evening and then took the 1mg injection. I was sooooo sick all night long, pressure on my stomach and nausea all night. And you cant 'undo' the injection once it's administered. I decided to stop fighting the nausea and vomited the next morning, which made me feel so much better. I was very nauseas for a few days and am happy to say that I am back on track with weight loss with no side effects after my injections (3 so far). Ive lost 6lbs in the past three weeks. 

Due to the lack of appetite, I am making sure my body is getting enough vitamins and minerals by taking supplements and forcing myself to eat things like oatmeal, vegetables etc.  I have a company in my town that will do my labs for a reasonable price which for me is important for holistic wellness (insurance is finicky). I am feeling great and enjoying the idea that my blood pressure and cholesterol issues may reduce as I continue my weight loss journey.

I started taking it in May of 2023 - six months ago.  I am still nauseated, with heartburn and very bad constipation. I have only lost 20 pounds so far. I exercise and eat very little, and slowly. No fatty or spicy foods. I've followed all the recommendations for nausea, etc. to no avail. Now it is making me feel faint and dizzy, so I have to stop. I was hoping that with Hashimoto's I would have more success than this. I am fortunate - Express Scripts insurance pays all but $45 of this.  At least it didn't make my hair fall out!! :)

I am 40 years old, and am in surgical menopause. After years of struggling to lose weight, I started wegovy. I have been on it since the start of April 2023 and have successfully lost roughly 1 lb. per week. I combined this with 3 days/week of exercise and calorie control (the medicine does the portion control for you!). The first few weeks I had side effects, but now I only notice not being hungry the day I take the shot. If  I eat something fried (chicken wings, mozz sticks) or greasy, my body reminds me that I shouldn't be eating it and i feel sick (or wake up mltiple times in the night for the restroom)...but honestly, that is not a bad reminder to stay away from those fat/calorie dense foods.

I have lost 30 lbs and am staying on the 2.4mg dose for maintenance. It truly helps!!

So I just started 1.7mg. Down 20lbs from my start weight. I definitely can't eat like I used to or portion size!
Although I do have nausea and heartburn it's not a deal breaker. The oddest and most surprising side effect is I've lost all taste for alcohol. I love my wine and some would say I drank to often.. but I love that I don't miss it! If everyone experiences this it may have yet another off label use!

been on Wyegovy since March 2023 - have lost 43 pounds to date.  Started at the .25 dosage/weekly and got to the 2.4 dosage... couldn't handle that dosage, severe cramping, severe constipation and nausea..  Back down to the 1.7 dosage every other week.  Nausea and constipation are the worst side effects for 2-3 days after injection, but it's tolerable.  The shots do change your taste buds and minimize cravings.  Overall, happy with the other week injections of 1.7 dosage.  Hoping to lose an additional 15 pounds to get to goal weight.

I just completed my first month on wegovy .25mg dosage. The last two injections were when I really started to notice symptoms like nausea and heartburn. These symptoms are mild and donât bother me. Without exercise and mild dieting I lost 12 pounds the first month. Iâve just started the .5 dosage today and am now adding gym 5 times a week and committing to a stricter diet so Iâm hoping by end of month two Iâm down 30 pounds total. With the pace Iâve been going itâs definitely possible! I do expect the side effects to get worse with this next dosage but my doctor prescribed me anti heartburn and anti nausea medication to help. Clothes are already fitting different and my mood is improved greatly. Iâm happy with my experience so far.

The pen is difficult to inject.  My first two injections the medicine leaked out.  I know have to inject into my thigh and apply a lot of pressure to the pen.  I do count to 20 after the plunger stops.

I was excited to try Wegovy to losing weight.
The first one was .25mg. I took it for one month, then I started taking. 1mg. At the second week of wegovy .1mg I was suicidal.
To bad I had to stop talking it.

The needle doesn't enter the skin, medicine is wasted.  Have to basically stab yourself with the injector for it to fully deploy and not lock the head immediately.  Once head is locked you cannot push down more to get penetration.  I have lost 2 weeks of medicine and instead of just providing a screw up cap that allows easy injections I have will go back into side effects of not having meds.

Back in 5/2022, I met with my PCP, discouraged at how much weight I had gained with no motivation to help myself.  I was at my highest weight 207 lbs and my daughter had just got engaged.  I needed to do something for myself, so when my doctor recommended Ozempic, I decided to try it.  I lost small amounts of weight each week, so was feeling good, but decided I needed some structure, so that I didn't go back to my old habits.  I joined Noom and that kept me paying attention to what I was eating and where my weight was at.  I felt nauseous and immediately full after a few bites of food, but never got sick.  I couldn't eat greasy food and if I did, I would feel very sick after eating it.  After a few months of Ozempic, I switched to Wegovy because of the shortage but still continued to feel good.  I'm so happy to say that I've lost 60 lbs and am just short of my goal of 140lbs by 5 lbs.  This medication is a miracle for those who have tried unsuccessfully to lose weight on their own.  It's a great jump start for those who have a lot of weight to lose and when you see your body working the way it should, it's very motivating!  Well worth trying!!!

I started wegovy 6 weeks ago and taking 6th dose of 0.5 mg. this evening. Started on 0.25mg for 4weeks. Had a few side effects with the first 2 injections of 0.25mg. Felt light headed ,some nausea and fatigue at times but was tolerable and managable with pepto bismol. Easy to inject and painless. I inject into my thigh because I read that you have less side effects. It works for me. It definitely decreased my appetite. My starting weight was 210 and now it is 196 in 6 weeks. I', glad I didn't let the negative reviews stop me from trying wegovy. I am looking forward to completing the 0.5 mg in 3 weeks with no side effects and more weight loss and hopefully move up to the next dose of 1mg. Will update at a later date.

I started on ozempic while wegovy was out of stock and switched over after getting up to 1mg. I had no issues or side effects till 1.7mg. Last week Iâve thrown up 7 times and will wake up right as Iâm going to vomit, once you do tho the nausea is gone. I as someone who would eat all the time itâs been harder, I can only eat a 1/5 of my old portions. So far the results are worth it, in just under 4 months Iâve lost 50 pounds. Started at 390 down to 340, So Iâll take whatever nausea comes with it :)

SW204 /CW 172 Goal 160
I have lost over 30lbs in the last 4 months.  I have had some stomach problems (gas, bloating a little diarrhea) But overall I haven't been to bad.  The worst was changing strengths . Each time can with new stomach issues. Now that I am at 2.4 my side effects have all but disappeared. Well worth it to me

Iâve been on Wegovy since April of 2023 and have experienced shortage of supply. I was on the 0.25mg dose for 2 months, where I didnât experience any weight loss, followed by the 0.5mg dose for a month. There were a few weeks after that where I could not get the prescription filled. I then was able to get the 1.0mg dose which I took 9 days ago. I was sick, vomiting, for 2 days. The side effects subsided after that. I took my second dose of 1.0mg 2 days ago and I was violently ill on the second day, couldnât even keep down water, and even after purging everything in my stomach, I was vomiting a ton of bile. It was horrific. Iâm afraid to take it again out of fear that I will be dealing with 2 days of vomiting every time I take the injection. Iâve lost 20 pounds but Iâm trying to figure if itâs worth it or not.

My prescriber and pharmacy errored and my first injection was yesterday for 1 mg. Should have been .25.  Iâve never been this sick.  Vomiting through Zofran. Headed to ER prob today for help.  Dehydrated. Canât even keep two sips of anything down.  Know this:  THERE IS NO REVERSAL FOR THIS.  THIS FIVE DAY OD SHOT FOR ME - will continue until itâs out of my system. Nothing manufacturer can offer to reverse.  Per poison control.

Since I've started Wegovy, I've lost so much weight. I started at 230 lbs. I currently weigh 175. The only downside is the nausea. If you overeat, you'll be super nauseous. Also, any time you start a new dose, it may also come with a bit of nauseousness. I've had no desire to drink alcohol which I love. I used to drink quite a bit. Not an alcoholic but I would drink during the weekend. There's absolutely no desire for it so that's good. Once you get past the first day or two of nausea, you're back to normal.

I have been on Wegovy since Jan. 2023. I am up to 1.7 dose. I elected not to go up to 2.4 because 1.7 was an effective dose for me. I have no major side effects. At the very beginning, on .25 and .50 doses, I would have a headache and major fatigue the day after taking the shot. I didn't really notice appetite suppression until 1.0 dose. It would only last about 4 days then my appetite would pick back up. 1.7 is my sweet spot. I eat about half of what I use to eat pre-Wegovy. I workout with weights and cardio 5 days a week for an hour. I have lose 32lbs in about 7-8mths. There was times when the medicine was on backorder. I take Metamucil twice a day for fiber also to keep bowels regular. I love that I can eat a normal portion of food now and not spend all day thinking about my next meal!!

I started taking Wegovy 2 weeks ago and just took my 3rd injection yesterday (start of week 3).  I began on the max 2.4mg dosage after trying to obtain lower doses for nearly a year to no avail.  I dropped from 260 lbs to 237 lbs in 2 weeks.  The first 3 days at this dosage was absolute hell, which I expected.  I vomited 4 or 5 different times over the first few days and felt drained and fatigued.  I could not stomach any food whatsoever during the first 3 days and just sipped on a bit of water from time to time. However, after the 3rd day, I was 100% and back to normal in all ways, except my appetite.  I hardly ever feel hungry and when I eat, I can typically only eat a small portion before feeling full.  For example, 2 weeks in, I can only eat like a 3rd of a cheeseburger or a  half of a salad.  Another good by product is that I hardly drink anything alcoholic any more (beer and wine).  Just no craving for it.  When I started week 2 and took my second injection, I was expecting to have to go through hell again.  That did not happen.  Felt great and still do starting my 3rd week.  Lots of energy, no sleep issues, and losing lots of weight.  Just took my 3rd injection yesterday and feel great.  In summary, the first 3 days absolutely sucked for me, but so glad I stuck it out.  Spending a lot less on food and drinking a lot less alcoholic drinks.  Very noticeable weight loss in my face so far.  I am also told that I don't snore anymore (lol).  Hoping this pattern continues over the next couple of months.  Very happy with Wegovy!

I lost 12lbs my first 3 injections, and everything was manageable until I went on vacation. I was at a concert when I tried a vodka lemonaide and ate half a hot dog after not eating all day and just drinking water. 10 minutes later I had horrible abdominal pain. I chalked it up to constipation, but it got so much worse. The pain was different than anything I have ever felt. Even drinking water was killing me. It felt like I swallowed razor blades and my intestines were ripping and my upper back was shredding into pieces. The pain lasted for 3 days with constant diahrea. I skipped this injection because the pain was worse than my gallbladder surgery. Last night the pain moved to the left upper abdominal area, it felt like I was being stabbed for hours on end. Literally my entire left upper stomach was visably twitching. The pain subsided today, im still constipated, extremly bloated, and tired as hell. Only 3 weeks in and I feel horrible. Please be careful.
Day 2, no hunger & no side effects

Wegovy works too good of you ask me. I literally cannot eat and food looks so unappealing to me now. I lost 40 lbs in two months and I'm not even at the full dose yet. My only issue is the nausea and complete loss of appetite I now have to force myself to get even a little down. I think I may take a break for a while, I miss being able to eat
Had no weight loss at all and when I got to the 2.4 dosage an alarming amount of hair fell out.

Worst experience ever after taking the 1st shot of .24ml. Iâve had severe vomiting for 48 hours continuously. It was so bad bile was all that I had left to vomit, made my teeth brittle and I was so cold and breaking out in sweats. I had to get an IV after the 3rd day. What a horrible experience and Iâm terrified of the thought of taking the next dose of this over priced medication that took so long to get approved for!
I can barely eat anything and keep it in for 5 mins without throwing up! Taking OTC Dramamine to help with the severe nausea. Itâs not worth going through such a terrible experience to lose weight.

I began my Wegovy journey May 2nd and am about to conclude my 4th month.  I am down 41 pounds.  The side effects have been minimal for me, I have been very lucky.  Other than a little nausea and some fatigue from time to time, I have felt great!  It has definitely curbed my appetite and doesn't allow me to eat very much at one sitting.  I have learned to listen to my body when it tells me to stop eating.  I have over eaten a few times and most definitely paid the price!  I haven't really changed much as far as the foods I eat, just the amount.  Being someone that has struggled with my weight since my teens, this has been the easiet, less stressful weight loss journey I have been on.  I am halfway to my goal!!  Yay!!

I started Feb 2023, lowest dose, for the month it worked, curbed any food craving and started to lose weight. Come March, nothing, and what weight I lost, I gained back. Aug 2023, I found out I have low Testosterone levels, and found out, Weygovi and Low Testosterone dont mix, and low T will cause the Weygovi to be ineffective. I kept twlling my endocrinologist that somethings been blocking the Weygovi, and of course, the answer is, well it doesnt work for allâ¦..I think we all know our bodiesâ¦so, waiting to fix the low t levelsâ¦

I started off the lowest dose but when I started the 1 mg I got super sick hours later vomiting nonstop really bad nausea bad headache dizzy  fatigue sever stomach pain  I feel horrible like Iâm dying havenât ate in 3 days since  taking it itâs not worth it ! Pls stay away for these

I am so pleased with this medication!  I have had no side effects so far. Although I'm still ramping up the dose (1mg now), I've lost 8 lbs.  I don't obsess about food anymore and I don't crave fried food!  The only downside I've found is that I forget to drink enough water now, which I never used to do.

BMI over 30. On week 10, 2nd week on 1.0 mg dose. Little to no appetite for a couple weeks. Decreased food intake. Zero weight loss. Until this week. After last injection, have been violently ill for days. Can't keep anything down, Threw up food from 2 days prior at beginning of this dose. Throwing up completely undigested food many hours after eating, Stomach won't hold any solids. Lost 10 pounds this weekend. Would rather be chubby.

My experience is different than most. I was not overweight, But had put on 20 pounds since peri-menopause that I could not lose and I felt horrible. I started at 158 and two weeks in I am at 147. Months also started at the 1.7 dose because that was all that was available to get without delay. My first shot was horrible on the first day.  Then my doctor called in nausea medicine and I was good to go. The second day I was good to go. I have just not felt hungry. I definitely have to watch what I eat and I eat supper slow. I was weak my first weak but I hadnât been taking my vitamins. I started taking them and everything got better. I took my third shot today and havenât felt sick all day. I was surprised. Last week wasnât too bad either. I didnât have headaches or any of the other horrific side effects that some of the others have left in their reviews.

If you use any medication you will have side effects that you don't want. Thats what drugs do. They give side effects to combat an ailment. Even multivitamins can cause vomiting, dehydration, gi issues and lightheadedness. If you don't use as prescribed then it is not the med to blame. If you expect to take a shot and wake up tomorrow 100lbs less you will be disappointed. 

I have had side effects but got through it. It wasn't pleasant but I got through it. I am happy to stay close to a bathroom once a week if it means my body can be in less pain because of my weight. Getting older sucks way more when excess weight mixes with normal wear and tear. 
I do think that too many people are not realistic about what this does. It doesn't fix everything by itself and nothing is going to give you that social media glow that isn't real to begin with. Even when you do lose a lot in the end, you now have another round of new problems. You look like a deflated balloon and are dealing with the complexity of being a fat person in a stranger's skinny body. 

Moral of this story. If this works the way you think it should you didn't need it to begin with. If you quit because you don't like the side effects, you didn't need this to begin with. Some of us are desperate, including myself, and will do anything to feel less pain. No one should stay on a med they don't like but don't blame it all on the drug.

I have been taking Wegovy since the end of April 2023. Due to supply issues, I took 2-months worth of the .25 dose and then now 2-months worth of the .5 dose. I have one more dose of the .5ml pen left, but have put off taking it due to experiencing extreme side effects last week (the 2nd time this has happened). It feels like a really bad case of the flu, mixed with nausea, vertigo, a horrible headache, fatigue, and having a very hot, flushed face that I cannot cool down no matter what I do. I canât stand for more than a few seconds at a time either. Itâs seriously awful. I have been prescribed nausea medication and will still sometimes throw up out of nowhere. Mostly like acid reflux. I noticed that this has happened a day or two after taking my 6th or 7th shot of the SAME dose. It is almost unbearable. Also, it is really scary that these side effects can appear seemingly out of nowhere when other weeks I feel mostly fine (maybe not ever 100% but manageable). I think these side effects may also be corresponding with my period, but thatâs just a theory. So, adding that into the mix is the cherry on top of what is a horrible experience. 

Some weeks I feel less hungry than others, but it has never been consistent or gotten progressively âbetterâ with each week. I already try to drink a ton of water, but have upped my water intake even more since starting the medication in hopes of helping avoid any potential side effects. I have also tried to incorporate more protein and veggies into my diet and stay away from really greasy foods or lots of sugar. Again, some days or weeks are better than others, but overall, I have made some decent improvements to my diet and still havenât been able to lose much weight or keep off the little bit I have lost. When Iâm not experiencing extreme fatigue or any other side effects, I am usually able to exercise 2-3 times a week. But if the fatigue creeps up on me? Forget about it. It will feel like Iâve been drugged.

Overall, Iâm disappointed that the medication hasnât worked the way Iâve heard it has for others. My doctor reminded me that not everyone experiences rapid weight loss in the first few months, but I guess I just assumed (or hoped) thatâs what would happen. She feels that my progress is good enough/gradual and that if I can get my hands on the medication during these crazy shortages then I should try to push through. However, risking feeling like death 2-3 days every 6 weeks has me questioning if itâs worth it. I want to be the healthiest version of myself, but have never found it easy to lose weight without crash dieting. As I get older and my metabolism slows, it only becomes increasingly more difficult. I want to be heart healthy, have energy, and feel my best. So far, Wegovy has occasionally made me feel less hungry, but the anxiety and stress that comes with experiencing side effects and dealing with supply chain issues/coverage is a lot.
Im just starting week 3, no noticeable weight loss. I noticed another person had problems with their throat feeling swollen and sore. That is what Im going through. Does this go away?

I'd give it 10 stars if I could. Started on 1/15 at 277 pounds down to 201 6 months later. It slows the digestive system, so I took on an empty stomach though instructions says it doesn't matter. Minor side effects. Headaches and the runs the first 2 days and the runs when I upped to the 1.7 dosage for about 10 days. Only other side effect was fatigue. Though when I'm fatigued that's when the weight comes off. Doctor kept me on the .25 doseage for the first 3 months, .50 for the next 2 months, 1.0 for a month and just started the 1.7 doseage 2 weeks ago. 
   Was able to eat the foods I like, though I avoided pasta, bread and sugar foods, diet mainly meat and baked potato. Wegovy curbed my carb addiction considerably, snacking reduced by about 80 percent and meals by about 40 percent. 
   Had a few periods when the weight loss stalled for 7 to 10 days. I lost weight before but never this easy. The cravings for food went away within an hour of 1st injection.

Extremely disappointed! I was excited to finally get my Dr. to prescribe it/my insurance to approved it ( $1,600.00/ 28 day supply) Got the 1st month and did very well on it. Got a Lil nauseous and dizzy but bearable. I lost 12 lbs.so happy.My second month had to wait 3 weeks, wasn't available, on backorder! Gained 3lbs waiting. Waiting 4 weeks now for my 3rd month. Gained 3 more lbs waiting! Backorder AGAIN! Rediculous! For that price, they should be producing for the demand or don't advertise! It's messing me all up! SO MAD!!!!

This is a very dangerous medication and you should be warned, I have been vomiting nonstop for two days!! I canât even stomach my essential pills for my heart or pain!! I can even eat apple sauce without projectile vomiting every last grain of it!!! Even Gatorade I canât stomach! Itâs going on day two and itâs getting better but yeah you will loose weight in a pinch if you POISON YOURSELF!!! I have felt hungover for days now with no relief!! Never again I will just count calories from now on!!

I'm on week 6 and on 2nd step up in strength. The first 4 weeks were rough. I was hungry all the time, but could only eat a couple of bites and my stomach felt full! But then I was hungry again in about 30 minutes. I just suffered through it and lost 12 lbs. This 2nd round is better. Hunger has finally subsided and I've lost 3lbs per week - 18 lbs total. I have found that Pepcid has helped with nausea and occasionally I've laid down because of dizziness, but all-in-all I've been happy with results. Sam's Club Pharmacy has been helpful in ordering my next set of injections a little early so they are available when I need them.

I am 42 years old and have a 27 BMI. I started with Wegovy at .25. Unfortunately, it didn't do anything - not even curve my appetite. Due to lack of supply, I lasted 2 weeks without any medication. I jumped up to 1.7 because .50 and .10 were out of stock until further notice in my area. I am on my last week of last applicator and I feel horrible. I am nauseas everyday, like pregnant morning sickness. I have extreme skin sensitivity, specially on my back and I feel like my bones are freezing all day no matter how many sweaters/blankets I put on. I can't be with to AC, I still like I'm freezing. Also, I noticed that my tonsils hurt and feel inflamed almost like when getting strep but it hasn't worsen just remains bothersome and feel somewhat swollen. My appetite has definitely decreased and I force myself to eat so I can have a little energy. I'm exhausted and cold all day long with extreme skin sensitivity. I have lost @6 lbs but I think I have lost more Fat % vs actual scale weight. My clothes is fitting loose. I just wish these side effects weren't as horrific. Is anyone else experiencing Skin Sensitivity/chills?

I have been taking the drug for 4 months and lost 40 pounds.  Overall, I am very happy with the results but have had some significant side effects.  Once starting the 1.7 mg I have noticed increased nausea and abdominal pain.  As well, recently had two separate times of vomiting and diarrhea, the last being the worst thinking I may have to visit the ER.  I was able to recover but since have had abdominal pain.  I'm concerned after reading the effects for others that I should stop taking the drug.  However, I've had such good results I would rather push through and hope they go away.  Several users commented side effects go away after 6+ months of usage.

I've been taking Wegovy for 10 weeks and have lost 20 lbs.  The side effects haven't been too bad.  At times I am very sick to my stomach, but doesn't last but about an hour.  Happens about 1 or 2 times a week.  Appetite is definitely curbed and little want for sweets.

Been on Wegovy for 8weeks now. Have lost 18 pounds. Very little side effects on .5. Nothing you canât push through. Some days you may have fatigue, and then it goes away. Other days you may have a bout of diarrhea, and then it get better. You without a doubt get fuller quicker. Hands down the best thing I have been given. Iâm at menopausal age and as hard as I tried the weight wouldnât budge until starting this. I feel great! All my numbers have dropped greatly, cholesterol, A1C. I do try to walk three times a week for exercise but nothing too crazy.

Only made it to the second dose until I had to stop. Had to go into the ER after my second shot because I was having such bad vertigo that was making me vomit all day. Iâm now 3 days since my last shot and I am still overwhelmingly dizzy and feel so out of control. Only thing that helps is laying in a dark room trying not to move my head at all. One slight move and the whole room is spinning all over again. Nausea and vomiting has subsided at this point now.  
Before this medication I was on Mounjaro and that one had gone MUCH better but insurance no longer covers it for people using it for weight loss.
This has been such an horrible experience and I would not recommend this medication to anyone!!

In hindsight, all was pretty tolerable until the second week of 1.0mg. After 14 days of feeling increasingly worse (extreme and sudden depression and crippling anxiety, weakness to the point I can barely walk across the house, fatigue, massive brain fog, confusion,  dizzy, cold and chills with no fever, rash on arms, swelling in neck, headache, eye pain, blurry vision,  jacked up blood pressure) I went to the ER. All sorts of abnormal labs for kidney function, electrolytes, metaboloc acidosis and messed up red blood counts. Prior to that dose, I was doing great, exercising daily, sticking to my lifestyle changes and happy with the results. Now I'm weak and unable to exercise, work, concentrate, feeling unmotivated, tired, moody, and anxious. It feels like I'm literally dying and there's nothing that helps. It's everything I can do to force myself to eat and drink a little bit.  This med doesn't help that much to justify feeling like absolute hell, mentally and physically for weeks after stopping it. I see that many people experience the same gigantic kick in the face at the 1.0 to 1.7 mg dose . I wish there was an antidote, I would pay anything to end this torture. I'll do this my dang self once I can muster the strength to move, think clearly, and get out of this quick, hard hitting depression.  Sorry brain, sorry kidneys, bye-bye sanity.

I have been on Wegovy for just over 2 months. I have lost 15 pounds, so I will say it is very effective. I am currently at the 1mg weekly dose, and it is rough. Since the start of this medication, I have had a general "queasy" feeling almost all the time. My appetite is definitely decreased. I have also had some dizziness and fatigue and it has interfered some with my workouts. I was eating low carb and exercising regularly before starting Wegovy, but was at a weight plateau. I started this because of my A1C (prediabetic) and triglyceride levels, and I believe weight loss will help both these numbers. I know to avoid weight regain, I will probably have to be on this indefinitely. At this point, however, I don't think I will go above the current 1mg dose, at least for a few months, because the side effects on this dose are pretty bad. Queasy all the time with intermittent nausea, constipation, fatigue, some dizziness during my workouts. I am hoping with time these will get better as the weight loss continues. I don't want to take Zofran, miralax, and colace forever.

I have been on Wegovy for a year and a half, minus 4 months when my insurance was denying the claim due to a misunderstanding. Iâm giving a review because mostly people with bad reactions leave reviews here and my experience has been overwhelmingly positive. It was working so well for me that I did each dose for a few months before increasing to the next level. Iâm just now starting the 2.4mg dose and although Iâm nervous, itâs worth it because the results are so good. 

I had a bmi of 31 when I started and now itâs is 24. Iâve lost about 28% of my body weight and now look and feel great. All my arthritis is gone! I did have some pretty significant nausea and constipation for a few months, but I only vomited once. Some headaches too and just not feeling great. But the longer youâre on it, it seems to get better and I mostly donât have any side effects anymore. We will see with this new highest dose. 

When I had to stop for 4 months, I gained back about 14 lbs, so thatâs why I started it up again. I intend to stay on it so that I can keep the weight off. Totally worth it, for me, and just hoping I donât get any serious side effects from long term use. I recommend people try it if they qualify. You never know how your body will tolerate a new medicine and you might get lucky!

Wow! I'm so glad that I started on Wegovy! I'm on the 1.7 and have lost 31 LBS. I didn't get sick or anything.  I do have dry mouth. Please don't let the reviews scare you! It feels amazing to finally loose the weight! In the first .25 dose I did have bathroom problems but that went away.

Starting treatment weight was 302 currently at week 10 of treatment, dose 1.0, weight is 268, intermittent fasting, cardio, and weight training daily. That is 34# in ten weeks and 11% of my total body weight...! Minimal side effects. Excessive dairy and alcohol are not a good idea. This product eliminates cravings... could not have changed bad habits without wegovys help.

The Folks out there that write Negative Reviews against Wegovy. You guys NEED to understand that everyone is built different. If you experienced negative side effects, well , Wegovy is not for you then. But don't trash Wegovy with your negative side effects. I am on my 10th week using Wegovy and Yes there were side effects but after time they do go away. Fatique, tiredness, constipation etc. Give the meds the chance to work first. And YES, you will definitely LOSE WEIGHT.
Regards.

I am not obese but have not been at a good weight for 9 years. Have tried all the diets, lost weight but have not been able to keep it off. A friend suggested Wegovy, since she lost weight on it. I asked my doctor and she prescribed it. 

In the first month I lost 10 lbs. When my prescription went to .5, I started losing weight a lot more slowly and having my first side effect, increased resting heart rate. I don't have any other side effects. With the increase in dosage however, I never feel full. 

To date, I'm on Wegovy for 7 weeks and have lost 13 lbs. I don't feel any different and am a bit disheartened that the weight loss is not as quick. I work out with a personal trainer twice weekly and go for daily walks. So far, I'm not really impressed.

I have been on Wegovy since the end of March 2023. In 10 weeks I've lost 22lbs, which is over 2lbs a week. This is a TOOL to help you lose weight. I workout 5 days a week, including strength training. I eat around 1200 calories, but that isn't hard, since the medication does curb cravings. I'm one of those people who has always eaten well and exercised, but after years of dieting and excessive restriction (even Anorexia), my body didn't want to work effectively anymore. For the first time maybe ever, I'm able to eat things I wouldn't normally eat, and not gain weight- but in fact, lose. I don't restrict things, but as an overall healthy eater and Vegetarian, this works wonderfully for my lifestyle. People really need to do their research, though. You are meant to slowly titrate up the doses so that you can eliminate or reduce the side effects. There are ways to deal with the side effects when you have them- drink more water, eat plenty of protein, etc. The therapeutic dose doesn't even start til 1.0mg-1.7mg and many do not lose anything until then, so you have to be patient. I'm one of the lucky ones whose had great success from the beginning, but I do lead a healthy lifestyle. I feel like my body is finally working the way it's meant to. Exercise, choose foods to fuel your body, eat lots of protein so you don't lose muscle mass, and be patient. Don't compare your journey to anyone else's.

Iâve been on this medication for 2 months now and have lost 26lbs. Nauseous and vomiting during the first 2 weeks. My doctor does well with keeping up with my progress and since day one has mentioned increasing my fluid intake. By reading other reviews dehydration seems to be a big issue for people. Hopefully this continues to work for me and I reach my goal with only 24lbs left to lose.
Do not take this. I took the .25 dose at 8:30 and by midnight I have continuously been vomiting. Diarrhea and extreme stomach pain. This is horrible!

I do not recommend Weygovy. I only did the initial shot and was sick soon after and for weeks after (even though I only did the one shot; I discarded the other 3). Im talking relentless nausea, vomiting, fatigue, weakness, zero appetite Which isnât healthy! I did lose 6lbs in 6 days bc I physically could not eat or drink without being immediately in the bathroom. I ended up in the ER on day 5 and 6 due to dehydration ??

I took my first dose of Wegovy and had some manageable symptoms. Diarrhea, fatigue, cold sensitivity. It did decrease my appetite, but my energy level is so low I canât exercise. Second dose was worse. I have felt like I have had an ongoing stomach bug for two weeks. I canât eat anything thatâs not clear liquid. I didnât, and wonât take the third dose. I just hope this goes away!

First lower dose didnât do anything for me and no symptoms. First week on highest dosage 50, was tough, vomiting, constipation, fever for 24 hours. 2nd week has been fine, a little nausea. I have not weighed myself but my clothes are looserâ¦

This sent me to the hospital with dehydration and severe abdominal pain. I have a pretty high pain tolerance, but this abdominal pain was by far the worst I have ever dealt with. I took 4 weeks of 0.25 followed by 1 dose of 0.5 (the correct dose schedule according to manufacturer) and 6 days later I was in the hospital. I have not taken another does since. But- my GI tract is still not right. It took at least one week to deal with the aftermath of the hospital visit, and now, 3.5 weeks out from my last dose, I still get queasy/nauseous 1-2 times weekly, so much so that I have to take Zofran, which barely touches it. And BTW- the nauseousness lasts for at least 12 hours, it's not a quick, passing thing. This "medication" is dangerous even when used correctly. I did read all these reviews before starting so was hesitant but went ahead anyway, and thought after a month that I skirted around any side effects, but I was totally wrong. Never again and don't do it. It's not worth it.

This has been the worst day of my life. This morning at 7am I did my first shot of .25, but 3pm I had called 911. 

I have been vomiting non stop since about 2 hours after the injection. My heart rate when EMS arrived was 155, I was having chest pain and palpitations. I was dizzy and delirious. 

My local EMS said they see this a few times a week from wegovy, the ER dr said he sees it daily.  I had focused on hydrating the 4 days before the injection and was even fasting I took it. Please reconsider taking this
I started on the medication 4 weeks ago and I have lost 13lbs. I have had no side effects and cravings for sweets are gone. Can't wait to see how much I lost next month.

Let me first say that digestivelly, I have never been more miserable in my life than I was on this "medication." Wegovy  gave me abdominal cramps so bad I had to go an ER. I was very dehydrated and in so much pain. Luckily my CT was normal, but my WBC was elevated. Maybe this is some other side effect that will start being reported more often now that half the population seems to be taking it. I started at the 0.25 and did that weekly for 4 weeks. During that time, I was ok but constantly felt somewhat bloated and would burp way more than what would be considered normal. Then came 0.5, one dose. 6 days later I was in the ER. It's now 1 week later, and my GI tract is still not normal. I am glad some people had success with this but for me, my life was way better before this medication. I'll take 15# overweight and feeling great to this any day. My next visit is to a GI doctor. I just hope there is no permanent damage.Thanks for the misery, Wegovy. Never again. Big pharma can take their bogus, fabricated  BMI and stick it.
This drug has helped me to reach a healthier weight. I have not had any side effects. I could not have done this without this drug.

I was terrified to start this because of the reviews I read. So far I have had minimal side effects. Iâm more sensitive to the cold, sometime have indigestion and definitely have constipation that I need to take colace for but besides that I have no other side effects.  I have loss 14lbs in 4 weeks. I am combining this with weight watchers so I am pretty careful about what Iâm eating. Wegovy seems to make it possible for me to avoid the cravings I generally have.  Part of it has been fear of getting sick from all the reviews but I think itâs also that it makes me feel pretty full longer.  I do still experience hunger but I am definitely able to eat way less and still feel satisfied. my insurance covers it and itâs working so Iâm happy to continue on the same dosage for another course (4 weeks). My doctor sees no reason to increase as itâs working and not making me sick.

So I just started 1.7 today. I think the is a great TOOL for weight loss. I am down 50 lbs. I call it a tool because its still a lot of work. I have been on this 12 weeks. I started at 320 and am down to 270 with not many side effect. I have twice overate 2 times while taking this medicine first time bad heartburn through the night last time was last night even though I knew better. I had acid reflux and 1/2 way into the night I through up. You would have thought I learned my  lesson. So I have had a few headaches and diarrhea bur nothing to hard. Losing 50 lbs I feel so much better and with the 1.7 I have noticed I don't feel hungry at all today. I am so glad I started this and my wife is on it she felt nauseous her first day on .50 dose but at a little and was fine. I am a believer

I did one month of each MG and have lost a total of 24 pounds.  I initially lost 9 pounds the first month while on the .25.  During the second month while on .50 I lost nothing(I also didnât exactly give any effort).  After starting the 1.0 I started losing weight again, towards the end of the month my weight loss started to slow down again.  I am now on my first month of the 1.7 and am losing weight again. For the first time I have a side effect of fatigue.  But what do you expect when you donât eat?  This will be my last month as I have hit my goal.  

Overall I am happy and would recommend.  Only negatives is the price and the fatigue once I started the 1.7.

At first I was nervous about the needle, but the first time I used it I didnât feel a thing. Very easy to use. The appetite suppression began right away, no nausea, no constipation, no diarrhea. I just took my second dose, and so far I am down 8 pounds. This is just after my first week. Could be a fluke, could be a difference between scales, I am going to weigh myself again at the doctors office using their scale where I initially weighed in, for a more accurate comparison. Overall Iâm very pleased. No insomnia. No cravings. Iâm definitely eating less and feeling better. My clothes are also telling the tale, fitting much better with no bloating.

I lost 10lbs initially on Wegovy then I stalled no more   I am overweight by a lot and prediabetic.  I do feel like it kept my cravings down but weight loss just stopped .My coworkers had good experience  they didnât have a lot to loose compared to myself  but dropped 40lbs plus  so I was very discouraged.  I didnât experience side effects  except for headaches  I sure wish I had experienced the same results as others but as in all situations not all medicines work the same on different bodies.

I took the .25 was ok except for nausea. Moved up to the .5 was still ok. Then moved up to the 1.0. Two days after the shot I was so sick. Watery #2,  terrible nausea, burping up sulphur eggs, stomach pains. I thought I had the stomach flu. Went away after two days. Took my shot again the same thing happened only worse. I ended up in the ER because the stomach pain was so bad it was worse than I ever could imagine. Had two bags of IV CT scan to make sure everything was ok and said that my stomach was distended and my hiatal hernia was inflamed. Also during the first two months of the shot I was stagnant with weight lose. I did lose 20 lbs but going back to eating the right way without all the pain and discomfort I went through plus loosing pay at work. Will not recommend this drug at all. Big pharma wanting to make money.

So far I have been very happy with this medication. I just took my fourth dose of .25 today and I am down 13 pounds. At the beginning, I had a lot of bloating and some constipation. I started taking a probiotic daily and that has seemed to help a lot. I have also increased my water intake. It definitely has decreased my appetite significantly. I am struggling to get my protein intake up. I concentrate on protein and vegetables at my meals. I snack on cheese, yogurt, fruit, protein bars or shakes, some nuts. Move up to .50 next week and Iâm hoping it goes just as smoothly.

Update, I have now have sulfur burps alongside nausea, heartburn, diarrhea, abdominal pain, distention, bloating, flatulence, etc. If I would I have this would be the end of the road for 7 lbs, I wouldnât have ever started. DONT DO IT. Everything easy comes with a price!

Started Wegovy initially no side effects other than constipation.Lost 8 bs in 10 thought this was going to be great. The higher the dose, the more nauseous I got. No appetite. Lost and gained the same two pounds now for 2 months. Even with a very low calorie diet. I was so hopeful, but this is for the birds. The only reason I will continue is so that I donât gain. Iâm so disappointed.

I am in my 2nd month of the startup dose due to the nausea, severe constipation and headaches the Dr thought going up to next dose wasnât a good ideaâ¦he wanted me to discontinue saying that the medication doesnât work for everyone BUT I asked to try 1 more time 
as of this morning I have done 6 doses and have lost 7.9 pounds. 
It does help with the feeling that I need to eat but I am seriously considering if the side effects are worth it.

I am 65, weighed 203, and am 5â8. I was really hoping this would be the answer to my weight loss journey.  I began Wegovy with .25 five weeks ago. I have lost five pounds. This drug has had a strange outcome for me. The scale stayed the same for eight days straight. It wasnât until I expelled a weekâs worth of #2 that I finally lost another 1.5 pounds. At the beginning, I didnât go to the bathroom for nine days. I was miserable. I tried senacot  and Miralax together before I finally went. 
This has been a horrible and disappointing experience.  It has made me depressed and lethargic, not to mention the stomach pain every day. Last week I went to the .50 dose. Worst week of my life. I have eight grandchildren and canât even enjoy them because Iâm so sad and sick. I have struggled with weight loss since I was 50. Thank goodness I am tall or I would look like a cow. I have three injections left and Iâm not sure I can put myself through this for three more weeks. 
I pay $906 for a monthâs worth, and I feel like it has been such a waste of money. I may go back to the .025 if I continue Wegovy. At what price does one pay to get healthy? Ugh!

Listed as a possible side effect but my dr says she has never heard of it..... I'm extremely weak feeling.  My legs feel like they could give away from under me.  I feel shaky. Its the feeling you get when you do need to eat not eating does not help.

Been on Wegovy for 2 1/2 months now and down 23 lbs. Beginning Nausea was horrible! Just took my first dose of 1 mg a day ago and Im so sick! Canât eat not hungry and the relentless Nauseaâ¦! Horrible pains on right and left sides of my stomach. Exhausted! I donât know if Iâll be sticking with this or not.

I started on the normal dosing schedule, 2 months in and on my last one week of 0.5 when I started getting left upper quadrant abdominal pain. As a nurse and knowing the rare, but possible side effects, afraid of pancreatitis I went to the ER. Cleared on the pancreatitis but the pain will not reside. Now itâs projectile vomiting, I canât keep anything down. Iâve had debilitating fatigue. Iâve only lost 7 lbs in 2 months. Gastric emptying delay .. thatâs how this thing works? Thereâs better ways to lose weight.

Day after my first shot and I feel horrible!  Headache will not budge been taking Tylenol extra strength.  Constant nausea I guess thatâs the way of losing weight?    Keep burping and taste like eggs I donât even eat eggs.. Sorry Iâm not looking for an eating disorder .. when does this crap leave your system??  I really donât want to continue to feel this way itâs horrible!  This drug should be pulled off shelves waste of money.

Today will make week 1 on Wegovy. First week I had 2 nights of insomnia but no other side effects. I completely loss my appetite and had to make myself eat healthy meals. Total weight loss for week one was 6 pounds.

I started Wegovy 6 weeks ago. Initially, I felt horrible fatigue, for which my doctor instructed me to take vitamin B6, so the fatigue is gone. I had to stay on the initial dose the second month due to stomach pain and diarrhea. I am taking Metamucil and drink a 3 liters of water a day. I do feel full fast and there are minor taste issues with food. The general feeling of being unwell does not allow me to eat much. I also am not exercising much but I try to just push through that and I walk.  I have only lost 6 lbs in 6 weeks but maybe slower weight loss is better. I will post again when they up my dose. Wish me luck!
Lost 12 lbs so far over 3 weeks & havenât even started to increase dosage yet.  Still need to pick up more exercise. Shifting to a low carb diet boosted weight loss

This medication has ruined the entire month of March for me. I have been sick every 3-4 days with explosive diarrhea and vomiting. I cannot wait for it to get out of my system. The reason people are loosing so much weight on this is because you literally cannot eat.

Iâm on week 5 doing the slow increase up to the 2.4 mg. First month was .25 mg and this month is .50, next month 1 mg, etc. Definitely learned after my first dose to do several things. Be super aware of what I eat on my dosing days and the next two days. Nothing fatty, unhealthy etc. that results in diarrhea. I always take Pepcid in the mornings now and on my dosing day and the next couple of days take another anti acid before I eat. I drink lots of water. Also one time I pushed the pen into my skin and it didnât click to dispense the medication so I lifted up the pen and ended up wasting a lot of the medication ??. Lastly I always take out the pen out of the fridge on dosing days in the mornings then dose at night but not right before bed time. It sounds like a lot but Iâm super happy and excited to be on this med. definitely notice the appetite decrease and Iâm excited to see how things go once I get up to the 2.5 mg dose. All side effects have been manageable just need to readjust some things.

I used .25 Wegovy March 2022 and it was amazing. Took away appetite, unfortunately this is when the shortage started and I couldnât refill for an entire year. Started up again .25 dose Feb 2023 and feel nothing. Did not take away appetite at all. Increased dosage to .50 and have been on that for a little over two weeks and still no noticeable change in appetite. Wondering if the rush to get the medication back on the shelves changed the med, as in 2022 the .25 worked amazingly. 
Hoping the next dosage works!

I started Wegovy 8 weeks ago and am completely happy with the results! not much as far as side effects go. One night I ate to much later and was sick through the night. This would happen before Wegovy but I was sicker. This has helped me not over eat late at night. I did Have Diarrhea one night and a little constipated nothing bad. My appetite is def less than before but you still have to work at it. I have loss 32 lbs in & weeks with a week at an all-inclusive resort where I did drink and ate what I wanted. I just took my last dose on .50 I will see how the other ones do. My wife just started Wegovy

I started a week ago today with my first shot. I made very smart choices with my food and drank a lot of water. The third day I had a severe headache. Otherwise a little nauseous. I am down 8Lbs. So far so good!

Started with the .25 dose, now one the 1 dose.  Working with my Nurse Practitioner to monitor side effects and tolerance to medication.  So far so good.  My Nurse Practitioner also has me adhering to proper nutrition and exercise in addition to taking the medication. 
Working with dietitian to change eating habits and that has been a good experience.  I like the approach because the first 3 months we focused on adding a new goal in terms of nutrition focus so as not to have to worry about everything at once.  My water, protein, carbs and fat each day are now where they should be for me.  Its not so overwhelming now trying to meet my daily goals.  The medication is just helping me not focus on food or being hungry while doing this.  
I have experienced some nausea after the injection but seems to go away after a day or so. We will see how this goes as the dosage increases.  Some foods i dont seem to tolerate as well but they are foods I should not have regulary as a part of my new behaviors anyway so I am ok with that.  Also now understand that those items are choices as well but should not be a regular choice so again the medication is helping with behavior changes. 
On the .25 and .5 dose i did lose weight but nothing remarkable, but this is probably more related to me working on smaller manageable Nutritional goals. 
I am have more significant loss each week with the 1g dose so I imagine this will continue as the dose increases.
After reading some of the reviews I would say your best experience with the medication is partnering with a provider who knows about the treatment of obesity so that you can get all the tools needed to have a good experience.  The medication alone is not enough.

3th shut at 0,25 mg and I got terrible pains in my stomach, so terrible bad that I had to annonce myself sick at the job. Was just laying on the bed. Screaming in pain and agony.
No way able to eat anything that that would just make the pain even worse.
Stopped the 'treatment', not by any means worth the effort.

I completed two does of Wegovy. The joint pain, every joint  hurt. Elbows, knees Arms, bottom of my feet..not listed as side effect however have read others posts with similar experiences. My dr doesnât recommend I continue with the medication. Also a black box warning on thyroid cancer. Eating healthy watching my calories and carbs while difficult at least I will live to enjoy my weight loss??
Decided the risks with this drug donât make it the cure all for weight loss !!

Effectiveness: I've been on Wegovy since 1/19/23, in the first month I was down 15 pounds, second month another 15. I just took my 6th injection today 3/23/23, and am currently at 35 pounds. My BP has already dropped from 130s/90s, to 90s/70s, and have been removed from my first BP Med. 

Ease of Use: Once you get the needle out of your head, it is an easy injection. Both injections on 1.0 have been 'light', as it doesnt feel like the needle is going as deep as the last 8 doses. Todays dose was leaky, even with the needle in and pressing hard. I'll try again next week to see, it'll still do it's job even if some leaked out.

Satisfaction: Overall I'm satisfied, I haven't had much of a change in taste, but have noticed I am definitely more sensitive to smells triggering retching. Nausea for .25 and .5 were very mild, with 1.0 being on the slightly higher side of moderate.
