The night of the first 1.0, was horrible; But that was my own doing, having eaten heavier foods through the day before the injection, today seems to be back to a more mild sensation, eating like I had been the previous dose days. My partner has been absolutely supportive through this, adjusting his diet to closer to mine. I've mostly stuck to a sausage egg and cheese JD Delight sandwich for breakfast, raw veggies with a yogurt based dressing, or chicken patties with salsa for lunch, and pretty much whatever has been made for dinner. I have greatly reduced overall carb intake, getting closer to a keto diet but not strict. Something you MUST do is tell yourself to eat. My first 2 days after my first injection were very hanger ragey. Lesson learned. Beef seems to be a trigger food for nausea now. One side effect I've experienced more often than anything has been dizziness on standing. The first time I experienced it, it was quick as I was actually getting up from crouching; I actually had to lay down for a minute to come back to myself. Since then, I've either sat back down or just stood and braced myself against something. The removal from the first BP med seems to have really lightened up that side effect though. Outside of that, I am gassy from both ends, but I can't tell if that's the Wegovy or the CPAP at this time; Probably both... but the drug is doing what it's designed to do. I am trying to tell myself to endulge more, as I am somewhat concerned with how fast the weight is coming off... thinking maybe my blood sugar has been getting lower than it should be (have never been diagnosed diabetic), but feel like that could have also been contributing to the dizziness. It has mostly curbed my sweet tooth, I do endulge in a little bit as dessert towards the end of the night, usually a serving of peanut butter cups, trying to include more fruit as well; But overall just learning to be more mindful of what I'm actually putting in, since I'm eating about 1/3 of what I would have before, so that what is going in is actually nutritious. I haven't started getting back into the gym yet, but am planning on it and becoming more active as the weather is getting nicer. I work from home, and have become accustomed to... remaining warm, since I'm now also cold much more easily.

TL:DR, you have to figure out what works for you, what triggers symptoms more severely and how to mitigate them. Having a support system WITH you, not just online, via people who are willing to make these changes alongside you also makes a HUGE difference.

I am 59 - 5â7â weigh in at 189 and menopausal and Hypothyroidism, As the years pass I keep gaining weight, I have tried other diets, and this is my last resort. I am on my 3rd week of Treatment started at .5 for the 1st 2 weeks and 10 on the 3rd  week I have only lost 5lbs, I have been a bit gassy and lethargic, Minor Nausea when I donât eat, my constipation now is severe but working on it.   I still do get hungry, but the cravings and anxiety eating have gone down and feel satisfied with small meals. I would like to lose 30 lbs. Will keep you posted.

I have been on Wegovy for 1 1/2 years and I have lost 50lbs I am very satisfied. I have tried many other diets and had no success. I am a type 1 diabetic on an insulin pump and very much in control I am feeling so much better I can bend get up off the floor tie my laces itâs amazing. At this point Iâm not losing weight Iâm just maintaining but couldnât be happier.

I have finished my first round of .25 Wegovy and nothing really changed for me. I've read so many reviews by people who have success immediately, so I am currently wondering why I am not having the same experience. My appetite has slightly decreased, but I actually haven't lost weight. I'm exercising and working hard at maintaining a healthy diet. My doctor has increased my dosage to .5, and I will start that this weekend. Has anyone had a disappointing experience at .25, or am I alone?

I just started the first week with my lowest injection. I had some nausea. I am a bit constipated. I feel great, I have no cravings and eat till I am full then done. I am drinking more water. Over all I feel GREAT!! Hope the weight comes off fast. 4 days with this...loving it

I have been taking Wegovy for about 9 months. I am currently on the 2.4 dose. In the first few months I lost roughly 25 lbs. and thankfully had little to no side effects-- I was excited. At the end of Dec I had a 2nd surgery to repair a hernia and due to the extreme pain I wasn't very mobile. I have continued to take the shot, but I have plateaued. Thankfully I haven't gained the weight back, but I am not losing either.
Iâve only been on wegoy for 1 month and I wake up so hungery. I thought it was supposed to stop to hunger. I am now about to start my 2nd month on 0.5 so we will see how it goes .

Most effective weight loss treatment I've ever used. I've been losing at a rate that is slow but very steady.  I am convinced that like many things, the reviews here are naturally an adverse selection in that people with a bad experience are far more likely to write reviews. My only side effects have been tiredness the day after shots, and occassional mild nausea.  The nausea was really just during the first few weeks, I assume as my body was getting used to this. I am 3 months in. 1 month .25 and 2 months .5. This medicine helps me eat less. I'm never starving between meals and when I do eat I simply don't want as much. I have noticed that as the week goes on I get hungrier and I have days where I eat over 2000 calories sometimes when I near my next dose. I am very happy with this med. I've even still been able to enjoy a drink or two on special occasions with no issue.

I have been on Wegovy for 5 weeks. The shots are so painless, I sometimes check to make sure I was the autoject pen actually worked (I inject in my abdoment. I have lost 15 pounds rather effortlessly. The main benefit I have noticed is I am no longer fixated on food. I don't think about eating constantly or have the desire to snack throughout the day nor do I eat voraciously. I started off at 231 pounds (I am a 56 year old male, 5' 10" tall). That weight put me in the obese category with a BMI of 30. After five weeks, I am at 215 pounds. 

I have reduced my caloric intake by at least 1/2. I am fuller faster and can stop eating with food still on the plate. It has also increased my ability to reject evening snacks. I still think about them occasionally but I am able to resist the urge rather easily. 

As far as side effects, there have been a few minor ones. I started off with a dose of .25 mg and on month two it was increased to .50 mg. The side effects I have experienced were mild to moderate and only happened when I ate too much food i.e. binging. When I ate more than a human being should, I had stomach aches, mild nausea, cramps, and acid reflux. Again, this correlates directly to overeating. The psychological effect of cause and effect (eat too much and suffer moderate physical discomfort) is also beneficial to changing my relationship with food.  I learned rather quickly that binging has a negative consequence. 

I think many of the negative stories about Wegovy can be traced to people either being initially given too large a dose or people thinking this is a miracle drug that will allow you to eat the way that made you obese and still lose weight. It is not a panacea that will allow you to continue to overeat. It is a significant resource to curb cravings and slow down digestion making you feel fuller with less food and also holding you accountable for your bad eating habits should you try to continue them. 

I have found that increasing your water intake and adding fiber supplements to your diet can minimize the side effects of constipation and diarrhea. 

My goal weight is 185. If I can maintain my current weight loss trajectory, I should hit that in three to four months. I had almost given up on losing weight until I was able to get this drug. I am extremely happy with the results and feel the minor side effects I have experienced are completely acceptable and manageable. If used as part of a reduced-calorie diet and with added physical activity, I believe Wegovy can help many people reach healthier weights in relatively short periods of time with minimal side effects.

My first dose I had some upset stomach bad gas burping and a little diarrhea. Took my 2nd dose last week and on Saturday night it hit me like a ton of bricks!! Severe diarrhea vomiting gas burping stomach pain. I am down 12lbs but can NOT deal with this type of side effects on a weekly base. so I'm done for now.
Horrible vomiting and explosive Diarrhea for last 2 weeks. Anti vomiting perscription meds do not work. STAY AWAY

I am overweight with a BMI of over 30. I have been taking this medication for two months and have lost 20lbs. I have been trying everything to lose weight for years and this is the only thing that is working for me. The first day I take my injection I do feel cranky and super tired but it subsides after about a day and a half. I still have about 20-30 lbs to lose and I am super hopeful that I can finally reach a healthy weight with this medicine.

I have loss about 20 pounds- since August- The medico makes me feel full and satisfied- like after a good meal. The weight began to come off and I couldnât believe it- Nothing else has worked for me. I do get occasional stomach cramping but it is only after the day I take my injection when the medicine is the strongest.

I stopped Wegovy after the third shot because I have a horrible taste in my mouth.  All food tastes disgusting.  I hope this goes away because I AM hungry, but I am repulsed by food.  Water is even hard to drink... It's like I have a mouthful of pennies all the time.  When I eat, the food is what I imagine dog food covered in lard would tastes like.  Once I start chewing, my food feels foamy, pasty, and is just gross.  This is the most bizarre thing to try to explain
I started with Ozempic and did 8 doses at .25 with no issues,  but since I am unable to get Ozempic, I switched to Wegovy.  I know they have the same active ingredient, but the Wegovy didn't work for me.

First injection- no issue. 
Second- 36 hours later vomiting, diarrhea and terrible spasms in stomach for 3 days. 
Third- 4 days later, stomach spasms, vomiting. 
I am doing my best to get past this. I will decide whether or not to continue after injection #4.

The first few weeks on the lowest doses were great. I didnât think of food 24/7. I made healthier choices and kept us my exercise routine. I plateaued on weight loss so we increased the dosage. I have been sick almost 2.5 weeks now. I have a hiatal hernia and GERD. I take Omeprazole daily anyway, but nothing helps it anymore. Not Zofran, Gas X, or Protonix. The sulfur burps are constant and disgusting. Iâm pretty sure I have a stomach ulcer now. I had one years ago and this feels the same. I throw up everything eat. It doesnât matter what I eat or how much or how little. Iâve lost 6 lbs and several inches off my body. Itâs nice, but not worth the sickness. Iâm not sleeping much before of it. Itâs effecting my work. I ended up in urgent care last week. This week was the last shot Iâll ever take. Iâd rather be fat.

59 yo female with a neurological illness preventing me from exercising as I would like. Last few yrs. Ballooned up to 198 lbs, 5'2" . Started 0.25 the first month. This was all very well.appetite decreased and able to eat sensibly without cravings. Sleep was better and lost 12 lbs in the first month. Month 2, Feb. 2023. Started 0.5 mg. Noticed more feelings of nausea and fatigue,especially the day after the injection. Experiencing more constipation. Just started 1 mg yesterday. Awoke during the night with intense nausea. Zofran only partly helped. Worked all day with nausea only ate cottage cheese. Feels very tired and very constipated. Taking cola e and metamucil alternately at times but can't handle the metamucil. Feels too full like I'm gonna vomit. Total weight loss now 23 lbs in 2 mos. I think I may need to back up to the lower dose. I think I was doing better on that.

I've been obese most of my life. On my last physical my A1c was borderline to diabetes so the dr agreed to put me on Wegovy. First and second week I was fine w diminished appetite. At the end of the second week I started burping these horrible eggy burps. That night was the beginning of the worst. For three days I had projectile diahrrea and vomiting. Terrified of these symptoms I stopped the injections. Went to work for three days and here I am at 2am writing this review. Sick as a dog again. Will have to call in again. For those who are happy w Wegovy, Im happy for you. This is not for me. In the two weeks since I started injecting, and getting sick. I've lost 13#! I want to lose weight but not like this.

This is my 3rd week of taking the beginner dose. Iâve only lost 5lbs. Iâm not hungry and craving sugar all the time and I am able to stop eating when full. Hereâs the caveat:  the copious amount of gas it causes in my system. Stinky sulphur burps and even stinkier gas from the other end. It starts about 1-2 days after the injection and it is continual, painful bloating and gas for the next 48hrs. Extreme fatigue during this time, too. I wonât be taking my last dose.

I have been on Wegovy for just 10 days and have already lost 15 lbs. I have 80-85 lbs to go but I am absolutely astounded that the weight is dropping so quickly at the start. I do expect a plateau at some point, but I am very pleased so far. I just have very little appetite, and I have no desire to drink alcohol. I get a bit nauseous briefly at times, but I just chew a piece of gum and drink a glass of water and it subsides. This is an amazing drug. I am so happy so far.

34 year old female. 5'2" and 168lbs. After first injection, I knew I'd messed up already. I got dizzy, sweaty and nauseous instantly. The next day I was pretty nauseous and so I didn't eat very much. The third day is where it all fell apart. I had a hypoglycemic attack at work from not eating enough due to the severe nausea. I was able to get a few bites of chocolate and crackers down and went home. I'd already messaged my doc about the nausea and he called in some Zofran. My husband picked them up and brought them home to me. I took one and laid down. About an hour later, I sat straight up and flew to the bathroom. I projectile vomited harder than I ever have in my life. I could hardly catch my breath it was coming out so fast. Then the diarrhea hit and I was doing both at the same time. And if that wasn't enough, I had another hypoglycemic attack during all of that. I was pouring sweat. It was running off of me like I was standing in the rain, rapid heart rate, dizzy and my blood sugar was so low I was barely responsive when my husband came to check on me. He called 911 and I stayed 3 days in the hospital receiving fluids, glucose and nausea meds. I'm home now but I'm still nauseous, bloated and my kidneys are hurting now. I'd be very careful taking this poison and double check that it isn't contraindicated with any meds you already take.

BMI >30, menopausal, AA woman with mild spinal stenosis and pinched nerve in left leg. I started Wegovy and just took my 4th week's dose of 0.25mg. I have not had any side effects and found it to be a very effective appetite suppressant. I have, like many others, tried dieting and dieting programs, my last one was Metabolic Weight Loss center. This is a keto-esque program that bids you to increase protein, lower carbs, lots of water, exercise, yada yada yada. But, of course those things don't work very well for me and I feel like a failure, or it does work for a while and then I gain weight again as I live my life. I am a stress/boredom eater, and also eat larger portions that I should. Wegovy was prescribed due to my starting weight of 215 lbs @ 5'7'', and elevated cholesterol levels, which I am on medication for. I did increase my exercise, from nil to trying to go to aquatic exercises, 2-3x/week for 45 mins. So far, I am down to 204 lbs without much effort. I realize that a significant weight loss will be very helpful with my back issues going forward and hopefully will relieve painful flare ups with arthritis, degenerative disc disease, for which i get cortisone injections a few times a year, and allow me to not have to use a CPAP machine.  But, I am a bit concerned that I may begin having side effects with the elevated dosages and may ask if I can stay on lower doses for a longer pd of time, especially since it is working. I read that sometimes people have gallbladder problems if they lose too much weight too soon, so I definitely want to avoid any of that.  Also, to be honest, I am concerned what will happen when I finish with this rx and what tools will I be able to use to keep all or much of the weight off. I will also disclose that I did research all of the common medications for weight loss that are now being used. My Endocrinologist said that Wegovy was one of the better weight loss drugs, and that it not only helps with weight loss but in some cases may save many lives as well from diabetes and heart disease.

Just started yesterday on .25, I didn't mind the injection. But I didn't sleep last night, this morning headache and nausea through out the day and don't feel like eating. I have been sipping Gatorade and water. I hope this feeling doesn't last through the weeks and months a head . I feel like I made an expensive mistake, from reading all the comments.

Absolute HORROR!!! I read many reviews before deciding to give this a shot in desperation to lose weight! I was hoping that the bad reviews were winers but low and behold they were correct!! I consider myself tough with a pretty tough stomach but I got to dose one of the .5 and third night I am still sick as a dog I feel pukey all day and every time I barely eat something healthy in a small portion I feel like Iâm food poisoned for hours!! I took a prescription ondansetron 4 mg for nausea and it didnât touch it, severe headache extra strength Tylenol didnât touch it, diarrheaâ¦ you get the pictureâ¦ I have lost like 1 pound and feel like I was doing better than this on my own! Matter of fact I feel that itâs keeping me from losing any weight which is weird since Iâve barely eaten and normally would lose weight â¦ Iâm questioning the people who are able to stomach this stuff, are you really human or possibly part alien lol. I would NOT recommend this drug, I just hope I havenât damaged my body in any way and canât wait until this drug is washed out if my system, waste of time and money.. the rest is going in the garbage!! Donât do it, thatâs my advice, or youâll be sorry!!

I am about to start my 6th injection (second dose of 0.5mg), so starting my 6th week on this medication. The first month has been all about adjustment and transitioning to a new way of thinking. Wegovy is a tool to help curb appetite and cravings, which it does for me. In the past, while decreasing food intake for weight loss, I was always so hungry  - and now I am not, and this has been amazing. My cravings for salty snacks and sugar have decreased significantly. I eat a smaller amount of the bad stuff and am satisfied. 

My barriers at this point are psychological - I still want to eat too much at the wrong times, I still want to drink wine, neither of which should you do on this medication. Your GI tract slows, and food and drink stay in your GI tract longer. If you overeat, you will feel awful. If you drink too much alcohol, you will feel awful. In an effort not to feel awful, I have been adjusting portion size and when I eat. I am trying to be aware of these issues - this has been why I have only lost about 3-4 pounds in 5-weeks. Still a victory considering how difficult it is for me to lose weight. (50yo F, 5â10â, starting 232#, current 228#.)

The only side effect I had during the first month was fatigue. It was significant! However, my PCP suggested increasing my protein (wow, was I not getting enough), and I also became more mindful of hydration. An increase in protein, and hydration, and a decrease in meal portion and wine turned it around. I feel great now! But it wasnât easy. The struggle is real, still. Lots of work left! Fingers crossed for the next 6-weeks!

Iâve been using this medication for two months now. Have always maintained a very healthy diet. Donât snack at all. Eat a low carb diet.  Drink plenty of water and do cardio a few days a week. I canât lose a pound. Iâm so disappointed:(
Took Wegovy for four weeks.  Never felt so ill.  Stopped two weeks ago. SEVERE depression. Blood sugar crashing - feel so foggy- no energy- WHEN DOES THIS POISON LEAVE MY SYSREM?

Just beginning to use wegovy. I've finished the four week starting doses of .25 . No weight loss yet. 
I want to share that the injector pen is gross to use! The pen requires you to press the needle into your skin, then the auto inject starts. I hate feeling the needle puncture my skin! It hurts!!! I use another type of auto injector pen for different medicine which requires that I push the pen against my skin, then I press a button which quickly plunges the needle into my skin and injects the medicine. That is such a better experience.

I am a caregiver and the patient has lost 40lbs on this medication. I am writing to share in the very poor 1 star section an observation about the comments posted here. First, there are quite a few in which the dose does not begin at .25 but much higher, including in one case 1.7mg because the lowest dose was unavailable. The instructions tell the user to work up the levels starting with .25mg so it is understandable you can become quite sick starting with much higer doses. Second, people claim no weight loss at all despite being on the med for months. However they don't share whether they are exercising and eating a low calorie diet. One person said he lost nothing including his appetite so just ate as normal. Maybe his dose had to be higher? Finally, one person claimed to have extreme vomiting, headaches, etc. and that he was eating 500 calories per day.  500 calories is not a low calorie diet that is starvation. Perhaps that is why he had terrible side effects.  In summary, if you are going to complain and be dissatisfied (or even super happy) do explain the basics about your diet, your exercise, on what dosage you have had the problem.  Thanks for sharing.

I took my 6th shot this week.  I have not had much weight loss, three pounds total but my body losses weight very slowly.  I have noticed that you must make a couple of accommodations to this medication.  1.  Drink water.  Seriously, drink a lot of water.  It truly mitigates the side effects if you don't drink water then you will notice a lot of side effects.  2.  Watch spicy foods. The heart burn is very real if you eat spicy foods or if you skip meals.  You have to do some trials to see which foods your body will tolerate.  I have read about others having issues with fried foods, I don't eat fried foods but I can see it could be problematic.  3. Don't overeat.  Listen to that "full" signal your body is sending you.  Over eating leads to some bad side effects.  Just realize you are only able to take in so much food at once. 4.  Plan what you eat and prioritize nutrient dense foods.  You can only eat so much so you need to plan your meals.  

Adapting to this medication is not difficult if you listen to your body.  I am still learning how to live on this medication but I am confident in the long run it will work.  I also meet with my Doctor once a month to ensure that everything is ok.

Worse side affects from any med I've ever taken!  Started on the .25mg injection and woke up the next day thinking I had covid or influenza because I had HORRIBLE body aches and fatigue. Went to the Dr and was negative for both so then it dawned on me it might be the Wegovy. Could barely  function for the next 3 days I felt so bad and was extremely fatigued. Decided maybe that was just a bad reaction to the first injection so went ahead with the 2nd. 24 hrs later the fatigue is worse, keep falling asleep while working from home and in the evenings. Nauseous and nothing tastes good except for bland food. On overwhelming feeling of severe depression kicked in after the 2nd injection and I've decided I'm done!!

I started with this medication when it was recommended by my Dr due to being overweight, unhealthy, feeling poorly about myself and nothing else truly continuing to help/work including excessive exercise.  I have noticed as I have gotten older it is in my head with the thought I am hungry plus I am a stress eater so I needed help more so with the âfood intakeâ piece.  I started this journey in September starting at 247 pounds.  I do t want to pretend it has been so wonderful because my body has definitely seen the wrath in good and bad ways.  I started out the first month at .25mg and am now in January 2023 worked up to 2.5mg.  The first month I didnât see much in weight loss but definitely noticed a HUGE difference in my appetite.  After the first month I did see the weight start to fall off.  I want to add I was not exercising at all.  My food intake was less and then came some of the not so pleasant things.  Diarrhea, stomach pain, breaking out in a full body sweat but thankfully no throwing up.  However, all of that I described was just as bad.  This would happen when I would make a poor food choice that maybe had a little grease or spice in it.  I did pay for these decisions and for a while I thought this was going to be the new norm and I along with my husband asked myself more than once is it worth it.  I can still say almost February 2023 it is.  I havenât had one of those spells at 3am for a long time now but I also donât eat like I once did.  I am now down over 40lbs and still have a ways to go with this journey.  I will say and want to stress everyone is different including how your body will react to this.  Just like any weight loss you want to take this slow and start with the lower dose to get your body used to this as well as that is what your Dr should be giving.  I know we are a world who wants to see results right now but with this you will just give it time and donât force higher doses or you could be quitting before you truly begin due to side affects.  Some takeaways for me.  When you are prescribed this make sure to ask for some anti nausea medication as well.  I have zofran and I am positive that is the only reason I didnât have vomiting with my side affects.  If you have sulfer burps which I started experiencing the end of December get on some anti acid medication.  I take omeprezol and it is a life saver.  Also try and remember why you are doing this.  I look at my parents (who I have now introduced to this as well) and want to be on better health and be there for my husband, kids and now grandchild.  You have to consider what is best for you.  Donât feel guilty for wanting to help yourself, just be smart about it.  We all go at different paces and I do believe after the research and my own experience this works.  Good Luck

Been on Wegovy for 3 weeks now.  The first week I actually felt full for the first time in 40 years where I didn't want to keep eating like I usually do.  I literally cried.  Feeling full is such a wonderful feeling.  I do need to train myself to stop eating when I'm full, that it's ok to not eat everything on my plate since I'm a compulsive overeater and that it's taboo to leave food on your plate. Once I eat my first meal of the day and I'll stop when I'm full, I'm then full for the rest of the day and don't even want to eat dinner.  I believe that eating very small meals during the day will be a benefit for me in making sure I don't starve myself. I really don't want to eat because of feeling full and that's scary for me.  I am getting help professionally in re-teaching my mind.  My sleep schedule is off, I'm wide awake at night and I do get sick to my stomach with a headache more so in the evening then during the day.  I've also noticed that my taste buds have changed and I'm not tasting the food that same way before I started Wegovy.  I've also noticed that my sense of smell is off as well.  I am so stoked to losing 100 plus pounds and pray that I'll be able to stop taking Wegovy without going back to my old ways once the weight is off. Long way to go so I'm not dwelling on it.  Good luck to everyone who is taking Wegovy for weight loss.

F, 52, BMI 35, 5'2", starting weight 195 lbs.

I've tried and failed at diets and exercise programs for most of my adult life. I can lose weight with extreme calorie restriction and exercise, but the miserable extremes I have to go to are unsustainable in the long-term. Now menopause is looming, and the weight has been creeping up, even with diet and exercise. 

I started 0.25 mg Wegovy in late Dec, and will be taking my 4th shot tomorrow. I have experienced mild appetite suppression, enough to help me shed almost 3 lbs so far (yeah, it's still hard). I have definitely reduced my food intake, and do find it easier to eat smaller portions and make healthier choices, as my cravings are somewhat reduced. I found that my 3rd shot didn't produce the same appetite suppression as the first two, so I'm hoping that graduating to 0.5 mg will give stronger effects. I travel a lot for work, so it can be difficult to make healthy choices on the road, but Wegovy does seem to help.

I have experienced very mild side effects: slight nausea (mostly just when I wake up an night to pee) and constipation (I suffer with this anyway, and take Metamucil, stool softeners, and magnesium). The last few days I've become exhausted in the afternoons and MUST take a quick nap, but I've also been under a tremendous amount of work/family stress, so that could explain it. 

Overall I'm happy with Wegovy, and feel optimistic for the future. My (new as of 1/1/23) insurance provider (BCBS) denied my pre-auth due to lack of 3 months of diet and lifestyle modification, but my doctor is appealing, as I've been doing that for 30 years! Fingers crossed.

I took one injection of .25 of Wegovy.  It started working almost immediately.  Iâm on several medications for heart related issues from Covid but all was stable.  Was nervous about taking this medication but did my research and discussions with doctors.  After a few days of the injection I developed a severe allergic reaction of hives/ rash.  Iâve still lost about 6 pounds in the past week but unfortunately canât continue.  Iâm one of the very few people who this has happened to, however, it was a possible side effect.  I worried about the other side effects, however, I didnât experience any of those.

I was prescribed Mounjaro first. I followed Mounjaroâs plan for 3 months until the $25 trials ended. During the mounjaro trial I lost 45 pounds in 90 days. I need to add I went on a protein shake diet. There were a few carbs thrown in there, but I really tried to go to as few carbs as possible. 

Now that Wegovy is available again and my insurance covers it, Iâm on Wegovy. I started on a low dose compared to where I was on Mounjaro. The 1st week didnât produce much weight loss or appetite control. My Doc doubled my dose and I definitely can feel a difference. My appetite is gone again. 

One word of warning about Mounjaro. In my case the constipation was off the chart. I had to be very careful what I ate and if was much at all (a slice of pizza at a party did 
me in) I had to use stool softeners, a laxative and eventually drink mineral oil to break up the road block. Seriously bad situation. Be careful.

I have never had a feeling of satiety naturally. Wegovy keeps me feeling full and allows me to make good choices with serving size. I have only taken it twice. The first week I lost 6 pounds because I just felt satisfied with very small servings and lasted so I could make it meal to meal. With that being said, I did make healthy-ish choices: soup, salad, salmon, grilled chicken...It is painless and easy to use. I was nervous to administer my own shot but they made it very easy. I am tolerating it very well. I feel lucky that I have only slight nausea and fatigue but it subsided after 1 day.

I started Wegovy in April 2022 at 269 lbs. and I am now 212 lbs. Sometimes I feel nausea but it doesnât last long. I can go all day without eating so it does curve the appetite, but I have to make myself eat something so I can drink my ??. Everyone is different when it comes to the side effects that others have mentioned, but I recommend this medication for weight loss.

This medicine may be horribly sick.  I vomited for three days, severe headache and fatigue for seven days.  I couldn't even keep water down.  I was too afraid to keep taking it since I had such a terrible experience on week one.

I am glad I didnât allow these reviews to prevent me from starting!  Reducing oneâs weight is never going to be easy and this does require trial and error at first.  Very few issues after 6 weeks. I now inject on Friday evenings in case I am mildly tired Day One or Day Two.  Never both days.  Ask your doc for an anti-nausea medication before you start as you may need it the first several weeks.  Works great!    One that doesnât make you drowsy.  Also have Tums and/or Pepcid. You will quickly learn sitting up straight allows you to quickly release acid buildup. Immediate relief.  Will also need to increase fiber and perhaps consider stool softener.  Stay on top of this and donât hesitate to ask your doc about your symptoms versus being miserable.  As with any weight loss, a steady, but small decline is great.  Donât worry if you plateau on occasion.  But we canât continue eating the same things and not exercising!  Iâm not a clinical person but I do suspect some people have more issues because they have more health issues overall.

Iâve lost 43lbs in 9 months with little to no side effects. I love this medication. But Iâm worried about gaining the weight back once my insurance company will no longer cover it. Right now Iâm approved for another 3 months, stay tuned.

I started this journey 6 weeks ago and have dropped 12 lbs so far.  I find that if I overeat or eat fried foods I get nausea and diarrhea .  This is the first medication(I've tried lots) that has actually worked for me.  I am definately sticking with it.

The center started me on the 0.25 dose for 3 weeks, then bumped up to 0.4 last week.  This week, I expected to see a big drop, as last week I went up 0.2 lbs.  I am extremely disappointed.  My food intake has decreased.  I did not have the nausea, vomiting and diarrhea that some have reported.  I was not eating much when I started the medication, and that may be why.   I did have extreme fatigue which I countered by drinking Zipfizz (electrolytes and vitamins - specifically B).  I was ready to quit and they bumped me up this week, so we'll see if I start losing.  I started at 268 and now am at 263.2.  Less than 5 lbs in 4 weeks.  For the cost and the risk, so far it is not worth it.  In 2019 I lost almost 40 lbs doing Keto and Carb Manager.  My weight started creeping back, and I thought I'd try this "no diet" wonder drug.  I was hoping that using this medication would allow me to put fruit and whole grains back into my diet and help me limit those carbs.  Unfortunately, it just may be for my body, Keto is the only plan that works.  I just got sick of counting everything.  The center said that you don't really start losing weight until the dosage is increased and that they want to make sure your body tolerates it well.  I paid for 10 weeks, but am thinking that it just isn't going to be effective for me.  I would have been happy with 2 lbs per week, which, I don't think is too much to ask given the cost.  If I have to count carbs and calories, what is the point?  Keto keeps away the insulin spikes so you're not hungry.  This was supposed to be effortless... but if you've already changed your diet and don't eat much, it just might not work.  Maybe it's my age and being post menopausal.  I was hoping to lose weight to save my joints more than vanity.

I started Wegovy on 2/1/22 weighing 244 lbs at only 5'5". As of today, I am 149lbs. For the first 3 months I did experience some pretty severe nausea and vomiting. I found if I would wake up 30 minutes before I actually needed to get up, took a 4mg sublingual Zofran, then laid back down for 30 minutes, the nausea was bearable. I always take my shot before bed and I would do this regimen the day following my shot and up to 3 days after. I was hospitalized once, around month 4, for dehydration. It is very important to stay hydrated. But I am happy to report, after month 4, I now have zero side effects and feel AMAZING. I have struggled with obesity my entire life. I have tried every diet, I have hired the trainers, worked out 2 hours a day 7 days week, meal prepped, counted macros, etc. You name it, I have done it. For this first time in my life, I have had success! I have never been this small in my life.

Flawless drug. Stopped overfueling in the first 24 hours. Dropped 20 lbs effortlessly. Will stay on this forever as I have 17 of the 22 identified "genes" (we all have them; I just have the bad versions) for obesity and diabetes type II. I stopped both in their tracks. I was not obese but not at an ideal weight, so this ABSOLUTELY can be used by anyone wanting to slim down for personal reasons (and NO ONE should try to tell you that you have a bad reason). As a research scientist, I have a VERY open mind. As a pharmacologist, I understand that not all drugs work for all people especially since behavior is involved and THAT makes you fat (nothing else). This stopped my genetically determined lack of satiety and allowed me to drop weight almost instantly.

I felt a little run down and out of sorts the day after my first shot and then felt fine the rest of the week and then fine for 2 days following my second shot. And then the nightmare began. I developed the absolute worst heartburn I have ever had and then had severe reflux. I constantly felt like I had swallowed a softball. Nothing tasted good. It definitely curbed my appetite though which is the intent of the meds. I tried to stick with the process hoping that my body would eventually adjust. I took nausea meds, Advil for the constant headaches, ate TUMS like candy, and took Prilosec twice a dat. I followed up with two more injections. But the side effects are just too much for me to take. I am nauseated almost constantly, burp all the time, am constipated, have a constant headache and have severe fatigue. I already have bouts of diverticulitis which I think are now aggravated by the constipation. I don't want to lose but about 20 pounds so I think I will have to go another route. This awful feeling all day is just too much. I know my family is sick to death of me being so sick all the time.

This is my second month 6 weeks. Lost 14lbs the first month and 6lbs the last two weeks. This is the easiest weightloss ever. I have tried everything. I eat about half of what I ate before. I walk for exercise but not as much as normal since the weather has gotten cold. No side effects. I did throw up once because I ate a really rich soup. I snack on fruit and sometimes have a little candy. It seems like the weight is just falling off. I love it. 18lbs in 6 weeks. I feel great. I do get constpation but try to drink water and eat high fiber.
Experienced bouts of diarrhea in the beginning but it stooped after a few weeks.

For weight loss (probably more vain, than obese): I waited until week four to write a comment. 
Week 1: I had no side effects, lost 5 lbs. 
Week 2: I had every side effect listed for three days, if you want to know how bad I felt just think of either the worst hangover you have ever experienced, or the worst morning sickness! Luckily I work my own hours so I could stay in bed. But if you have a 9 - 5 job, you will be calling is sick! You cannot function. No weight loss. 
Week 3: Again for three days, I had all of the side effects as week two, but could sorta function. Lost 3 lbs. 
Week 4: Injection last night, and have started to feel sick again. 
Is it worth it? Well I have two more weeks left of a VERY expensive medication. I will power thru it, see if the side effects subside, and what the overall weight loss is and then decide.

Did this medicine work, yes. Took away my appetite for sure. Was it easy to use, yes. Was I satisfied, no. I threw up and had diarrhea for 14 hours. Started an hour after I used the injection. I was not myself for over a week because of this. Now I did start at the 1.7mg dose because that was all that was available. Still debating on trying the lowest dose if it ever becomes available. By far the sickest I have ever been in my life.

I started taking wegovy 9/22/2022 I  am assuming I was given the correct dose which is 0.25. I am very disappointed, it did not suppressed my appetite. I honestly think the makers need to reimburse me. For a very expensive drug like this and no results it's not right. I can honestly say I waste my money

Been on it for exactly one week, it was an interesting week.  I may find that I come back and add another review later that is rated higher, 

 Brief background on me, I have been a gym rat since 2008, very healthy, I eat lean chicken, veggies, and complex carbs, no added sugars, no processed foods and only drink water, green tea, and milk... 

 but I was post-menopausal in my late 30s and which caused massive weight gain (60 pounds), though my diet and exercise never changed.  

Got on HRT and lost 20lbs but could not get under 200lbs. My weight fluctuated between 200-230 for 3 years..  I even intermittently fasted. 

 I asked my doctor about Wegovy and I was given a prescription.  My labs are good, no high glucose so insurance wouldn't cover it.  I filled my script at a compound pharmacy.  They mix it with B12 and I get it for $150 per month. 

 I  need to go from 211 pounds to 150.  The pharmacist told me to take 15-20 units. 

 The next day I took 18 units and felt great!  Not hungry, very focused, no side effects- I always drink a gallon of water a day...  

In comes the nightmare of my first night... 

 I normally take 1/2 of CBD gummy at night to help me get a full 8 hours of sleep... so as usual, I ate it and went to bed at 10 pm.  

At 10:30pm I got super hot, dizzy and massive sweats...so much that my hair was soaked.  I ended up passing out in the bathroom, falling face down... I had to be rushed to the hospital as I kept losing consciousness, I had all the severe side effects, minus nausea.

  After about 7 hours I was released.  

Turns out, that the CDB interacted with it, and plus I was only supposed to take 12 units. The combo of CBD AND taking too much (not preloaded injectors) caused severe reactions. 

 I have been fine since.  

No more CBD!  

 My current problem now is am not sleeping at night.   So I am unclear if the CBD gummy caused the reaction or if it did so because I took too many units of Wegovy.. either way, I am waking up at 3 am.. ugh.  I don't know what to do to stay asleep as I am scared of taking ANYTHING to help me sleep as I never want to experience what I did the first night.   

Taking the sleep issue out of the equation.  I lost 8 pounds in my first week and I feel fine. This is the first time in 3 years the scale or my measurements MOVED DOWNWARDS! 

Those who want to take this: Make sure you tell your doctor EVERYTHING!  

You have to change your diet to avoid nausea, gas, and those types of side effects.   Eating carbs, sugary things or over-eating will cause stomach issues.   

Cool it on the caffeine and get plenty of water.  keep track of your food and how you are feeling and stay in contact with your healthcare provider.  

If I can go back to 8 hours of sleep, then I can raise my rating.  I am looking forward to this journey of finally moving out of the category of Obese!  I will be contacting my doctor to see what we can do about my sleep. Other than that, I am satisfied.

I have lost almost 30% of my body weight - 58 lbs so far in 8 months - taking Wegovy in conjunction with a focus on diet, exercise, sleep and stress management from Calibrate.  Wegovy was an absolute game-changer for me in terms of hunger and being able to portion control.  I have always felt hungry, could not skip meals and this absolutely gave me the power to portion control and take it or leave it in terms of food.  A couple of bites and I am good now!  It's absolutely remarkable.  The side affects are minimal too, some burping and tiredness but nothing consequential.  I'm a 52 yo menopausal woman - 5'7" and now around 137#.

I've only been on the drug for one week.  But I've lost 6.8 pounds.  I want to be clear though.  I was worried about side effects so I've done exactly what my doctor said.  I did not overeat.  I did feel fuller when taking it.  I also generally exercise 5 days per week.  The reason I began the program with Wegovy was because with my regular diet and exercise, I was not seeing results - none.  So, I took drastic measures and got on the program.  So far, so good.

Oh my God I never experienced any thing like it in my life..i only started yesterday 1/10/22..i ate very healthy my first day..felt nausea from the min i took injection..went to bed last night and the vomiting started and the burps were unreal..sick all night..and still dry reaching to day afwul..im afraid to eat..i am done wit it even though it cost me â¬157..ld be terrified to take another one nxt wk..it has been afwul experience..

I started wegovy in March 2022. I'm down 40 lbs. I'm still on wegovy 2.4 mgs but my hunger is back. I've called the wegovy phone number that's on our prescription but I've not gotten any answers or help. My Dr says keep taking it. I'm frustrated without any answers of why this is happening.

Took one dose. I think my doc started me too high at 2 mg.  Threw up violently all day. Nausea body cramps no appetite. I am day 3 post injection now.  Canât wait for it to wear off.  I am done.  Rather be fat

My SW was 199.6 CW is 142.2. Wegovy was fantastic. The only side effect I did experience was a little bit of nausea in the morning. I had used with Wegovy for seven months and have currently been off of it now for four month and continued to still lose weight. My insurance covered it and I had to pay $100 per month, but if you go onto the Wegovy website and sign up for their training you get a prescription card that makes that will go be only $25.

I started off with a BMI of almost 40. I'm barely 5 ft tall and aging. I've fought my weight for so many years that it was depressing and exhausting. I lost over 70 lbs in 2020 and gained most of it back between summer of 2021 into Spring of 2022. I did not know anything about wegovy until Spring of 2022. I've lost an average of 10 lbs a month and I'm currently down 58 lbs going into my 6 months of using wegovy. I hate giving myself a shot but this works. Side effects for me are minimal. Someone else posted it's like a gastric bypass without surgery. I would say compared to what I watched my mom go through because she opted for the surgery this is close on the effectiveness but the side effects are not as bad as undergoing surgery. I would recommend to anyone that has been in the battle for a long time and it seems like nothing works. It works if you stay with it and push through the not so great days. The good days outweigh the bad.
Started Wegovy on 10/2/21 weighing 313lbs. As of 8/29/22 I have lost 100lbs with no exercise! Very little side effects.

I started this medication March of 2022, as I write this it is August of 2022. I started at 247lbs standing at 5â9â I did show as Obese on my BMI. I am now 177lbs which means I have lost 70 lbs in 5 months. This medication is a miracle worker but I have spent about $100 on vitamins, laxatives, and other medications to help with the side effects. If you are serious about weight loss the side effects are just something you have to deal with. I have nausea, constipation, vomiting, low iron, and a multitude of just other little things. I highly recommend buying ginger ale, multi vitamins, vitamin D, and a probiotic to help reduce symptoms. I LOVE WEGOVY!

Started this med with beginning dose and read all potential side effects.  Use some Zofran 1st two weeks for nausea.  I have learned what I can and cannot eat on this medicine.   More of a mediterranean or paleo diet.  Has been wonderful for me.  Lost 40 lbs since March.  Listen to your body tell you it is full.  If you over eat, you will be miserable for a while.  One word of advise... You cannot eat late and go to bed.  You will have indigestion, nausea, etc as mentioned in the other comments.  READ ABOUT THE MEDICINE, then decide it it is for you.

My doctor started me at the 1.7mg level at the first of July.  I've lost 11 pounds even though I skipped a week( the fifth week) when I went on a summer trip that involved a long flight. (I didn't want to be sick over the Pacific and stuck on a plane.) My insurance surprisingly covered it, probably bc I have tried all sorts of things over years to lose weight.  I started off needing to lose 20 pounds but hopefully 30.  I was quite sick with vomiting the very first dose of the first week, for one day.  Hwr, since then I take a Zofran an hour before the injection and do this right before bed.  I have experienced all the negative side effects at some point or another, but feel they are all manageable. I'm a bit frightened to go up to the 2.4mg dose, but I'm just planning ahead for a couple of rough days.The worst for me is the fatigue. I used to work out more, but now I'm without energy. I'm just making the choice to do it anyway, and I do feel better when I do. I do not plan to take this medication for the rest of my life, but I'm not sure how getting off of it looks. I am very curious about the science of this medicine and how to stay at a healthy BMI without it.  I was prescribed Plentity before this, and I stockpiled it with the plan to take it after I finish Wegovy. My doctor isn't sure this will work.

I was surprised to read how many people experienced bad side effects. I did not, fortunately. Some loss of appetite, but I figured that was kinda the point, at least at first. I had a little nasua the 
first week on .5, but it went awayin a couple of weeks and never came back.  When I do eat, I enjoy my food. I am just able to eat less, and less frequently, without being uncomfortable or stressed. I have been on it for about 10 months now, topping off at 2 mg. I have lost over 30 pounds, which since I am short was almost 25% of my body weight and has made a tremendous difference. It would be best if I lose about 7 to 10 pounds more to be at my healthiest weight but have been a little stuck for the last couple of months. My doctor is increasing dose to 2.25 which is still a little lower than the prescribed dose of 2.4 used  in the study. I am optimistic that will do the trick. I LOVE this medication. Highly recommend!!
6 months, lost 25 pounds( out of 237), minor stomach issues. On 2.4mg. Highly recommend.

This has been a complete game changer for me. I can finally feel full with smaller portions, I donât get shaky and irritated when Iâm hungry, and I have lost 10% of my body weight in first 5 months. I did have nausea and tiredness at first but after first few months I havenât noticed it again Iâm still on 1.7 mg and will continue until needing to go up. I love this medication and I am so thankful for the ability to take it as not all insurances cover it.

I think what causes weight loss is the nausea. I'm literally afraid to eat while taking this. The heartburn is like nothing I've ever experienced and now I'm on the 2.4 dose and have decided I am DONE. I will not punish myself anymore with this drug. On this dose I feel nauseous, dizzy, and exhausted as well as the horrid heartburn. I'd rather be fat

So far so good for me. I'm just starting my 14th week (2nd 1.7 dose) and have lost 26 lbs so far. My side effects thus far have been super mild compared to what I've read here; some mild nausea and constipation, but that's really it, and I guess I'm tired a bit, but I can't separate that from the rest of my normal life, stress, whatever. I haven't slept well in eons, so it is more likely related to adulting in general, and not med-related. I get nervous at every jump in strength, but so far, that hasn't been an issue either. I guess we'll find out when I jump to the maintenance dose. My biggest frustration has been with price (my insurance doesn't cover it) and accessibility, and my biggest fear is maintenance when I finally (if I ever) reach my goal weight. This obviously isn't sustainable forever (who can afford that?!) but I will appreciate the jumpstart it's given me, I guess regardless of where I net out down the road. Good luck all!

I have been on Wegovy for 2 months and have dropped 40 pounds. This is good, but it comes at a cost. The drug has totally changed my relationship with food. I always loved food. Every meal was an event I looked forward to, and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. But due to childhood trauma (being starved as an infant), I always ate way too much. Sometimes 3 or 4 times what might be considered a normal portion. 

Since taking wegovy, I can't enjoy food at all anymore. Eating even a small amount makes me feel ill. Swallowing itself causes pain. I've never vomited and the feeling passes eventually. But I no longer look forward to meals and sometimes I'll just skip eating altogether because I don't want to go through the hassle and pain.

I feel like the protagonist in Clockwork Orange. I've been conditioned by a drug to hate one of the things I've always loved most. It's the mental strain of this situation that has caused me the most stress. Far more than the nausea and pain of eating itself. 

But I need to accept it, or face weight related conditions like diabetes, heart attack and stroke. Living longer to see my grandchildren grow up outweighs my passion for food. So, I'll keep taking my shot. Unless they invent a pill that allows you to eat as much as you want and never gain weight.

I definitely lost weight then plateaued at about 7%. My insurance company decided to no approve it so I stopped taking it. I feel amazing though now that I am no longer on it! I didn't realize how negatively impactful it was to my happiness. Not depression just sluggish and indifferent. I am glad I am no longer on it. I just need to figure out how to keep losing weight...

I am on week two of .18mg and I am severely sick. Nausea and dry heaving. I tried to cancel my next vile but the company already charged me and the file is in the mail. I canât return the vile which means I am out a substantial amount of money because my insurance doesnât cover the drug. I am so mad at myself for moving forward with the shot. It also makes me severely tired and depressed!

I got extremely Iâll an hour after taking this. Vomiting violently for 48 hours, horrible heartburn , absolutely no energy. Couldnât eat for two weeks. Iâme going on my third week out of work because of how sick this has made me.

Iâm on my 13th week, and the first week of taking the 2.4 ml strength. Started at 280 lbs. and have lost 35 lbs. so far. By far, the worst side effect has been the vomiting, even with Zofran. Like many here, finding the correct dosage was a challenge, even resulting in delayed refills. I found the vomiting was worse after a delayed dose. I hope to be able to live with the nausea, fatigue and extreme vomiting long enough to lose at least another 80 lbs. I have found that the day of taking Wegovy and the next 3 days are the worst, but of course by then the next dose is around the corner. I have very little appetite, no taste for anything sweet, but crave anything salty. Salted pretzel sticks are my best friend.

Per my insurance I had to try four different weight loss regimen to no avail before they approved Wegovy.  I am on 2.4.  I have lost a total of 40 lbs over 3 years with different meds.  Wegovy worked very well, though I've had side effects. In the beginning I got nauseated, headaches, and I've had severe hair loss.  Hair is growing back. My physician told me to take antacid for the nausea and that worked very well. I started in November 21 and by now the effect is slipping away. I have more hunger and cravings again. I am at a weight plateau for weeks now. Not sure what to do about the effectiveness and I can't find anything about that online. Anybody have the same experience or a tip what to do?  I really don't want to gain any weight back!

I had a positive weight loss experience with this medication but still was often sick and vomiting the next day after taking it.  I only took the medicine for a month and a half because it was just a sample pen.  .25 for first month then .5 for the other two weeks.  My body tolerated the .25 but not the .5 I would be nauseated the day after taking it and vomiting, then it would subside.  I did loose 12 pounds but with the medication I incorporated using the âmy fitness palâ app to track what I ate.  Personally anytime I have been successful at losing weight, keeping track of what I ate was a key factor.

Took the medication for four months did lose some weight but the side effects were terrible. One side effect is the Slowing down on the stomach to empty.  In my case the drug caused a permanent damage  with my stomach no longer being able to empty on its own. I had to stop taking the meds, see a gastro physician abx was diagnosed with gastroparesis.  The only way for my stomach to now empty properly is with the assistance of a neurotransmitter that has to be implanted into my stomach. I now live with a lifelong condition thanks to this drug.  No weight loss is worth it.

I have only been on this med for 1-2 months but i was previously taking saxenda at full dose and it wasnât doing anything for me so i switched to wegovy and my dr started me at the 1.7 dose and then after 2 weeks to the 2.4 due to pharmacy shortages. Most of my side effects are during the first few days of the injection. I have lost 10 lbs within the first month but then nothing so far since. I have considered stopping multiple times due to the side effects. I have random bouts of nausea but worse in the morning when first waking up and i take a few drinks of pickle juice and it goes away usually. Worse than the nausea for me is the intense fatigue. I nap daily and have no energy to exercise for the first few days after my injections. On the lower doses i was getting outside and exercising but it causes so bad fatigue and weakness itâs hard now. All in all for me, i donât think losing 10 lbs has been worth giving up my entire summer being sick form this med and unable to enjoy stuff. Perhaps if i had a 30 or 40 lb loss that would be different. I plan to give it 2 more weeks and if i havenât lost at least 8 lbs Iâll stop it.

I take Semaglutide 1mg/0.5mL for diabetes/metabolic syndrome. I tried 2mg to also help with weight lose and I know why it makes you lose weight. about 2 days after I took 2mg I was sick at my stomach so much that I was projectile vomiting. I couldn't eat anything for 4-5 days without getting horrible belching, nauseous, stomach cramps, dizzy, diarrhea, or all of the above. Needless to say I will be searching other options for weight loss.

I am 48 and started at 185lbs. I was on .25 for a month with no side effects or benefits. The pharmacy couldnât get the next two dosages for months, so my doctor okâd me to jump to 1.7mg. I got very sick for two days, only side effects after that have been constipation. I just started my second month on 1.7mg and Iâm only down 3lbs. I doubt that has anything to do with the meds. My appetite hasnât changed at all. Iâm hoping the next dosage up will be where I start seeing weight loss. Iâve tried every other weight loss drug available, including phentermine, ozempic, rybelsus, topiramate etcâ¦.Iâve worked with dietitians, physical therapists, and weight loss specialists with not one pound lost. I was hoping Wegovy would be what my body wanted. So far, Iâm disappointed. I still have hope tho!

I started in Feb increasing the dosage until I got to 2.4 so 4 months later I've been at a standstill on losing weight started at 214 and down to 191 which is where I've been the last 2 months, some of my urging to snack in the late evening are coming back. The lower dosage seemed to work better than the higher dosage. I had one day I threw up on the 2.4 dosage but that was the only time.

Drug has been life changing. I started back at Thanksgiving 2021 at a weight of 357 lbs, I'm 6'3. I'm currently at 250. I no longer take any blood pressure medications, or water pill for swelling. I'm no longer pre diabetic. The side effects are mild. My side effects are basically zero. Some mild stomach upset from time to time(if I eat the wrong things, high fatty foods ECT). I can't stress how much this drug has changed my entire life.

Iâm at the end of the 1mg dosage and start 1.7mg next week.  So far I am down 26 pounds and have managed to loose weight weekly.  My appetite has definitely decreased tremendously, it really surprised me how quickly it worked.  Some of the side effects I have had are nausea, constipation, diarrhea and abdominal cramping.  The cramping is definitely uncomfortable but fortunately only happens to me about once a week.  Iâve also noticed if I eat certain foods 
(greasy foods mostly)  it can make the cramping worse. Overall  I eat pretty healthy and have no cravings for sweets or chocolate! I will eat it on occasion but do not get the same satisfaction from eating it as I did pre-wegovy.  Itâs very important to drink a lot of fluids, on days I feel blah I will drink Gatorade or Powerade zero and that has really helped. I have also taken Zofran a handful
of times in the last 10 weeks. Iâm very happy with the results and  each week it gets easier to tolerate.   I have no regrets and have recommended it to others and am very hopeful I will get to the max dose of 2.4.  as far as supply I have been lucky and  able to find it. Most of the shortages are with the .25-1mg. dose, I did have to call four pharmacies to find the 1mg. 
Overall, I am pleased with the results and will continue to use it.

Taking wegovy has definitely decreased my weight, but only because tge medication caused complete loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, extreme fatigue, dizziness, headache, abdominal cramping.  I was barely able to eat or drink much water.  When I did eat, I would always get nauseous and would eventually vomit.  I lost 20lbs in 7 was but purely due to starvation.   I have never felt worse.  I dont recommend this medication.
I game changer for me. 25# down but the bigger take away is the shift in my relationship with food and eating. I am thrilled.

Iâm a 56 year old female, 5â11â and started out at 227 pounds. I have struggled with my weight since high school. Like many, Iâve had temporary weight loss successes, regaining everything and then some, each time. My realistic goal is to be 195lbs. My ideal goal is 180lbs. I have currently lost 23 lbs and have been on the program for approximately 6 weeks.
 I began the standard titration schedule in April 2022. Luckily, my insurance covers the medication!! Due to a pharmacy glitch, I only had one of the .25 doses before jumping to .5. The result was 3 miserable days of the gut wrenching vomiting described elsewhere in these reviews. I contacted Novo Nordisk to ask questions and report my experience and was told I would be receiving a call, which I never got.
My titration schedule since the week 2 glitch, has been smooth. Iâve chosen to have my Rx filled by a large mail-out pharmacy, reasoning that they will get inventory priority over my small town local pharmacy. So far I have not experienced the medication shortages suffered by others. 
I am currently one week in on the 1.7 dose. I have no intention of stopping the medication, but it is definitely not a walk in the park.
Intermittent nausea, deep fatigue, headaches, constipation, general feelings of yuckiness, plus  my initial bout with vomiting, have made this a difficult journey. Zofran is my friend. My goal is to stay on the medication for at least two months at the 2.4 dose, giving my body plenty of time to adjust.  My credo is that I would rather be sick for a little while than fat for the rest of my life. 
I have had no hair loss (an adverse effect  reported in these reviews but not in the Wegovy literature), nor have I had any other serious or life threatening side effects.
Like most, I have an extremely reduced appetite as well as a distinct change in the type of foods I find appealing. Like another reviewer, I canât tolerate heavy greasy foods. Fresh and frozen fruit are my favorites. I have increased thirst and find myself guzzling ice water (I also happen to live in New Mexico which has literally been on fire for the past 6 weeks, contributing, Iâm sure, to my feelings of being parched).
Overall, Iâm extremely grateful to finally have a chance at real and lasting weight loss. My knees hurt less, my self image has improved, my clothes are more comfortable and less tent-like. Moving around is easier in general. Iâm no longer embarrassed by how much food I consume. Iâm still too ashamed to be seen in a bathing suit, but soon even that will be a possibility (I want to start swimming again). I have hope again.

WAgovy has been working for me well. I so hope I can get it field. I ha e had the tardiness an every o ce in  while my stomach will hurt when I eat. I get full faster. My hunger is curbed well. It's amazing.  I wish all the people that have tried it had a better response. For me it's amazing.  Thankyou . I sure hope it can be filled. I'm on the highest dose. One week in on it. I will start my 2nd week next wensday 
 So far I have lost 50lbs I'm thrilled an I'm working on 70 more. That would put me at 130
135. I sure would be tickled to get down to that. 150 would  be fine to. I'm a very satisfied women.

I was excited to try this medication as my Dr. thought my results would be beneficial.  I had no health problems except being overweight.  Three days after my first injection, i developed severe chest pain.  I was taking my ambulance where i developed pericardial effusion and was hospitalized for 2 weeks.  I also developed A-FIB.  Being a had a complete physical one month prior and everything checked out alright.  I can help but believe this medicine was the culprit.  Needless to say, I DID NOT TAKE AGAIN.  Be careful as I did not tolerate this medication.  I do know others that have done well.

I have been on the drug since October and have lost 40 pounds. Cycled through 0.25, .05 and 1.0 doses with no major issues. Started 1.7 dose just as I got COVID. Horrible side effects (almost ended up in the ER from dehydration) and could not tolerate the 1.7 dose so my PCP recommended I go back down to 0.5 and cycle through again until my body could handle the higher dose.

Just finished my time on 0.5 dose and now cannot get any 1.0 dose pens from my pharmacy. The drug manufacturer has no supply of 1.0. Apparently there is now a national shortage. They are saying they should have some in "the second half of 2022". Not sure what that means - June? December? Glad the manufacturer is being so transparent. My pharmacy told me to start calling around to see if anyone has any Wegovy and they will transfer my prescription. Who has time for that? 

Basically this drug manufacturer has left their customers high and dry. There was ZERO communication that there was a supply problem. I would not have cycled through doses a second time if I had known I was going to have to go off it again. I won't be waiting around for them to decide to actually supply the drug to consumers. I certainly will not be cycling through doses a second time.

For anyone who has not started Wegovy - don't bother. Since they cannot guarantee supply, I would not start down this road. You can't just stop, start and jump doses unless you want potentially severe side effects. 

Clearly this drug manufacturer does not care about the people using this medication since, "Novo execs are pleased with Wegovyâs launch so far." Not sure how they are pleased with a launch that leaves patients high and dry and having to discontinue use of the drug after MONTHS of stepping up doses. This drug costs me $1300+ per month so this is not something I take lightly, not to mention the health impacts. I feel I have wasted over $10,000 in drug costs. Glad Novo is "pleased" with that.

Almost at the 3 month mark and am > 40lbs down. Started at .25 and am now on 1mg with no plans to increase as this is already incredibly wildly effective and I don't need it to be more effective. I am now in the 'normal' weight range per BMI chart for the first time since I was in my teens. I could not be more thrilled. Now my doctor and I are trying to figure out how to titrate back down the dosage and hopefully not re-gain the weight.
Just getting ready to start month 3 and itâs not even available. From what I have read wonât be available anytime soon. I paid 2 months of this for nothing. Not impressedâ¦

I just finished my 1 mg and had to stop because Iâve had constant vomiting, to the point that Iâm throwing up poop, so one of the cause effects happened to me that you have to stop taking the drug. Currently on the way to the hospital to find out whatâs wrong
But the first dose I was fine, second dose I had nausea and just started taking zofran but this last dose has been a nightmare BUT Iâve lost 25 pounds.

Four months in and I've lost 16 pounds. Titrated up to 1.7 dose with minimal side affects. Only thing I've noticed is occasionally dizziness and headaches. Along with sticking to a low calorie diet along with walking at least 30-45 minutes 5 days a week this seems to he working well so far. Started mid Jan 2022. Get full very fast which is something I've never been use to, lol. Really helps curb appetite. Hopeful for no additional side affects. Goal to lose another 30lbs.

I just took my 9th shot 1g. Doing it for 2 months I have lost 22lbs. I workout at the Gym 3 times a week and eat 2000 calories per day. I am so happy with the results and very little to no side effects.

I started Wegovy in mid-September 2021, from 0.25mg, and took the last shot on March 28th @2.4mg. I'm off the Wegovy since then and keep my weight as is, I exercise and pay attention to what I eat (I did that during the time that I took Wegovy as well). altogether I lost 50lb and I feel much better with my body, I had no side effects luckily, and felt great the whole time. I'm looking to get back on the program but unfortunately, my insurance does not cover Wegovy. Hopefully, there will be another promotion via my doctor that I will have an option to get on this program again :-).

3rd shot..no weight loss at all. Nauseated..yuke..get explosive diarrhea. Plus my damn hair is falling out...I don't like that at all. Not sure I'll continue.. because if this is the way you have to loose weight by puking and diarrhea...nope 
..makes no sense.

0.25: on this dosage for 4 weeks. Nausea the first few days after taking a dose, but not bad. Noticeably less hungry and less cravings. Slight fatigue. 

0.5: noticeably more fatigue and nausea. Still losing weight (down from 177 to 165 at this point). HORRIBLE diarrhea 3 days after 2nd dose- could be period related but omg Iâve never experienced that kind of pain before, which lasted about 12 hrs. 

1: I just took my second dose of 1mg. Not hungry at all. Fatigue not as bad this week. Nausea is almost crippling, but Iâm trying to stick it out. Down to 161lbs. 

Overall, for me, this med has been very effective as far as weight loss, but very difficult to enjoy normal life with the side effects. I will probably quit when I finish this pack. 

Also, itâs $860 per month with the discount from manufacturer, which is ridiculous.

I took the injections for a little over two months with no side effects and great weight loss.  My problem started just into my third month.  My hair start falling out in big clumps.  I am 7 months into stopping it and I had had to cut my hair short as I had so many lengths it looked awful.  I have been a stressful time.  I called the company to let them know of my hair loss and someone was supposed to call me back but never did.  I still do not see hair loss on the Wegovy site as a possible side effect.  I wish it would get put on as one just so people can make a decision as to if this is something they can live with.

Similar to many reviewers: 1) it has worked, 10% body weight in three months, because I never feel hungry- and when I do eat, the portions are minuscule.  I canât abide anything greasy, spicy, or unhealthy, so that helps, too.  2) The side effects range from tough to terrible.  Fatigue, hair loss, constipation AND diarrhea, but the worst for me is the horrible nausea. I vomited every time I increased a dose and often for no apparent reason.  This is full-on, empty-your-entire-stomach-until-your-throat-is-scraped-raw-vomiting.  Yesterday I moved to 1.7 and have had constant vomiting and diarrhea.  I will be not taking another dose of 1.7 because despite the clear effects on my weight, I canât let this drug ruin my life in this way!  I will see if I can go back to 1.0, since the nausea was intermittent and handled by Zofran at that level.

Easy to use. I took for 4 months and had no side effects until the 1.7 mg dose, but also sadly not much weight loss. My appetite was lessened, but I continually lost and gained within a 5 pound range. For me, that is not worth the bloating, belching and (during my period) extreme dizziness and diarrhea I experienced at the 1.7 dose. I've stopped the medication. Insurance was not going to cover the drug after my 6 month coupon period ended anyway.

After taking my first shot of the 1.0 mg, within 6 hours I was vomiting every hour.  2nd day that was reduced to every two hours. The nausea was horrible and the stomach pain really bad.  Third day my husband dragged me to urgent care where I had severe dehydration.  After 4 hours of tests and 3 bags of fluid and anti-nausea drugs I was released to go home.  It's been a week since all that happened, and my stomach still is not 100%.  I'm going back to losing weight the old fashion way by smaller portions and daily walks.  I have issues with my thyroid and losing weight is very difficult, but I don't want to ever feel that awful again.  I'm glad others have had success, it's just not for me.

I work for Bariatric and Medical weight loss for my local hospital. I have NEVER had weight issues. I started putting on weight in my mid 40's. I'm very active...I play softball a few times a week, crossfit (LOVE), 5k's and did bootcamp while doing crossfit. I'm NOT a big eater & I don't like fast food much. I eat decent but was told not enough. At lunch I always walked over a mile but I continued to "BLOW UP"...literally! I found out I had Hashimoto disease which explained the bloating. Once I started my medicine for that my weight started to come off. Our drug rep came in one day with Wegovy. I asked my doctor in my office about it & was told I could try it. Me and some of the nurses started taking it. The side effects weren't to bad at first. The 3rd & 4th month was HORRIBLE! I was having IBS attacks...vomiting & #2 at the same time, tired, burping more. If I ate something...which wasn't much...if I sat down to watch tv I started feeling like I was bloating up, like I had to burp. Once I stood up I would burp & I could immediately feel the bloating going down. Then I would have attacks if I drank my protein shakes. Then I had attacks if I drank milk. I tried Almond milk & I had attacks....so I stopped drinking any form of milk. I was told by the drug rep that Wegovy doesn't do well with people that doesn't have a gallbladder...which I don't. I have lost over 20pds but I'm sure my thyroid medicine helped with that as well. I noticed since taking Wegovy I have lost some of my muscle mass which for EVERYONE is not good. You want your fat mass to go down & your muscle mass to go up. As I'm reading some of these reviews, I'm reading that some are losing a lot fast. That isn't good & it is probably muscle mass, not a lot of fat mass. 
Another side effect for me and another coworker was gag reflex. I was brushing my teeth & then tongue and I literally vomited!! NASTY!! I took my last shot this week & I'm done. I'm glad it has helped some people BUT remember to consume 85 plus grams of protein & more if you are exercising more. Drink a lot of water and do weight training!!

Started on .25 in November and every month moved up and am now on 2.4. Greatly reduced appetite has enabled me to sustain weight loss program. Post-menopausal and 60 - have lost 36 pounds in the winter with less than normal exercise.  Very effective in supporting weight loss - few people understand that some people experience hunger more than others and this medication significantly reduces appetite.

This is the best weight loss drug I have ever tried! Started in Jan. 2022 and so far down 38 pounds as of today. I have another 50lbs to go but am now more confident than ever that I can reach that goal. I have been overweight my entire adult life but menopause really put me over the edge. Nothing else I have tried has worked like this. Currently on the 1mg but am moving up this week. Unlike others, I have had very few side effects. A little sick to my stomach and a little dizzy but that is it.  Nothing I can't handle. My energy level has actually increased which is not something I have heard. This has been a true miracle for me!

This medication has definitely curbed my appetite. Since I was a kid I have always been a hungry person and never able to go more than a few hours without eating. I typically compensated for years by extreme exercise.  After combining Covid isolation plus menopause I was obese and not feeling good. Wegovy combined with a low carb diet and exercise has made the pounds continue to fall off. I can now eat literally half or less of what I would eat normally with no stress. My brain really just tells me now thatâs enough. Thankful for science and this great advancement for weight loss!

I started taking wegovy February 9 th 2022 weighing 176 pounds . I am down to 144 pounds now and itâs April 2022â¦ Iâm very happy with the medication Iâve had no side effects and feel great â¦.

Iâm 53, post menopausal with Hashimotoâs thyroiditis  and have had a very difficult time getting scales to budge. I started Ozempic at 0.25mg in January weighing 156lbs 5â4â. My endocrinologist slowly increased my dose staying at the 0.5mg dose for 8 weeks to adjust to the GI side effects. I recently increased to Wegovy 1mg and had a tough adjustment,( abdominal pain, fatigue, just feeling run down, GERD with feeling like everything I ate just sat in my stomach for 48hrs. ) however, it slowly improves over the first few days, now itâs April and Iâve lost 23 lbs, down to 133 and feeling like itâs been worth it.
