The pen is simple to administer.  I just started my 2nd round (5th week) still at .25, and already lost 11 lbs. Although Iâve lost weight, Iâm not going to sugar coat the side effects.  For me itâs the  sudden nausea with bloating, constipation and fatigue.  By now, Iâm learning to manage by using OTC nausea medication and stool softener. Sometimes I want to stop using it because of the symptoms, but seeing the lbs come off keeps me going.  The medication really does curb your appetite dramatically.  I donât feel hungry at all.  Every patient will react differently but you wonât know until you try it.  I canât see myself increasing the dosage right now.  I donât think I can handle a higher dose.

I got VERY VERY sick at 1.0 dose. I had to go to the ER because I couldn't hold any food or liquid down. Also I had constant diarrhea. 
I am going to let everything get out of my system and then start over, but will STOP at .5 dose. 
I have a sensitive stomach so I am not surprised I experienced every side effect. I did not have any issues with .25 or .5. 
The medicine did curve my appettite. I am diagnosed with hypothyroid so I wasn't feeling the full sensation before this drug. I will be very careful with this drug the second time around.

I am so pleased with my progress. Started Wegovy mid- October 2021, Iâve lost 49lbs as of today. Itâs truly been a miracle for me, my appetite is very small and I get fuller, faster, which is the whole concept of this hormone. My doctor and I have decided to stay at 1.7 since Iâm doing so well, that way we have a backup. This past month I will say I feel like I need to titrate up, as I donât seem to be getting full and Iâm starting to think about food more. I would like to know if anyone else has noticed a decline in effectiveness. Iâm still happy, plan on taking it forever if needed, with my success, itâs clear my body was depleted of this hormone. The majority of my weight came off in the first couple of months, now Iâm steady, losing a pound or two occasionally, Iâd be happy here, although my goal is to be 11lbs lighter. Stick with it, I had nausea up to 1.7, now itâs non-existent. Keep a bag of saltines with you, have a couple when you experience it. Highly recommend this drug.

I have been taking Wegovy for approx 6 months.  Have lost weight and I am going to stick with it.  But after I went up to the 2.4 I started experiencing sensitive skin on my arms, legs and back.  It felt like sunburn but there was no rash, no redness.  It was very weird!  At times it was severe, especially on my back.  I actually went to my doctor thinking I had shingles.  But it has for the most part gone away.  I am still having just a small amount of sensitivity in the skin on my back.  My sister started Wegovy after me and started having the same sensitivity in her skin.  That's when we realized it must be from the Wegovy.  I have noticed my hair is dry feeling.  But over all once I got past the "sunburn" feeling, I am pleased with it.

I started Wegovy 9 months ago and have lost 25 pounds (210 down to 185) and I would like to drop another 20.  I am on the full maintenance dose and the weight loss seems to be leveling off.  I have not tried to lose weigh--it has just happened due to decreased appetite.  Finally something that works!  I have always had a big appetite and after menopause it really became a problem.  It seems incredible to me now that I'm not needing to eat as much.  I avoid junk foods but still have a strong sweet tooth and indulge in sweets fairly regularly.  In have had constipation, some low level nausea, some fatigue, and tingling skin at times, but not to the point of stopping Wegovy.  These side effects are mostly felt on day 2 and 3 following the injection.  By week's end they are typically gone.  Side effects also occurred when moving up to the next dose level.  But after a week at the new level the side effects dimished each time.  I lingered at .5 for two months rather than going to the next level and did the same spending two months on 1.7 because I didn't want to deal with the side effects.  Once I took the plunge and made it to 2.4, I was glad I went for it.  The first few days at 2.4 were rough but I'm okay now.  I'm about to begin my second month on the maintenance dose and am hopeful that the weight loss will continue.  I think it will because I am just not craving all the calories.  My doctor provided me a Rx for nausea, which I have only used a few times.  Also, I have continued on 10 mg of Omeprazole for acid reflux that I had taken for 5 years prior, and I did not need to increase it once I started Wegovy. I also take thyroid medication without incident.   The weight loss has really helped my arthritus knee pain,  and I feel that has been worth the trade-offs .  My doctor is pleased that the weight is coming off slowly because, she says, it is more likely to stay off that way.  I am concerned that if/when I stop taking Wegovy my appetite will return along with the weight.   But for now I am very pleased with the progress and I have no plan to stop anytime soon.

I have been on Wegovy since December 2021. I have lost 20 lbs. One month I stayed on too low of dose .25 mg and it did not work. You have to go up each month. I do get body aches (like Fibromyalgia) all over until the 5th or 6th day (before I take a new shot). No nausea. I am at 1.0mg. I am debating if I should go up to the 1.7 mg. I do not like the body aching all the time. My appetite has changed for the better. I eat very small meals now. I now walk 2.5 miles a day for 4 to 5 days a week.

No problems initially with the lower doses. Not much weight loss. HOWEVER, starting the 1.7 dose yesterday... woke up this morning throwing up bile. Had heavy chest and back pain. Thought I was having a heart attack! Called paramedics. Everything checked out but I still have heavy chest and HORRIBLE reflux. I'm DONE!! The 10 lbs I have yet to lose is NOT WORTH what I'm feeling now.

Iâm 54 with post menopausal weight gain. I started Wegovy in October 2021. Stop in January. Lost 25 pounds. 150 to 125. During the process, had several bouts of nausea as well as severe stomach cramping. I am on thyroid medication for hypothyroidism. Wegovy caused me to become hyperthyroid.  I was losing my hair, I was always cold and could not sleep at night. Iâm not sure that losing 25 pounds was worth using Wegovy. I never made it past .50 The nausea stomach cramps and constipation were more than I wanted to deal with. It is April 2022 and I have lost a lot of hair and my hair became very brittle and is breaking off. I do not recommend this for anyone taking thyroid medication. It is definitely going to interfere with that.

This really has helped my appetite I have always had an appetite 24/7 that was ravenous but wegovy has calmed it down I have experienced tiredness nausea and headaches but nothing that couldnât be managed I  am really hoping it works

I started on 2/11/2022 at 343 pounds. I am titrating up monthly and just took my last .5 before starting 1.0 next week. As of today (4/4/2022) I weigh 315. So almost 30 pounds in 2 months. Diet is mid-keto. Keeping carbs below 35g/day and protein above 80g/day. Have not incorporated exercise into my routine yet. I try to drink around 100+ ounces of water a day. So far no side effects on either the .25 or .50 doses other than fatigue and being constantly cold. But at 55 years of age and going through menopause, I welcome the cold. I am nervous about the higher doses, but I cannot let it bother me. I put off taking my first Wegovy injection due to fear of side effects - and that was a mistake since I haven't really had any so far. Slow and steady is best. My Doc says that anything lost on the lower doses is a bonus as most people see their best weight loss on 1.7 and 2.4 doses. Good Luck to everyone on their journey.

Today would have been my 4th shot. I'm down.16lbs but cannot eat, nauseous ha ING to take Zofran, constipated taking miralax, bloated, belching and even a trip to the ER. I am happy with the weight loss but the side effects are just touch to handle.

I have been on Wegovy for nearly 5 months and I'm now at max dose.  I started at 178 lbs and currently at 157 lbs. So I'm averaging about a lb a week. Some weeks I don't lose any weight but then the next week may lose 2-3 lbs.  I have not had any serious side effects.  Occasional nausea 1st few months but  would only lasted a few hrs. Occasional stomach cramping. I have found that when I experience these side effects it is due to forgetting to eat, eating something I shouldn't (ie: fatty or high sugar foods), or eating to much at one time.  Be sure to drink plenty of water.  I have had mild constipation issues since having my gallbladder removed just over a yr ago, so I have to occasionally take a stool softener but Wegovy hasn't seem to make it any worse. I have cervical stenosis and was having severe low back spasms. I also have some arthritis in hands and feet so I needed to get some weight off my small frame of 5'4".  So far I'm happy with Wegovy.  I recommend not restricting your calorie intake to extremely and not trying to losing more than 1-2 lbs per week on avg (unless doctor advises otherwise). Remember to eat something every few hrs and drink plenty of water. Don't let yourself get too hungry and then eat too much, that will lead to discomfort.

I am 53 and have struggled considerably with my weight loss journey during menopause.  I tried everything...exercise, intermittent fasting, keto, clean eating, more protein less carbs, HCG, WW, etc etc etc and the weight would not budge.  I am working with a nutritionist in my Dr's office and started a month ago at a very low dose of .25.  I am eating half of what I usually eat and have no cravings for sweets, wine or bad food.  I am down 11 lbs in 1 month and I feel hopeful for the first time in a long time!  I am less bloated and down a size.  I have nausea at times but nothing unbearable.  It basically slows your digestion down so I take something each day to help with bowel movements.  I take pepcid each day to prevent any reflux.  My injection also has B12 in it and I think it helps.  I also take a B12 shot on its own about 3 days after my Samgulitide shot.  I should also say I started bio identical hormone therapy around the same time and I think it has helped me a lot at least with the hot flashes!  I feel like my metabolism is kicking it up a notch finally!  If you can work with a reputable medical professional who has experience administering this medication, I recommend it!  I meet with mine each week and she monitors me very closely.  Dosage is key and it sounds like a lot of people start to high for some reason and that creates complications.  By the way, I started at 212.  Good luck!

I took wegovy for 3 months and got to the 1.0 dose. Had nausea, constipation  and acid reflux daily, but 3 days after my first 1.0 dose started having extreme pain on my right side. Ended up needing labs and ultrasound. I now need my gallbladder removed and my inflammation in my body is over 10 times higher than it should be. I will never take wegovy again! All this and only  3
Pounds weight loss in 3 months.

I started the Wegovy injections 2.5 months ago because I struggle to lose weight since being diagnosed with hypothyroidism.  I started on a dose lower than .25mg, and I am now taking .5mg and have only lost 10 lbs.  first 3 days after injection, I am tired all day long...it can be tough if you have to work and manage a family too.  I also get bad acid reflux for those first 3 days after taking the injection.  It does help with my appetite but I struggle to have the energy to exercise.  Although I will force myself to do exercise, it is not enjoyable (as it once was).  I have not had any stomach issues with the dose I have taken thus far.  And... after reading some of these other posts on here, I am nervous to up my dose for fear of severe nausea!  I really need to lose at least 30 more pounds for a knee surgery.  I have been at a plateau now for the past month, so I either need to up my dose or try another route.

The first month I lost 7 pounds and the second I only lost 3.  I am carefully following a low calorie diet and exercising.  Not sure I am going to continue with this medication. I easily could have lost those 3 pounds the second month without this medication.  The side effects are no joke.  I am exhausted so much of the time (many days I need to nap) and have frequent GI upset, although no significant nauseau and no vomitting like others have reported. Frankly, I am really disappointed.  My doctor told me to expect to lose 8 pounds per month and that the side effects are transient and that is definitely not what is happening.  On the plus side, it is very easy to administer.  I can't imagine someone having trouble with it and I was initially nervous about self-injections.  But of course, why do injections at all when then treatment benefit seems so minimal.

Five months ago I started at 364 lbs.  I lost 20 pounds in the first two months, none the 3rd month, 2 lbs the 4th month, and 6 lbs the 5th month for a total of 28 lbs.  I have lumbar spinal stenosis, so exercise is difficult for me, but I do water walking 2-3 times per week and just started strength training twice a week.  The injections are super easy; soooo much better than a daily pill.  I wish the injector pens could be sanitized and reused instead of thrown away.  I have a hatial hernia and severe GERD.  Wegovy makes this much much worse, especially when Iâm trying to sleep.  With the coupon, I pay about $1200/month as this drug is NOT covered by Anthem.  Iâm a bit disappointed that I have not lost more, especially since I can eat very little without starting to feel some minor nausea. I am prediabetic, and my A1C has gone from 5.8 to 5.6.  I do think the weight loss has helped my back pain a bit, but I still need a walker to walk more than 1/4 of a mile, but I can stand up longer without as much pain as I had when I started the Wegovy.
I have just started Wegovy. I am my second week .25. Can anyone tell me how long it takes to see a difference?

I have been on Wegovy since just before Thanksgiving of 2021. Started out 183 pounds.  I have been on it 6 months and have lost 40 pounds! I  55 and have tried every diet out there with no results.The nausea is horrible for about 36 hours after my injection,  but eases up considerably.  I have been a little tired after each injection, but I thought I was just being lazy. Didn't realize that was a side effect. My main side effect is hair loss. I got COVID the 1st week of January and heard horror stories of hair loss after COVID. I have noticed hair in the drain after I wash my hair and when I run my fingers through my hair. I did not realize hair loss could also be a side effect with Wegovy.  Not sure if the hair loss is from Wegovy or COVID. Seeing lots of baby hairs coming in, thank God.Overall, I really am impressed with my weight loss results with Wegovy.  Once I realized the nausea is not constant and goes away after a few days, I knew I could tolerate it. Hubby says I " eat like a bird". Feel full after a few bites. Learned quickly not to drink a lot of fluids and then eat. You will vomit. I learned to adjust my fluid intake around my meals. I recommended Wegovy to my sister and she is starting it soon. Interested to see how her journey on Wegovy will go. Very impressed with Wegovy and definitely recommend it for weight loss.

Have taken the medicine for the max amount the Wegovy co-pay benefit would cover my costs. So at month 6 Iâve lost 36 lbs but the side effects got worse in the last two months with terrible gut pain 2-3 days after injection. When I stopped taking the medicine the pain was gone, but weight began to creep back even after maintaining the exact same amount of calories and exercise. Not sure how the medicine affected that drastic loss of weight but I did my part and at least I have better eating habits. My doctor offered to switch me to Saxenda but Iâm a little uneasy about the abdominal cramping.  Itâs no joke.  Hurts a lot.

For me, Wegovy has been a great experience so far. I just finished my 8th week and today started on 1.0mg. I have been steadily loosing 2 pounds a week and I feel great. I can already see a difference in my body and I have more energy. The injection is truly painless and easy. Occasionally I will feel slightly nauseous but that is always because I didnât listen to the cues my body is sending that I need to stop eating. It is hard to re-learn how you eat and listen to what your body is telling you, but if you do, you should feel fine. This medicine is a tool not a cure-all. The patient needs to also do their part and use it along with your own efforts to help on their weight loss journey

I have been on Wegovy since January 1st and have not lost one pound. I am up ton1.0mg but I also had gastric bypass surgery in 2006 so maybe it is not absorbing in my system like others. I am not sure, but I am not taking my shot this week and I will see if I start to lose again. I am in boxing classes and not eating because the shot makes me not hungry.

This medication worked wonders for me so far. I was grateful not to have any side effects until month 3. I am almost to the 6 month mark. With HITT exercising and eating less Iâve lost 40 lbs. The nausea and vomiting suck but luckily it only last one day and I can plan my schedule around it.

Started 5 months ago, just started the 2.4 dose.  Have lost 28lbs so far. Results were slow to come, but really started to drop weight at 1mg dose.  Nausea has definitely been the biggest issue.  My GP wrote me a script for zofran, it really helps.  Also I have absolutely NO appetite whatsoever.  I am struggling to force myself to eat, and even when I do, I am absolutely done in 2-3 bites.  I have also noticed a serious decrease in energy and overall mood- not sure if this is from not eating or the drug itself.  But the side effects are well worth the results, for me at least.  As far as supply, there are occasional issues with getting it filled.  But I recently read the manufacturer is shut down temporarily due to safety regulations- and from what they are saying, the lower doses will be the only ones affected, and could be off the shelves for up to 6 months.  For reference, I am a 40yr old female, started in October at 201lbs, as of now (March) Iâm at 172 lbs.

I was doing OK with this medication for three months- Oct, Nov Dec 2021. Had no appetite some nausea not awful. Lost 15 pounds.
Then at the 1.7 dose the bigger problems began. 
Super nausea omg I felt so ill I stayed in bed. Couldnt even talk I felt so sick. Also started to give me more muscle spasms ( I have fibromyalgia from Lyme Disease). They were nonstop and horrific. More anxiety,  could not poop at all. When I forced it and took every laxative it was so painful I wanted someone to shoot me dead.
Also..sweating. ugh.
Just awful. So I backed it down to the .5. Made it 4 weeks and after I had more anxiety again and more depression and freaked out ith a major panic attack I'm quitting forever. I don't know if it built up in my body and then caused the problems mixed with my other health conditions or what but this drug is not sustainable. I also vomited terribly on the 1.7 at 3am.
It has the most side effects with any medication I've ever tried. They were delayed, but then I got super slammed. I had to increase my anxiety med because of this.  I hope I feel better in a month. I'm disabled and don't work. I'd never be able to work while taking this drug. I'm glad some can continue.
I've felt like death since January 2022. All done with Wegovy. Lost 20 pounds but I really don't think it was worth it.

I started Wegovy 4.5 months ago and have lost 10 pounds.  I am currently on the 1.7mg dose and upping to the 2.4mg dose next week. I personally get extremely nauseous and fatigued for the first 2-3 days post injection.  The medication absolutely decreases my appetite, I get full very quickly and stay full for a long time.  I often feel quite nauseous about 20-30 mins after eating for about an hour and then it goes away.  I  read a lot of reviews that show I much greater amount of weight loss in a shorter amount of time than I have achieved and I have felt frustrated at time by that, however, the clinical trial data shows an 15% weight loss over 68 weeks, which is 17 months.  Therefore, I think my âslowerâ weight loss is ok and I do find the medication effective.  I am also on an SSRI for depression maintenance, which increases my appetite significantly and perhaps slows down some of the weight loss.  Before every injection, I debate if I want to stop the medication or continue it because I feel so sick the first few days, but itâs is working and Iâd like to get more weight off before I stop.  In a nut shell: donât get too frustrated if the weight is not flying off.  Watch your diet, exercise and keep going as long as you can tolerate the med.

I've only taken 2 doses at the .25mg and have already lost 20lbs. I do have to force myself to eat and drink cause im just not hungry, but at 41 I have lupus and a few other issues and I'm happy so far.

I started at the 1mg dose almost 6 weeks ago. I must say it really decreases my appetite. I have to force myself to eat sometimes, and when I do I get full quickly and almost averted to food when i've barely started eating. Mild side effects. When I first started nausea and stomach pain, now nothing. That being said 6 weeks in. Have not lost a single pound. I will speak to my md about maxing my dose in another few weeks. I'm just worried too much Wegovy will prevent me from eating at all.
In about 2 1/2 months I lost 21 pounds. Very happy.

I was fine on the .25 and .5 doses, maybe a couple pound weight loss. Which is to be expected since those are loading doses. I took my first 1.0 injection 8 days ago and Iâve not slept one night due to horrible stomach discomfort, nausea and pain. Itâs awful! This just isnât for me. Iâm done. Wishing you all the best of luck! I know it works wonders for a lot of people.

This is a wonder drug. However!!!! The nausea and vomiting it causes will make you think you are dying!  Letâs just say itâs a mixture of the worse drinking night of your life, plus the worse morning  sickness anyone could ever have combined with the worse stomach virus you could ever get. This all lasting about 4 of the 7 days of a week.  With that being said, who in the heck would want to eat feeling that sick. Hence = weight loss.
First 3 days after taking Wegovy deal with EXTREME nausea. Remainder of week, general feeling of blah.

Havent had any side effects yet @ .50 dosage but lost a total of 10 lbs so far while being on it and stuck at a plateau for months. Started weight 283 and was at a plateau @ 220, started taking Wegovy and weigh 210 now. I wouldnt be taking this if insurance didnt cover it so it only cost $35 per box.

I started the medication in October 2021.  I have tolerated it well and have lost 80 pounds.  Easy to administer and is a good adjunct to a good diet and exercise.  It remover the constant hunger feeling and cravings.
I have had constipation but other than that I have had no problems with this medication. I have lost 30 pounds.

I have not started this medication yet. I am writing to advise all of those who concerns about the cost. Check with your local compounding pharmacy. My pharmacy is compounding Wegovy prescriptions at $199 for a 2 month supply. The coupon does not apply and my insurance doesnât cover it but I am able to file it to my Flex spending account. $200 a month out of pocket is Much better than the $900 I was quoted.

I took my 3rd dose today.  I am prediabetic and had really lousy labs.  At 54 I was looking to finally drop the weight and get healthy.  I am already down 9 pounds. Very minor side effects.  Slight nausea but nothing a sip on ginger ale wouldn't cure.  I was extremely tired the first week.  I thought I was actually coming down with something.  The second week was alot better.  My clothes are loose today.  My underwear is starting to get baggy so I know I have lost inches.  I normally have very course and thick curly hair.  It has become soft and very manageable for some reason.  Loving my hair!  Highest weight 258

I am a failed braiatric sleeve patient. That tool was effective at first 
and i lost 50lbs, but after 6 years  i was back up over 300lbs. So, my PCP told me about Wegovy and although skeptical, I Started Wegovy mid November 2021. Gradually titrated up and reached the 2.4 maintenance dose this past weekend. Up until now, constipation, belching and gradual decrease in appetite. Lost 15lbs. After starting this 2.4 dose, the nausea is miserable! But I'm determined to see this through. I am relearning a healthy relationship with food through side effects and what amounts to eat. I am thankful this medication is available and I can tolerate it. I'm sure this method isn't for everyone, but I'm happy with the direction  I am headed. Can't wait to get to "1"derland. (Under 200lbs)

I have now been taking this medication for 4 full months.  I have lost 25 lbs and couldn't be happier.  I have had little to no side effects.  The most for me is being really tired the day after the shot.  It's sad that all of us benefiting from this medicine can not afford it after the $25 coupon.  I will definitely put my last 2 months to good use.  :)

Started at 237lbs. @.5mg and slowly titrated up to 1.7mg with only sporadic, and occasional nausea of mild to moderate intensity. Just did my first week of 2.4mg and experienced 2 days of strong nausea, but easily resolved and I think my body has finally adjusted to the full dose. If you can endure the nausea and stick with it, youâll be fine. Eventually the body WILL adjust but it takes timeâ¦I now weigh 200lbs. I had to buy all new pants, Iâm down like 4 sizes, lol.

Absolutely the best thing I have ever tried.  I have my weight on and off my whole life.  I have lost 35 lbs.  I did have some of the minor side effects but nothing compared to the way it curbed my appetite and my sweet tooth and feeling full quicker.  My only complaint is I was able to buy the RX only with the use of a coupon and I got up to the 2.4 mg dosage for 1 time and the coupon had maxed out.  I canât afford to continue with the medicine now

I started a month ago with .25 no sides effects except the first day i had a really bad stomachache. This is my first using .5mg i have been feeling a little nauseous specially when eating. So far i have lost 7 lbs, i eat less and feeling full for longer period of time.

Iâve been using Wegovy .5 since last August, with zero side effects, and have consistently lost 1 lb. a week.  The doctor will not raise my dose unless I go 3 weeks with no weight loss.  She said there is no reason to titrate up, as long as itâs working, and that more side effects happen in higher doses.  I want to lose 84 pounds, and Iâm down 27 pounds so far.

5 weeks in Iâve lost ~10lbs with another 25lbs to go. I moved up to .5mg after the third dose of .25 and Iâll probably do the same as I titrate up to 1.0 because Iâve not had any nausea-related side effects thus far. Itâs a really great drug for me. Ive tried diet and exercise several times over the years and that program worked but it was SO hard to keep it up for several months at a time and the hunger pains never went away. Thatâs the best thing about this drug - no hunger pains. At all. Zero. The only two things that Iâve noticed is my sleep habits became a little worse. I had trouble sleeping more than a maximum of 6 hrs / night but I started taking melatonin and thatâs helped tremendously and Iâm back to normal sleep. The other is a little constipation. Prior to the drug I was routine once/day, now itâs once every 3-4 days. But I eat so little now that itâs not really an issue. Aside from that Iâve had a very good experience on this drug. Nothing tastes different or worse - I just eat 1/8 to 1/10 of what I used to consume. When I eat too much, which was hard to gauge the first few weeks, I felt like I had the biggest meal of my life, which was uncomfortable, but it went away after an hour or two. You need to learn how much food is enough, which is much less than you think it is. One trick Iâve used is to try to eat very slowly.

WEGOVY has been a miracle for me. So far, Iâve lost 40 pounds due to complete loss of appetite. I only eat lean meats, fruits, vegetables, complex carbs, low fat dairy, very little sugar, and nuts. I exercise 4-5x/wk. Zero constipation due to exercise and eating a cup of bran-type cereal each day.

I do feel tired a lot, mainly from not eating much, so keeping a food diary helps me up my food intake when itâs too low. 

Iâm currently on 2.4, but I think itâs too high, so Iâm going to ask my Dr. to lower it back to 1.7 next month.

I lost 18 pounds in 4 months using Wegovy.
I started to have intolerable side effects at the 1.7 dose and after 6 weeks had to. Drop it to .5 again.
I have fibromyalgia from Lyme disease and it gave me unbelievable fibro flares. Maybe something to do with the sugars in the muscles. I screamed in pain. Also couldn't eat much at all, was so constipated I would take anything and everything to try and go and only could after 7 hours of lying in the bathroom in the worst pain imaginable.
Woke up at 3 am twice and vomited also.
I also see a difference in the texture of my hair. Very dry. Makes sense if my whole system is dry.
So I'm using the .5 maybe 2x month but I think I'm going off it. I just got my hair back and I don't want to lose it again.
I don't know how many can tolerate the side effects at the higher doses. I was so nauseous I felt like death.
I'll try my best to keep the weight off.
Maybe a low bimonthly dose will help me do that. I am 53 years old. The website wouldn't let me record my real age.
Good luck

Inserting the pen into stomach is very hard and most times has left bruising.  After my initial weight loss, I have been at a standstill for over two months.  This medicine is extremely expensive to not work continuously.

I am a 44yo female, have gone from 177 to 150 in just under 4 months. I exercise a lot, but haven't changed what I eat much. The pros... I can feel starving, then be full after eating very little. I'm losing weight pretty consistently. I can still eat things like sushi, ice cream etc, but instead of eating a bunch, a few bites and I feel satisfied. Food I used to love I no longer have any craving for. I have also noticed that even drinking (in a margarita fan) has lost a lot of its allure. I am looking great and about to break the 150 mark for the first time in a decade.

Cons... I feel generally unwell. Like I am coming down with something. It wasn't terrible at first, but as the dose increases, it gets pretty bad. I am on a generic semaglutide so thank God, the prescriber has been able to titrate me insanely slow (often by .25 every week or two) but we had to lower it back again as I seriously was miserable. Since getting to around 1.7, I am having a lot of problems with constipation, way more nausea (like waking at 4am and running to the bathroom to vomit), heartburn, and lots of burping which randomly started this week and really sucks. I exercise about 6 days a week and went from level 8-10 on the elliptical to feeling like I'm going to pass out of I go higher than about level 2. A flight of stairs kicks my butt. I get dizzy super easy. Most of this slowly started around 1mg, but the 1.7 has been brutal. I told the prescriber I don't think I can go higher than this and she seems amenable. So I imagine the weight loss will slow down but it would be nice to find a balance of still maintaining/losing a bit while also feeling well.

Wegovy definitely works. Ive been on it since 12-8-21. Its been almost 3 months & I'm down 30lbs. I dont crave foods anymore since I'm on my 3rd box (dosage goes up every month). Sometimes I feel like I'm starving but when I start 2 eat I can only take a few bites. My issue is constipation. Exercise, drinking nothing but water, coffee, taking  laxatives, prune juice, fiber supplements, probiotics, & enema didn't work & now I'm having 2 see a gastrologist. Its a rough drug but worth it if your obese & need 2 lose the weight fast. My 18 yr old son is on it. He was 240lbs. Hes lost 20lbs in 2 months. His only issue is an upset stomach but he likes it.

I'm on my last 1.7 dose and I've gone from 190 to 163.2 lbs so far. My side effects have been pretty mild. I think I had nausea/stomach pain the first few weeks after I started. Now for the most part I only have nausea in the few days after I've titrated up. I did have one week where I started puking and had really bad nausea. It turned out I'd forgotten to take my dose the week before. I'm writing the date I'm supposed to take each on the shots right when I get a new box now. My appetite has been reduced significantly. Some days I can eat normal amounts of food, but others I just don't get hungry or get full very quickly. I am very aware of when I'm full now, like I'll eat half of my food and then feel like I don't want another bite. If for some reason I do eat past that point I can get nauseous and my stomach might start hurting, but that's rare for me. Also the shots themselves aren't that bad. I do Emgality shots once a month and those hurt a lot more than the Wegovy. My weight loss has been really steady. I don't think I'm done losing weight and the weight loss has been pretty unrelated to my exercise/types of food I eat. I've been stressed and have not been making good decisions in those areas. I'll probably stay on this for the rest of my life if I can. As far as the cost, I get it for $25 with the coupon for now. I was told it would be $100 a month without the coupon. I luckily just got a better job, so I'm just going to pay the $100 a month once the coupon runs out. Hopefully insurances will start covering it more and make it more accessible.

I have been on Wegovy since October 2021. I'm currently on 2.4.  I have lost of total of 35 pounds. I have alot of constipation, I have to take something for the constipation. I do have some vomiting when I eat hot, spicy or greasy food. I'm very please with Wegovy.

Reporting on 7 months of Wegovy after 6 months of prior lifestyle therapy. I started with a BMI of 32 at 217 pounds. With calorie counting aiming for 1500 calories a day, I was able to get to 200 pounds with constant cravings and food obsession. Since starting Wegovy I have lost an additional 35 pounds but with absolutely no food cravings or obsession. It was embarrassingly easy to lose weight on Wegovy. No nausea. I have classic symptoms of weight loss: 1) some fatigue initially when I was losing weight quickly, which has now resolved; 2) cold intolerance has been my most discomforting side effect; 3) bowel movements only once every 5-7 days but without any symptoms of constipation. Nearing a plateau in my weight with only 2 pounds weight loss in the last month and BMI 24. I could not be more pleased and feel blessed that I have excellent insurance with virtually no co-pay. I am 63 years old and have not had a BMI of 24 since I was in my early teens.

What an experience. I am totally shocked by how this medication worked for me since starting 19 days ago. I did not know what to expect when I started this and of coarse was anxious about side effects. But I will be using my third injection in 2 days and am all in. Let me make a list of what I experienced on this med. 
From Day 2 
I did not Crave food. I did not think about my next meal
I did not feel the hunger one feels when they are obese. You know what I mean
I have gone every morning but two without breakfast. Yes I know its the most important meal. But its also a chance for your body to start burning fat. I dont care what nutritionist say it worked for me in the past. And if I can only have coffee until 1130a I am doing this.
So lets see how this goes

I've lost over 50lbs in the 5-6 months I've been taking it, I'll be off it soon due to it no longer being $25 a month for me (insurance won't cover it sadly). It's definitely worked but has come with a lot of stomach issues. They improved when I started taking digestive enzymes with meals, but it didn't completely go away. I've been able to tolerate it though since I was only getting the massive discount for 6 months.

I m so thankful for this medication. I have lost 65 lbs since August 1, 2021 with minimal side effects. My favorite part of taking Wegovy is that it has changed the way I think about food. For me, the challenge and struggle in losing weight is that I constantly thought about what I was or wasn't eating. Wegovy has changed that. I rarely have cravings. If I do, a small bite of something satisfies the craving. Thankfully, my insurance has approved it through Aug 2022. Hopefully, I will be able to get it for my cost of $25/month after then. I hope that insurance agencies will see the value in approving weight loss medication for prevention of comorbidities of obesity.

I have never been so sick in all my life. Sure it works, anyone would lose weight if theyâre constantly sick. Itâs like a forced eating disorder because if you eat more than a few bites youâll vomit and then eventually you lose your appetite completely. Constantly nausea for 4 months  will do that to you. It did solve a problem for me in getting a large amount of weight off, 40 lbs in 4 months to be exact. Due to a health issue (diagnosis of RA) I suddenly gained a lot of weight and couldnât get it back off. Iâm not sure that this would work for someone whoâs been overweight for an extended period of time for the sheer fact that you donât learn any healthy habits so Iâm not sure how you would maintain it once discontinuing Wegovy. Iâm not even sure i wonât gain it back for the same reason. Not eating is not healthy, vomiting every week is not healthy and is it really safe to mess with your blood sugar and pancreas? Iâm grateful for getting this head start and hope that I can now move to (my own) phase two and work with a nutritionist because I just canât do it anymore. Bottom line it may have some benefits for some people but there are a lot of side effects so proceed with caution. Words just could not express how incredibly sick I have been since starting this! I started at the lowest dose and got to the maximum 2.4 at 4 months.

Iâm learning how much I canât eat to lose and maintain weight but I had to go to reduced dosage of 1.0 from 1.7 because I was nauseous and constipated most of the time. Going back to 1.7 because the hunger is coming back although I still canât eat much.  Will go back to 1.0 if nauseousness returns the same as before.

Im on my last dose of 1.7mg. Everything before 1.7mg was perfect and now is hell. Iâm never constipated and being in 1.7mg kill my appetite completely because the food would get stuck in my stomach and in my throat. I canât feel bowel movements cause every time I feel Iâm going to have one, is stuck. Peeing have become difficult. Thereâs nothing in the side effects that talk about problems with peeing but Iâm having them. I have try using miralax but it wonât work. Iâm currently taking magnesium citrate and is not working. I will probably develop a infection and have to get a colostomy. I lost 20lbs in 4 months but at what cost?! Beware, if it gives you this symptoms talk to your doctor. Iâm doing that on Monday.
Week 4, No effect. Actually have gained weight. Think the starting dose is to get your body used to the drug so there's no side effects at higher doses.

The first two months were pretty good. I was experiencing decreased appetite, heartburn, some nausea and weight loss. Month three as the dosage increased, I started experiencing a lot of nausea. Had to be extremely careful not to eat more than a few bites or vomiting occurred., Fourth month I was extremely ill with every bite I put in my mouth. I am now on 1.7 and contemplating stopping the medication. Itâs time to increase to 2.4 but I told my doctor thereâs no way and she gave me another prescription for 1.7. She also provided an anti-nausea medication that helps just a little.  Very torn because I want to keep losing but I also want to stop feeling sick every single day. My husband thinks this is ridiculous and I should stop because he is tired of me being sick.  In my third month I also started experiencing headaches and they continue. This last month I am experiencing severe muscle cramps in my back where nothing seems to relieve it. Thank goodness itâs only happened a few days here and there.  Iâm down 25 pounds with a goal of another 15. I just donât know if I can continue. Very torn!

Started November 28th 2021  .25 mg 4 weeks then .5mg 4 weeks now on first week 1mg .Lost 22 Pounds so far. have lil Nausea once in a while but eat a cracker or have some club soda im fine, no other syptoms so far. for me this has been a Blessing. I eat smaller amounts and all cravings are gone . I am staying on 1 mg for 3 more months cause its working well since the lower doses were also working . Im 63 stuggled all my life .this is awesome for me. just work with it ,its a wonderful tool. you have to put in some effort to choose healthy foods .,cant wait for the next 3 months Just do it !!

I was 75 lbs overweight and do a lot of stress eating. I am currently on .5mg dose for 3 weeks and have lost 14 lbs. Side effects include dull headaches which go away with Tylenol. Some constipation, but not real bad. My worst is the fatigue, it will effect your blood sugar. I have little or no appetite, but force myself to eat three meals a day based on diet plan.

I have been on this medication since October, and I have lost 28 pounds.  This medication has had little side effects for me and has taught me portion control.  I have been on phentermine before and this by far is the best overall weight loss drug.

Sick. AfterI went to the 1.7mg sick sick sick. I lost 16 pounds and 4 of those was the 6 weeks I managed to stay on the 1.7. Decreased to the1.0 then. Also haveLyme and fibromyalgia and this made my pain worse because I could not go to the bathroom anymore.
It was scary. 
So I will come down on the wegovy.
I was ok until the 1.7.
Side effects are TIRED!
NAUSEA REALLY BAD. BURPING CONSTIPATION. I CRIED I felt so ill. I'll go down to the low dose and lose 1 or 2 pounds a month. Fine. No more high dose.
Taking a 3 week break right night.
Maybe I'll go to the bathroom. Also people...if you lose weight too fast your hair will cone out. Careful. I list 16 pounds in 4 months and I'm worried because I just regrew my hair from my illness. Be careful. Tirate SLOWLY 
I'm 53 yers old

Immediately after the injection I have a day or two of a hazy headache and other mild side effects. I notice the most side effects when I up my dosage (at 1.7 currently) but by the end of the 4 shots I notice less and less. 

I get very tired initially and the mild headache along with acid reflex can be annoying but the results have been worth it. I feel less interested in eating, even if my favorite food is around Iâm just not getting the same satisfaction from it that I did in the past. 

I havenât been great about exercising but Iâve still been losing 2-3 (sometimes more) lbs a week. Iâm definitely an advocate for this shot if other procedures and plans havenât worked for you.

I lost 20 pounds the first 2 months. I thought this is easy. When my dose was increased to 1 it was down hill from there.. I developed gall stones and severe pancreatis.  After a stay in the hospital  several antibiotics  and gall bladder removed I'm feeling better. Needless to say no more wegovy for me.

No weight loss. And the pen is a joke. Iâm injecting it into my leg but I have to see the yellow line has stopped moving at some point after it clicks the second time? Itâs the only Rx Injection Iâve taken thatâs like this. Itâs like they want consumers to screw up so theyâre on the medication longer.
I'm only on day 4 but haven't notice any difference in appetite....only metallic taste in mouth. Is this normal? And how long before you started feeling effects?

I loved it. I lost 50lbs in 6mos and I had no side effects. I wish they would come out with another coupon.  Very expensive.  But my overall it was great an I feel great!!! THANK YOU FOR COMING UP WITH THIS WEIGHT LOSS PROGRAM.

This is the worst weight loss medication I have ever taken in my life.  I started with .25.  Week one, no side effect except for a little acid reflux.  2 days into week 2, the acid reflux was so horrible, I spent 2 nights not being able to sleep because I was coughing all night from the acid.  It wasnât until the following day that things turned really bad.  I had a headache like Iâve never experienced.  I was nauseous and vomiting. I was weak and heard ringing in my ears.  I went to Urgent Care.  My BP was 171/100 and I am always normal.  It wasnât until today that I feel somewhat better.  I will never take this medication again nor do I recommend anyone taking this.  This could have been life threatening.  Definitely not worth it!!!  The FDA should pull this medication immediately!

Sure you will lose weight if you can't eat and projectile vomit constantly. The constant, helpless feeling of nausea that will not subside, plus the vomiting is not worth it for me personally.  I also am experiencing times of twichiness-my hands will shake and I get slightly dizzy.  I had terrible insomnia one night where I only slept for 2 hours, was up for 3, then finally got another 2 before going to work but with terrible nightmares.  Praying this stuff gets out of my system soon.  I feel horrible.
Iâve lost 50 lbs in 6 months

I was on the injection for two months and lost 18 pounds which was awesome.  Unfortunately I started noticing more hair than normal in my hands after showering. My hair on my hair was falling out. I have always had pretty thick hair. I now have very thin hair on top with bald spots. Of course I stopped the medication right away. Now the depression of not having the halo to take the weight off I also Hate my hair. I think it looks awful. I had to cut it just to make it presentable. Wegovy for weight loss was great but there can be hair loss. I called the company to let them know. The lady said she was going to have someone call me about my results and no one ever did. Just know hair loss is a possible side effect.  Wish Iâd hadnât been for me.

I just began month 3 (1 mg). Up until this point I was nauseous, gassy and had diarrhea immediately after I ate, but I didn't mind all that because I could tell it was working. And the fact that I had already lost 20lbs in 2 mos was awesome. I had no cravings, the smell of food made me ill, no appetite -it was great. But now that I've started 1 mg, none of those side effects are happening, I'm back to craving food and I'm back to being able to eat food without getting rid of it right away (diarrhea). So now I'm worried that the 1 mg dose isn't working. It was the .5 mgs where I lost the most weight but was the sickest. Do I need to go back down to .5? Should I just keep going? Not sure what to do but this drug is amazing and I would highly recommend. Not everybody will experience the same side effects, so don't let that keep you from trying it. My nausea wasn't that bad and Wegovy has never caused me to vomit. Oh and I'm a female, 45 y/o and 5'3".

Am I the only one having a problem with medication leaking out of the injection site?  Iâve had it happen after 3 out of 4 injections now, and itâs very disheartening.  According to the pharmacist, this is extremely common with these  pensâ up to 45% of the time.  Wouldnât the medication work better if you were getting the FULL DOSE each time?  Iâve lost 10#, so I must be getting a little of it.  Iâm an RN with 45 years of experience, and this is a less than perfect  injection system.  And watching the medicine roll down your leg or abdomen is like watching $400 run down the drain.  Frustrating.

I started Wegovy in October. So far I have lost 25 lbs, which has been wonderful. My biggest issues are the nausea and constipation. I have increased my water intake which has helped a bit, but the nausea is unreal. I am on the 1.0 dose and I can't imagine getting to the higher dose. It is definitely a mental adjustment to not being able to eat as much, or as mindlessly. I am hoping Zofran will help with the nausea.

I really feel as though the Wegovy has changed my thoughts of food. I donât crave certain things, I donât want certain things. I stop eating because I am full faster. I am making better choices when it comes to eating. The weight loss is slow but I feel as though I am losing in areas I havenât lost in a long time. Minimal side effects which donât last long. I am looking forward to the end of my journey on Wegovy where I keep the weight off this time.
I weigh 225 lbs and gave been in wegovy for 4 weeks and haven't lost but 2lbs. I get bad headaches and have had diarrhea several times using it. I don't feel its working for me

I've been using  this  medication  for 3 months and I have lost 25lbs. The first  time I used it..it curved my appetite and I was very impressed. My only upset is the having  to use the bathroom all the time and nausea  feeling right  after the medication  is administered. This is the first product I have used after years of trying  to lose weight that have given me these kind of results. I don't crave sweets  anymore. I would recommend  this  product

The first two weeks were rough. Upset stomach, lots of acid, fatigue, nausea.  Now I have stabilised and have just had my fourth injection.  Down 11 pounds in less than 4 weeks. I still to 1200 calories a day and use Noom and My Plate to make sure I am getting a balanced diet.  I have fewer cravings for sugar and alcohol and my appetite is definitely Italy decreased.   Now I have my energy back and my stomach is better. I work out with a trainer three times a week and feel strong!

I started on the lowest dose in August and just started the highest dose today. I have lost 26lbs so far without working out and just doing portion control. My biggest complaint is nausea. It is awful if you accidentally overeat. If I eat even an average amount, I will vomit. I hardly eat anymore, which is a good thing. I used to overindulge. The side effects are a trade-off for the results. I am trying to lose 100lbs total so I will keep you updated.

I am on my 9th week and I have felt terrible the last 3 weeks. I get nauseous and very dizzy. Anything I eat I have diarrhea right after (even bread). I need to lose about 25 more lbs but I donât know if the side effects are worth it.

I'm on my 4th month of treatment (one more week left) and have made it to the 1.7mg dose. Early on i started noticing constipation but that was an easy fix. Just making sure I eat more fiber and using a stool softener. There would be a few times I felt nauseous but i wasn't eating like i should have. Just trying to learn what my body needed. That went away with some adjustments to snacking and eating. This new dose however has been the hardest for me. The nausea is lingering. There have been a few times that I actually throw up. The nausea usually lasts the first two days of the weekly shot. If I take a nausea pill though it really helps. I notice that I feel full all day long some days. I try to eat something small just knowing that I still need to eat. I don't have any cravings. I've lost around 30 pounds. It started slowly at first but has really increased over the last 4 weeks. I've noticed that many of my clothes are fitting better. With more exercise I think my results will be even better. If you can find ways to manage any negative side affects I think its worth it to stick it out.

I started this journey July 9th as a last resort to get healthy enough to come off of blood pressure medicine.  My brother is my best friend and is in need of a kidney transplant. His time if running short.  I am his only full blooded sibling. I went to Tampa to find out how to test to see if I was a match. I was turned away due to being under the age of 50 and on blood pressure meds which make me high risk for kidney problems in the future.  I was told I need to be off blood pressure meds at least 90 days before they will even test me to see if I am in fact a match.  I was devastated. When I returned home I spoke to my cardiologist and he told me to limit salt and lets try to lose some weight and he will monitor my blood pressure and see what we can do to come off the meds.  I went the very next day to a weight loss doctor and discussed options.  We determined that due to the nature of medical needs surrounding my need for regaining my health we would go with the wegovy.  As of December 20th I am down 34lb and about 8 inches off my waist.  I have been monitoring my blood pressure and taking half the medicine strength now from what I was on.  My blood pressure sometimes runs a little low/normal so we are thinking within another month or so I will be able to go without it and see how I do.  If everything goes well I hope to be able to enroll in testing to see if I am a match to donate a kidney for my brother.  If I am a match then we owe it to wegovy for saving two lives not just one.  That is a blessing for sure.  Fingers crossed and prayers raised.

This does work like a miracle for weight loss.  I have lost 20% of my body weight in 5 months.  I am at my goal and it feels wonderful. However, I have had several awful GI episodes in this last month.  At first I just had mild nausea and great appetite suppression, but the last month I have bad nausea/pain episodes about once a week.  Its bad enough that I am stopping the wegovy, even though I am terrified of gaining weight back.  Still, I feel this medication is worth a try by anyone who is overweight or obese.

Started Wegovy on 10/18/21 & I'm down 25 pounds.I really didnt have any major side affects on the lower dosage. I'm currently on 1.0 mg, I get full very quick & if i over eat or eat something that dont agree with my body I have to vomit. I'm learning what I can & can not eat. My body lets me know when I'm full.

First week of Wegovy. A little blah and had to take extra Pepcid for unset stomach. First day was amusing. Stomach gurgled nonstop all day. That night a little nauseous. Totally shut down my desire to eat. Certain food taste different. Sweet thing tend to taste overly sweet. Feeling full much sooner and canât get through a full meal.  This is certainly the strangest drug I've ever taken. Iâm hoping for the best. The doctor said she has had no one drop out. I think most of us will do anything to loose weight and as we have powered through all the side effects of being overweight, we will power through the Wegovy side effects. Good luck everybody.

Iâve taken only my first dose at .25mg. Iâm not sure that I will be able to continue taking this medication. While my cravings have been diminished significantly, I simply cannot eat without extreme nausea even with an anti-nausea medication. Within an hour of the shot, my arm and neck on the side I had the shot felt like they were sunburnt. Within 4 hours, I was vomiting more violently than I did while pregnant. Iâve never been this Iâll feeling since the time I had food poisoning and ended up hospitalized. The nausea is pervasive and will not go away even after vomiting and zofran. Iâve lost 7 pounds in 48 hours. Feel like Iâm drying up. Smells trigger the nausea, even on day 3. Itâs also given me some severe headaches that begin in the evenings and continue for many hours until I managed to fall asleep. I have nasty sulphuric burps and the gas and bloating are pretty bad too. Just started with diarrhea this morning. Not sure what it did to my system, but Iâm not sure that I want to see what a higher dose does to my body. I doubt that I will continue this medication beyond the second dose unless my side effects improve dramatically.
Stopped working

I am a type 2 diabetic, my dr perscribed this to me for a few reasons, one main reason is because I struggle with loosing a few more pounds to get to where I would like my weight to be. I had taken wegovy for 2 months and recently decided to stop using it. When i first began shots it started to subside my appetite briefly, however the headache it gives it quite annoying. I continued using this in hopes that I would start to see some kind of change. Unfortunelty no change in my weight what so ever. All it really did for me was give me a weekly two day long headache. I stopped using and went back to using my ozempic. Was hoping for better weight loss results with this medication that I didnt get.

I've been on this medication for 11 weeks now, and lost 24 pounds, no side effects. I think my taste buds changed as there are things I can not eat/drink anymore like coffee or ice cream. 
I eat healthy and exercise 4 times a week for 2 hours each time, added walk for 30 minutes in the evening 2-4 times a week. I don't snack, I avoid carbs. I eat only when I'm hungry which is happening 2-3 times a day and even then, I eat very little as I feel full quickly. I listen to my body and stop eating when I'm full. I drinks lots of water. reading all comments here I think I'm lucky as I have no side effects. I highly recommend this drug after consulting with your doctor.

I have been on wegovy no for 5 months, and I have lost almost 50 pounds. My doctor started me out on the lowest dosage, and now I'm on the highest dosage. The only bad thing is that I stay nauseous all the time, and the next 2 days after taking the injection, I would throw up, even if I haven't ate anything, I would throw up the wegovy medicine I think, because it would be yellowish stuff coming up, and it has a weird taste. But on the 3rd day, and after, I just be nauseous, and I can't really eat anything, and if I eat to much, I would throw it up. I asked my doctor if he could prescribe me something for the nausea, and he did. So yes the side effects are terrible, but I am very pleased with my results, and no exercise is needed.
So I just took this last week and my cravings have stopped and feel full.  No nausea or diarrhea.  Feeling hopeful.

I started this journey with Wegovy late August this year.  It's now just about 3.5 months later and I've lost 20LBs.  Some times I get headaches and a wave of nausea but really just around when I take the shot.  It passes quickly and the health benefits of having lost 20lbs so far exceeds the mild side effects.  At 5"3" and in my 40s as nothing else has worked...  The one impact is really not eating as much and believe me when I say I'm an eater so it's just been a bit of a mental adjustment not being able to eat as much at meal time.
Been on Wegovy for 5 months. Lost 10 pounds.  Nausea and diarrhea prevail. Disappointing.
I've been on WeGovy for two months. I've lost maybe 3 pounds. The side effects for me include constipation, heart burn and nausea.

This medication is the only one to work so far. Iâve lost 41lbs and I just started my first week on 2.4mg. It started slow on .25mg dowses, not always losing those weeks, but got better with the .5mg dose and the 1.0mg dose is where I really noticed the benefits. No cravings (as someone who craves a lot before). Most days I donât have side effects. Occasionally, the day after the shot I would have some nausea and Iâd just take an anti-nausea pill and feel better shortly after. I also some constipation, so I just have to be mindful of taking something for that when it happens.

Wegovy is the only medication that worked wonders for my weight loss journey.  I been taking Wegovy for 5 months and without exercise I have lost 32 lbs.  It has helped curb my sweet tooth and my desire to make unhealthy food choices.  When I eat sweets or sugary drinks I do get nauseated.

On my 5th week of 1.0 and have had great results, down 18lbs and fitting in shirts I havenât been able to wear for years.   Makes me feel a little blah first day after taking but I feel like I have so much more willpower and sometimes will make a meal that I just decide to skip altogether.  Very happy.
This stuff has made me feel so bad(sick! Terrible abdominal pain, nauseous, gassy) , not a way to loose weight.... Please try something different.... Not worth it.

Iâm in my 5th month and Iâm down 40 pounds. Iâve gone from a size 12 to a size 6. The medicine is doing itâs job. Itâs extremely easy to use. Iâve been ahead of the curve and havenât had any issues getting it. The downside are the side effects.  Nausea has been my number one problem. Overall Iâm extremely pleased.

This is my 6th week, currently on the .5mg dose after graduating successfully from the .25mg for 4 weeks. I've already lost a combined 15lbs in the 6wk period. I did experience severe nausea, vomiting and diarrhea for one whole day during the 6th week, which was honestly painful to experience, but that is the most common side effect as the body is getting used to it and telling your brain to stop eating profusely, otherwise you will throw up!

The injection is painless as I take it on my thighs.

I highly recommend it after consultation with your doctor.

The nausea is debilitating. I was ok till I hit 3rd week at .50 but now I can barely get out of bed Iâm so nauseas. Trying to work through it with doctor suggested remedies. They work somewhat but this is really hard.
On the positive endâ¦I have lost 25 lbs in 2 months.
Ive been in this for 5 weeks lost 2 pounds????
It's definitely making me lose weight, but only because I can't stop vomiting and having diarrhea. I've dropped 22lbs, but I'm miserable and can barely function between trips to the bathroom.

I took my first injection on 11-22-21 5pm, other than mild heartburn my week was uneventful for side effects but with Thanksgiving my eating habits were not the best, I did however manage to lose 3.5lbs. I took my second yesterday at 5pm at about 10 pm I started having anxiety and weird painless muscle spasms all over and a wave of nausea but eventually i fell asleep and woke up fine. My bowel habits have been pretty normal but i take Magnesium 500mg at night. I eat but still feel hungry after despite eating a whole meal and being protein conscious. Its too soon to tell if its working I think bc I ate Thanksgiving dinner for days but back on track so we shall see. I have read that most ppl are having trouble with side effects but so far pretty minimal.

HAIR LOSS.  I started the highest level of Wegovy 10 days ago - 2.4 mg.  I almost immediately developed a skin sensitivity on my back.  Not itchy, no rash but just felt like I had a sunburn.  Honestly, I thought it was the starch in the shirt I had on.  It has remained for the past 10 days.  A few days after that started, I noticed that I had no hair on my legs - none at all.  None on my arms or underarms.  Honestly, I cannot pinpoint the day I noticed this development, but it was definitely noticeable after I hit the highest dosage.  I was freaked out - super concerned I would lose the hair on my head which at the moment, does not look any thinner.  I just got back from a dermatologist this morning and brought all the prescriptions I take.  When I pulled out the Wegovy box, he exclaimed, "that is so interesting.  I got two calls from PCPs last week that said their patients on Wegovy had small bald spots on their scalp."  He didn't know what dosage they were on.  He said he is going to contact the manufacturer to report these reported side effects.  He looked at my legs under a special magnifying glass.   He said that the hair follicles were not scarred - the hair was visible but not above the surface.  This would seem to indicate it will grow back.  He looked at my scalp and said it was healthy so, not thinning at the moment.  JUST A WARNING TO ALL.

This is absolutely the best medication I have ever taken for weight loss. I have virtually no side effects other than loss of appetite. Typically I can't finish a plate of food.  I eat some and then a switch sorta flips and I'm done.  I've never had that sensation before and I have tried pretty much everting including gastric bypass. I have been on it since August and I've lost 26 pounds. Typically my weight stalls at about 15 lbs.   I am eating a healthy diet, walking and drinking a lot of water.  I feel wonderful.  I am currently on 1.7 mg.  I find the injections easy.  My fear is what will happen when I quit taking it.

I started on 2.4; 4 days ago and experienced vomiting nausea and abdominal pain. Today I have zero appetite incredible pain will most likely see a doctor today. I lost 10 lbs from water weight and not eating. Most of all Iâm just disgusted and ashamed that I paid this much this stuff, the discounts are a joke

I am on my 3rd dose and have lost 11lbsâthrilled!! I noticed all the typical side effects right away but all were mild and manageable.  Best thing this med has done for me is severely curbed my constant thought of foodâfor me almost a constant obsessionâ¦for me, controlling my eating is much easier when the place in my brain that causes me to obsess over it is regulated. Hunger severely diminished and fel full very quickly after eating small amounts and notice nausea if I overeat or eat too much sugar..if this med continues to work for me it will be a godsend. Have not exercised much since starting but planning to up my game this coming week.
I just took my 1st dosage of the ,25. I feel nauseated & sick to my stomach & feel blah. I will keep everyone updated.

I have been on wegovy for 3 months going on my fourth month. I have lost 6 pounds. Very discouraging. This week I'm starting on 1.70. I'm so sick. I'm nauseated, vomiting. Don't feel good. Just blah. I had some how ended up with extra .25 so after a week I added that to my 1 mg. I cut my intake of food to more than 1/2. I don't understand. The weight should be melting off. Am I not eating enough?? I don't crave sweets anymore which is a bonus! I don't snack or munch on junk food. Wish I had answers.

Iâve been on wegovy for 4 weeks and have lost 16lbs so far. I have little to no symptoms with only slight nausea. My appetite has cut in half and Iâm less inclined to over eat. I physically canât! Iâm ecstatic of the results and hope to see the weight keep shedding.

Took my first shot last night . Letâs just say that I got serious nausea and felt like vomiting. I thought it was cause of our dinner and food poisoning. Turns out after all that and being able to sleep I woke up and have been have some of the same symptoms. Sucky part is I can not keep anything down . I tired drinking green tea and not even 20 minutes later I had to throw it up . Had some madeleines vomit aswell. I looked up and realized the side effects are what Iâm having but it hit me so hard this morning that I had to call into work because I didnât want them thinking I had covid symptoms and send me home . 

Fingers crossed I get over this little rough patch because I wanna be able to try this new adventure because Iâve had trouble losing weight for years .

I am on my 4th month at 1.7 of wegovy. I have had minimal side effects including nausea and constipation. Some diarrhea as well on and off. However, I have stuck to it and lost 43 pounds which has improved my health and self esteem. I would and have recommended it to many friends and coworkers. It got started when the coupon offer was available however it has since gone away. I am concerned when I stop in a few weeks. It has really helped to keep my appetite reduced. I have learned to eat less but I donât want to gain the weight back.

started my first .25 dose this week- yesterday ...so far a little nausea but other then that no other side effects. Wondering how quick the weight will come off.... as far as eating I really don't have the need just feel blah. Any comments on your experience would be great :)

On my 4th week of .25.  Lost nothing, might even have gained a pound.  The weight is like glue on me.  I am on a calorie restrictive diet so I am not overeating.  I am on thyroid meds, the initial reason why I gained 30lbs. so not sure that is the reason why it's not workingl  Anyone else having the same result?

What I find hilarious about Wogovy and similar meds that are touted as a great way to lose weight is the fact that they make you feel like crap, and THAT'S the way they make you lose weight. Lol. Nobody will tell you this beforehand, however. I have had only one dose, so the jury is out in whether this actually works for me, but I have been dizzy and woozy since starting it. I'd better get over that, or I'm done.

Giving myself the shot is stressful; it is not painful you just have to push the pen so hard it creates anxiety. I started at .25 for a month and am on .5 for one and a half months and was nauseous for a month. I found taking the shot at night has helped with that. I have lost 12 pounds and It curbs my appetite like nothing else has, I no longer crave sweets or snacks; I am not waking up in the middle of the night to get a snack which been amazing! I do have headaches even lightheaded but that is caused from not eating.

I started Wegovy on Aug 17th, so I'm 3 months in and have lost 25lbs.  I'm currently on 1.7 doses for this month. I've not changed anything in my lifestyle.  I will say that Wegovy helps me crave only nutritious foods and drinks.  It's totally changed my taste buds.  What that means is some foods/drinks i used to enjoy, i no longer crave and in fact, I now dislike them.  No more coffee for me at all.  No more sweets, chocolates, etc.  I seriously had an addiction to chocolate kisses and now just the sight of them makes me slightly nauseous. I don't really exercise either, so like I said my weight loss is all Wegovy.  I have a minor side effect of nausea but it's mostly when i wake up in the morning.  How can anyone complain with these kind of results? I love Wegovy!  Happy weight loss everyone!

I started last Friday, I am ok Saturday but Sunday night star my diarrhea, bloating and burping for 2 day, after that happen I am feeling so tired and so fatigue; when eating something immediately go to the toilet, all night like that . Stop now but I lost my appetite and I tired. I have high blood pressure,Rheumatoid Arthritis and fibromyalgia and I take a lot 7 different pills every day for my diseases . I decided not take anymore wegovy , because I do not liked lost weight like that. Thanks.

This medication has worked wonders for me. I am irritable and notice heartburn and headaches if I don't eat (since this curbs hunger and cravings). I am on my second round of .5 mg after three weeks at .25 mg. I accidentally took a 1 mg dose instead of the .5 dose. Anyone else do this? Any reactions?

Overall Wegovy has been one of the best weight loss tools I have ever used. However, those that are using this or considering using this need to understand just that, it is only a tool. Wegovy has allowed me to feel fuller almost every single day, without eating 1/2 of what I put on my plate. I am on my 2nd dose of .5 (about 6 weeks) and have lost 18 lbs. I do a lot of cardio, but I also love the gym. I feel nauseous if I eat too much or too much of something with too much sugar or fat. I feel this is teaching me how to eat better. Good luck to everyone using this product and to those that might choose this route for their own health.

I'm on my 4th dose of the .25 & only lost 8 pds. Its seems to be working, I found out that drinking beer is a NO GO for me. I havnt had any major problems with. I'm not as hungry as I thought I would be.

I am only two weeks in but seeing definite results. I have lost 10 lbs in 2 weeks with a combination of Wegovy, exercise, and a 1200 cal/day diet. I've noticed that Wegovy has curbed my appetite BIG TIME which is helpful since I've cut my intake in half. 
Some negative side effects I've been experiencing are:
1. constipation
2. headache
3. slight hair loss (this may be more from the reduced cal diet vs Wegovy)
I feel good though and I can't wait to give an update in a month or two!

I just started the 1.0 MG dose. I haven't had any trouble at all, except 1 night of horrible heartburn... that's it. I have a very large numb area on my left thigh from when I was pregnant, so I have no issues with taking the injection lol. So far, after 9 injections I've lost 30 lbs. I haven't gotten a whole lot of energy back yet... I'll be glad when it does.
I am on week 5 on 0.5 injections and donât notice that I am any less hungry. Lost 2 pounds. I eat just as much as I did before stating the medication so it is not working well for me.
No carvings at all. Im able to stick to eating under 1200 calories per day. Doesn't hurt. Mouth nausea dissipates after about a month 3rd Month in...171-150. I love it

I have been on Wegovy for almost 3 weeks now and have lost 8lbs. I had a baby in January 2021 and have had the hardest time losing the weight. The only side effect that I have had is a little constipation, other than that- this has been a life saver!! I will continue to update everyone as I take the medication. My goal is to lose 30lbs to get down to my pre-pregnancy weight! I am currently at 183lbs.

Wegovy has been great for me July20th was my start day and my weight was 206. I'm able to get my medication for 25$ each month. I did experience some nausea and  feeling quizzy no vomiting. Yes it has been difficulty to get the dose of medication from pharmacies when you need it but my pharmacist has been great about looking around and getting it to me in time for increase. However when i increased to 1mg my body could not handle it , I became nervous on the inside and not eating hardly any food. The taste of most foods I love and have been eating  for years no longer taste the same therefore I don't have a taste for anything so my provider switch me back down to the 0.5 and I'm am doing great. As of today 11/2/21  my weight is 183. 

                                                                         Happy with Wegovy!

I have been on ozempic for weight loss since May. I have lost 40 lbs. after getting through side effects over the first month.  I am currently at 1mg/week but want to increase my dose to 1.5.  As everyone knows, this drug is very expensive.  I have a couple of cartridges containing .5 or just 1mg. My question for anyone with any knowledge or experience: can I inject .5 of one pen and 1mg from another to bring my dose to where it needs to be?  I will not discard any of this medication! Any information would be appreciated. Thank you!

Just completed my 12th week injection and Iâm down 32 lbs so far! I spent one month at .25 and two at .5. Moving up to 1mg next week. Did experience bad nausea for a while, so my Dr prescribed Zofran and I take one pill before the injection and I donât have any issues now. Definitely cuts my hunger/cravings way down. I focus on eating clean/lean proteins, fruit/veg, dairy (Greek yogurt) and very few grains. Iâm diligent about checking labels and learned early on not to cheat. This medication will let you know fast if it doesnât like something you ate and you wonât forget.  Been working with a Dietitian and she really helped me with making smart food choices. Exercising one day a week with a trainer and hoping to increase that soon. Weighing myself daily which has really helped.  I can tell how my body responds to any new foods this way. I first tried getting the medication at CVS and Walgreens and they werenât able to get it. My local CVS still canât (asked them recently). I use an independent local pharmacy now and they have no issues getting it. Go figure. Briefly used the coupon code, which was great, but my insurance has authorized paying for it, so thatâs even easier.  If you are committed to eating properly/exercising I would definitely recommend Wegovy.
This semiglutide has worked wonders for me.   My sugar cravings are non existent.   I'm drawn to vegetables and lean Mears.   I've lost 15 pounds in a little over 3 weeks.   "Game changer" for sure!!

I have taken this medication (.25) for one month.  I have had no adverse side effects.  I still enjoy food, but just feel full much more quickly and for a longer period of time than usual.  I needed to lose about 30 pounds and have lost 8 pounds in the past month. The only complaint I have is that it took over a month for any pharmacy in my area to get it in stock, and now I canât get a refill.  I paid $374 out of pocket for one month.  My insurance didnât cover any of it.

On my 10th week have lost 30lbs. It really helped with appetite control.  I feel like I am making better nutrition choice. I eat small snacks with high protein.  I do get nauseous the day after my injection and have trouble drinking water just switched to non sugar flavored.. I set a timer to make sure I am getting enough fluids to prevent the headaches.
Took for weight loss. Lost 23 pounds in 2 months but then not only did I not lose, I started to be hungry all the time. Nausea started. Discontinued. Disappointed.

Iâm up to 1.7 mg dosage and the experience was great until I reached 1.5. Diarrhea and bloating completely took over. Iâll stay on it to see if perhaps that was just thatâs dosage. 
The cost without the coupon is in the thousands but if you have the coupon your total cost is $25. My PPO insurance does not cover it and I think $25 is a great price. To be clear itâs $25 total and not $25 off.

I have started very slowly â ozempix in the .25 dose for 8 weeks and then the Wegovy at .50 dose for 8 weeks. I have experienced acid reflux and diarrhea but not terrible. And I have lost 20 pounds in 3 months. I have no desire for food, but when I do eat, I feel drawn to carbs! If it wasnât for the fact I was feeding a house full of men three meals a day, I probably wouldnât eat a thing all day. As it is, I sit down with them and pick. Itâs worked like a charm and I donât feel at all deprived. Since I have hit a weight loss plateau my doc is upping my dose this month to the 1.0 .

Today was my first day.  Discovered have hashimoto's thyroiditis and that is why I have gained 40 pounds in the past year. I took shot at 12pm and it is 5pm and I dont feel well at all, dizzy, lightheaded, chest tingling and dry mouth, I do not do well with most meds but praying they subside because the weight loss is definitely needed for health reasons.

Doc Gave me 2.4 mg first dose and violently throwing up for 3 days straight.  lost 16 lbs in that week and in bed for 7 days. Second dose 2nd week bloated, gas high B/P ! 3rd week more the same as second week.  Constipation! gastric slow down! Overall disappointed ! I stopped taking it.  Not for me.   FDA should never had approved such a dangerous drug! Join the gym !

so far I have lost 14 pounds in 10 days. The only side effects I have had are a mild headache, but do feel fatigued. But thrilled with the results and know that pace can't continue but need to keep trying
Started wegovy yesterday 10/17/21, Hoping for positive results. I did not yesterday night that I had alot of gas.
