The third month really increases the effectiveness however, the fatigue and Nausea is almost unbearable.  I asked my doc to go back to month two for a bit
Can anyone help me? I donât think Iâm fully getting the pen to work- Iâve tried twice and the medication just pours out on the ground after I think I am done!
I have not had many side effects thankfully. I lost five pounds right away,  but 10 weeks in I have not lost any weight or seen any changes in my appetite.

Iâve struggled with some vomiting and diarrhea, but noticed that not eating within 5 hours of bedtime, and truly not eating even a bite more when I start to feel full, is the way to avoid vomiting. (I read about bariatric surgery recovery and adapted accordingly.) I struggled with a bit of nausea initially, but now I take Dramamine ahead of the injection and itâs helped a lot. I started on the .5 mg dose and am up to 1 mg, and have lost 25 lbs since Sept 1.

Occasional nausea, but passes quickly. I have lost 3.5 lbs this first week. No real problems at all, injection is easy, in the side of my thigh. Wegovy defiantly helps curb cravings and appetite. Going to keep going as it seems to work well.

I got violently ill from taking Wegovy. I had all the side effects nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, constipation, stomach  pain, headache, tiredness , upset stomach, dizziness, feeling bloated, belching, gas, and heartburn.
I was in the ER 2 times in 24 hours for severe dehydration, non stop throwing up and migraine.
Thankfully the vomiting has stopped but now I have diarrhea.
The cost of the medicine and copay for 2 ER visits have cost me almost $500. 
All this was after my first dose of the medicine. Now I have to dispose of 3 months of this stuff.
Very expensive lesson learned.
Had sever vomiting and headaches the first week but then slowly recovered. I have lost 20 lbs in 7 weeks. Has everyone upped their dosage as described in the materials or remained on the same dosage?

I am happy for everyone that is having great results with this but i, unfortunately, did not. I stopped after week 5 because I had gained 18 pounds and was having terrible migraines. Instead of feeling fuller I kept feeling like no matter how much I ate I was still hungry. In an odd and possibly unrelated twist, I have non diabetic hypoglycemia and while taking this my blood sugar was constantly low, Iâm talking in the 40s and 50s after eating a healthy meal. The only way to deal with that is to eat so this was a disaster for me all the way around.

I was started on the o.5mg dose and the nausea started about 2 hours later. I threw up about 6 times throughout the night and had severe nausea with tapering vomiting the following 3 days. I started to feel a little better the day prior to taking my second dose. Again, severe nausea for about 2 days, difficulty concentrating and very dehydrated. Iâve lost 15 pounds in 10 days. I spoke with my doctor who recommended that I go down to the 0.25mg dose for a month but canât get the medication at the pharmacy due to supply issues. Iâm now 2 days past when I should have taken it and back to throwing up again. I wonât be taking this again.

I think I have tons of side effects. Nausea and vomiting for up to 4 days. Feeling better day before next dose.  Also, food sits on stomach for days leaving me with horrible gas and bloating. Alternate between Diarrhea and Constipation.

I took the highest dose and have been vomiting for over a week. So Iâm losing weight but Iâm so, so, so sick. Its been completely debilitating. Itâs just not worth it.
I'm so sick , can't stop throwing  up, it's been 1 week since my 1st dose, just got my 2 dose, was on ozempic  before for about 2 months,  down 40 pounds,

Just started treatment. Had a fair amount of Nausea the first 4 days after injection; then it started to ease off. Lost about 4 pounds this first week, but made other dietary changes too (quit drinking alcohol, juice, sodas). Think the medicine made it easier to avoid those things (seemed to have more willpower to resist).  Next injection is approaching and I'm worried I will be nauseated again. Plan to go ahead with it though (hopefully that side effect is temporary).
The pharmacies are having difficulty getting the drug from there supplier's so I might go 1 or 2 weeks between refills.

Iâve been taking it 2 1/2 months really no side effects and Iâve lost about 18 pounds Iâm just really upset that theyâre having supply problems especially once you start something you donât want to stop and try to go back again.
Terrible vomiting, blood pressure through the roof 190/110 for more than 24 hrs so far.  Had to go to ER.  Dehydrated too.

So far down 44lbs in 6 months. Thats nearly 8 per.  Could not be happier - hunger practically gone. Eating so much less, and whatâs better, not constantly thinking about my next meal!  The hard thing is making sure you can get it. So popular, manufacture is having a hard time filling stock!

I am on week#7 and down 15 pounds.  I walked an average of 13,000 to 15,000 steps Monday through Friday and on the weekend I average 20,000 steps.  Iâm on the third .50 dosage.  I drink around 180 oz to 210 oz of water a day.  I use to drink half-half sweet tea all day and water at night.  It has cut back my appetite and no cravings for anything sweet.  I give the shot in my left arm since I have a phobia of sticking a needle in my stomach or leg.  The arm is so easy and it doesnât hurt.  I would recommend this for sure.  The more you work out or walk, the better the results!

I started on the 0.25 injection in July. No side effects, no weight gain or loss. Then had to wait 3 weeks to get the refill for the next dose of 0.5. I just took the first dose of it 4 days ago and I haven't been able to keep anything down at all. I eat a little bit and 20 minutes later it all comes up. I can't keep going like this. It is severe projectile vomiting. On the bright side, I did lose 3 pounds, but i don't want to lose it like this. My throat burns from vomiting so much, I've had a migraine, and I'm afraid to eat anything and i don't know how long it'll take for this medication to leave my body.

Insurance wonât cover and out of pocket is $3500- the coupon that is offered is a discount for $25! Big deal! Iâll have my NP switch back to an affordable pill option. Donât waste your money nor your time.

I am on week four and I take 2mg. Since I have gallbladder problems I expected to have some issues and I did but drinking apple cider in my water and taking magnesium helped a lot. All of those symptoms went away at week four. I love wegovy. It really takes away my sugar cravings and my appetite. In fact, food was all I use to think of. Now, I have completely lost interest in it. I have diabetes and thyroid disease, so it's really hard for me to lose weight, but for the first time, I am hopeful. Now that food has lost its charm, I am looking for something else to occupy my time. ;D
I'm on my 3 injection and I've lost 6 pounds. My only issue is I have sever constipation. But overall, taking the injection is not bad at all. I hope I begin to see more weight loss.

Completed week 9 shot 1mg. I have been so sick, from the start. Vomiting, horrible constipation, burps, throat burn, acid reflux bad, just sick sick sick. I have lost a little weight but this is not worth being sick and not being able to do a thing.

I began 5 weeks ago. 10lbs down, no side effects. My craving for sweets were gone. Major problem, you can not get a refill. No pharmacy has it. Back ordered til September 30. So my Dr. has prescribed me something else til it gets in.

Ease of use?  How can it be easy to use when availability is inconsistent.  It has been a struggle to get prescription filled every month with it taking 4 weeks before first prescription filled after moving prescription to several pharmacies.  Now after dose 8 Iâm faced with 7 weeks before dose 1.0 is available on October 31. Does stopping the progression of doses raise flags of concern for the anybody but me?  Lost about 7 lbs.  Good appetite suppressant.  Sweets are too sweet.  Definite side effect of messing with my mind and moods. Iâm wondering if stopping wegovy cold turkey is going to cause more of these unwanted side effects.
The only issue I have with this drug is getting it filled.  The pharmacies are having difficulty getting the drug from there supplier's.

I just took week 4. The side effect I have experienced the most is gas. I started drinking chamomile tea to help with it. Just like many of you, my sweet cravings have stopped. I have little to no appetite.  I noticed that if I do get a headache it's because I haven't eaten and once I eat the headache goes away. I do drink lots of water. I'm due for the higher dose next week and I'm hoping that the side effects remain tolerable. The needle itself is small, for those of you wondering it's like an epi-pen, slight sting but that's it.

I just did my 6th injection yesterday. I have lost 7lbs and 30 inches all over. This has definitely cut back my appetite and sometimes I have to remind myself to eat. I am also eating much less at meals so I made up snack boxes this week to make sure I eat a healthy snack that is low calorie. The only problem I have found is eggs taste and smell funny to me. I have asked my family if they noticed eggs tasting funny and they said no so I know it's me with this medication. I also noticed that the smell I get with eggs is now stuck in my nose. It's like a sulfur smell. Overall this medication is working and very easy to use. I do the injection in my thighs just switch each week.

Weeks 1-4 on 0.25.  Hunger diminished, exercising regularly, riding my bike daily.  Week 5 I started .5 and that's where this story unfortunately will end.   I cannot explain how sick I am.    I've had a hiatal hernia which is dormant for 20 or more years, I take nexium daily.   It's I describable how sick I've been.   Vomiting, diarrhea, sulphur burps, queasy stomach, feels like a brick is on my sternum.    Cannot lie down, burning bile backs up.   Today would have been my sixth shot, second st .5.  Instead of taking it, I'm googling how long it will take for this stuff to leave my system.    My diet is very low calorie, 500 or under, with that and exercise, I lost 11 lbs over five weeks.  After the horrific reaction, three lbs more came off but that's because of artificial weight loss although I would have lost a bet if I'd have bet no human being can expell that much material in one day.  I've never been this sick.  E VER.   So I'm going to stop now because I think the lesson is beware if you have a hiatal hernia.   It definitely was effective but I know it had very bad consequences for me. Nothing helped.   I found myself searching my cabinets for leftover Zantac, that's how much I just wanted to disappear.    Cannot lie down, aches everywhere.   Bye bye for me

I began taking Wegovy 5 weeks ago. I started on the .25 dose and now am on the 1.0 dose. I have tried everything on the market snd this has been the only thing that works for me.

Within 2 days of taking this medicine, I began vomiting, this continued for 2 days,unable to keep anything down,dehydrated, by the time that I went to hospital, kidneys were at 26% function, and I was in ketoacidosis,spent 3 days in icu

I started Wegovy 0.25mg on 8/26/21 weighing in at 198.6lbs. I have been eating low calorie since then which has been easy to do because my appetite has decreased dramatically! I am super surprised because today I am down 5.4lbs! The only side effect so far is very mild nausea which comes and goes but is very manageable. But I'm also scared that I may get pancreatitis next as it's also a common complication of wygovy?? I'm calling my Dr Monday to discuss this. Sitting in the hospital now revering from surgery??

Started at .5mg no real nausea, I would have a few bouts of the runs the first week. However I had gastric bypass a few years back so my stomach is always off. Yet this didnât make it any worse. Has taken urges away to snack and really simply eat. I donât feel terribly full yet could be because I have a small stomach to begin with and I eat small meals to begin with. First week only threw up once. Second week no issues and now into my third week. I am disappointed in the weight loss so far in 18 days only lost 4.4 pounds and that is eating average 600 calories per day, keeping carbs under 80 per day and working out 3-4x per week. I was truly hoping for a jump in my weight loss.  I feel ready to move onto 1.0 after my 4th shot.  the shot itself I donât even feel it I jsur feel the pressure of the pen kn my thigh which I recommend upper thigh. as for the benefits I cannot see. I am barely pre diabetic 5.7 A1c and this medicine hasnât caused me to have low blood sugar that I can tell, even with keeping to under 80g carbs per say. My insurance doesnât cover and I have the discount savings card from Novo for six months which I understand they stopped for anyone new after 8-16 but I am able to get 5 more month supplies. There is a shortage and I had to call around and luckily found a pharmacy a bit far to fill my 1.0 box. More to follow when i move onto 1.0

This is the end of my second week on Wegovy.  I have lost about 7 lbs and quite happy with those results. The first day of injection has been the worse for me accompanied with an annoying headache. I sometimes felt mild acid reflux and nausea that I normally calm with a soda and crackers. I endure dry mouth along with an irritating bitter or nasty taste in my mouth. Other times, I just feel off kilter and can't identify a specific symptom. But I am really concerned about my fatigue which I felt more the second week.  I noticed only a few people mentioned that side affect. My appetite has largely diminished. (Actually, the joy of craving a particular food and satisfying that craving is done). When I do, eat pretty much anything will do. With busy 12 hour work days, I often don't eat at all. I conclude that may be attributing to the lethargy. I have succumbed to drinking pedialyte regularly and intend on drinking more water. I am getting through the day OK but can't wait to lie down when I get home (unusual for me). A few co-workers have commented on my lack of energy and luster, so to speak.  Perhaps Week 3 will be better.  I'm fighting to endure the "cons" for the desired result.  I get married in November and would love to be about 30-40 lbs lighter for the wedding. If I happen to reach that goal, I will probably refrain from taking it and work hard to keep the weight off.

Iâm currently on my 6th dose at .5mg. So far Iâve lost 11 lbs with no exercise. The needle is very small and I can hardly feel it. Iâm injecting into my thigh. Pros: Iâm not hungry at all so I have to force myself to eat. When I do eat I eat very little. Cons: I get really nauseated especially on day of injection and day after. The other days are more tolerable. Every now and then I experience some heartburn which subsides with over the counter meds. All in all the drug is working! I can deal with the minor side effects as long as Iâm getting great results. Im eating a lot less and losing weight as a result. I will try to incorporate exercise this week to speed up the weight loss. ??

Hi everyone, I am 33 years old and weigh 240. I have been on Wengovy for two weeks and just started my 3rd week today. I have lost 5 pounds since I started the medication. The only side effects I have noticed is gas and that is only a day or two after the injection. (On belly) the injection itself does not hurt. I find that it gives me a bit more energy throughout the day. I do notice that eating sugar or things that contain any sugar like fruit make me nauseous along with over eating. But I still do get very hungry throughout the day. I find that I cannot eat as much as before starting this medication. I have changed my diet and started walking on a daily basis.

My PCP prescribed this fiord me and finally after 3 weeks my pharmacy got it in.   I am so reluctant to start this after reading the side effects.    I need to loose weight so bad.  Hoping I will get the nerve up to take the first dose!  A ny advice will be appreciated!
I started Wegovy 4 weeks ago and lost nothing. Then Pen is irritating because you have to push hard to inject. Wish it worked for me.

I am new to this and have only been on it one day. I lost 2.5 over night. Hope it continues. I feel less hungry and have a bit of heartburn but an antiacid helped. I am hopeful for progress toward my goal.

I'm in Chicago and cannot get a prescription anywhere - I need the second cycle (0.5) but can't get any that or the third cycle.   My doctor gave me the first cycle.  From this forum, seems like everyone is able to get the prescription filled.  Anyone having the same issue?

The pen to administer is terrible.  Have to push very hard into injection site to get it to click.  If I'm pushing into fat in stomach area can push inches deep with no click triggered.  the clicks are loud and obnoxious, the injection hurts   When to pull away from injection site is not clear because the second click is NOT when to pull away.  if giving on upper arm, hard to see yellow bar. the saxenda injections were SO much easier,  I give the Wegovy pen an D-
Started wegovy in May, I am now about to start my 2.4 mg injections I AM DOWN 33 LBS, no major side effects, just not hungry.

Started out on .25 dose and lost 8 pounds in 3 weeks The last 4 weeks I have lost an additional 6 pounds. I am just not that hungry so my portion sizes are way down. And if I overeat I am punished with feeling too full for hours after. I had some nausea and diarrhea the first week. But now no noticeable side effects. This has been a miracle for me. Bumping up the dose to .5 next week.
Just do not feel cravings nor inability to avoid hunger.  Don't understand how, but really don't care.  Week 3 of .25 injections, hope keep moving in same direction.

Sorry to post here, but I am hoping to get advice from those who have started taking Wegovy.  How did you find a qualified doctor to start the process?  Did you just use your standard family doctor or did you locate someone with specific knowledge of Wegovy?  If the latter, how did you find them?  I tried Novo Nordisk, but they were unable to refer to anyone local (St Paul, MN).    Any help would be appreciated.  Thanks.

I am currently on week 2 of the .25 dosage and what Iâve found is that I am simply not as interested in eating as I normally would be, and eat significantly less at each meal. Iâve also found it easier to bypass the candy bowl at work. Iâve made no changes to exercise or to the types of foods I eat, yet I have managed to lose 4 pounds in 1.5 weeks. I did find that if I eat  my dinner too late, I end up throwing it up, but thatâs the only side effect Iâve seen. I donât mind it, because it serves as a behavior modifier. I also seem to have boundless energy, but that may only be coincidental. Iâm extremely pleased with my experience.

Just stuck myself today with the week 5 at .5.  Previous four weeks were at .25. Injections have been totally painless.  No nausea.  So unpleasant side effects.  The main effect is that I am just rarely hungry and it does not take much for me to feel full when I do eat.  Only lost a couple of pounds so far.

I have been on Wegovy two weeks now...I started out with the .5 dose since getting the .25 was impossible. My first shot, I did have vomiting about 8 hours later and nausia the first day. However, food intake is way down. The full feeling has really helped me cut out snacking. I am drinking lots of water ( 96 ounces plus a day) and I am sure the first week was a lot of water weight loss, but 8.8 pounds the first week. I have upped my exercise game to ensure I continue the downward trend. No side effects so far with the second shot. I make sure I drink a protein drink.I doubt week 2 will be as good as week one, but reading these reviews it seems I am doing really well in just the first week.   For a person that has struggled and stressed about weight gain my whole life, this simple shot has changed my outlook and I do believe lossing the weight is gonna happen. I am super pumped as I take the 6 month journey ( that $25 card) and see where this goes.

I just started on my second week of the .5mg dose. I haven't experienced any nausea, vomiting or abdominal pain. The first symptom I noticed was a headache while on the .25mg dose. Second was the decreased appetite and the feeling of fullness after consuming very little. I have also experienced belching, but the most significant side effect has been the overwhelming feeling of fatigue for the first few days after dosing.I started on Wegovy on 7/21/21 after a 3 week delay due to insufficient supply. I have lost 8lbs overall so far. I am happy to continue on the course!

I'm on week number 5 of the wegovy ..the first 2 week's were horrible fatigue nausea diarrhea and gassy had no energy to do anything....my Dr gave me some nausea meds so I wud give myself a shot then take a pill right away and tht helped tremendously!!! Im on week 5 now with the 2.4 dose and just a little fatigue no other symptoms overall i have lost 10lbs!! So I'm very happy and thts with little to no exercise....I do have to force myself to eat thou..im always full...Im also a type 2 diabetic and I have not had to take any insulin or any diabetic meds since I have started this medication...my average sugar are 99 now...sometimes I go as low as 70 and 80's I use the Libre and it gives u an overall of how your sugars are...so far thus is working for me so yeaaaa!

I first started taking this I was sick as a dog. But I started drinking gingerale and it helped tremendously with my nausea. The second week was good still no craving for sweets I lost 7lbs at the end of wk 2. Week 3 I can tell that my craving are beginning to come back and I only lost .4. I will definitely be taking .5 when it's time to switch doses. I'd rather deal with nausea if it means me losing weight in the right way especially with water aerobics and walking with ankle weights.

I'm 69 and have been overweight since menopause--very happy to have this opportunity.  I took my fourth injection yesterday and have lost 9 # so far.  I'm glad I did not read any of these reviews before starting.  I have had some nausea and fatigue, but I am continuing, and  overall  quite pleased.  I will talk to my doctor next week to get assistance with the nausea.  I have been able to continue my exercise regime even though I'm feeling more tired.   I am planning to do a second month at the same .25 mg dose as it does not seem likely I will feel good enough on a higher dose.  My appetite has sharply diminished and really only want to eat twice a day--breakfast and dinner.  I am drinking lots of water due to increased thirst, and I have mostly curtailed my evening glass of wine.  I am hoping to continue to lose pounds on the lowest dose.

Started first dose on Thursday around 1pm, by 7pm nausea started and by 9 I started vomiting. The vomiting didn't stop, twice over night, in the morning, afternoon, etc... It's more Saturday morning and I'm still nauseated and still vomiting.  I can't keep down the smallest amounts of water.  I think the level of nausea was under played, when it was prescribed my doctor told me to sip some ginger ale to help.  We are way beyond ginger ale.

I did the first injection (in my stomach). I thought it was tolerable. I had nausea and a headache, but the worst was the fatigue. I did NOTHING for a week!  Extremely unlike me.  It took all of 7 days for the side effects to subside.  I did not do the second week...yet. I did lose 5lbs. I did not have an appetite. I just wanted to sleep. I have read some of the reviews.  I want to try the second dose after a week off from the side effects. I have not, just yet.
I started yesterday .25 I am very very nauseous / heartburn I use to take heartburn medicine can I take it with this? or just take Tums?  will it ease up ?

I just started .5 yesterday. Iâm down 10 pounds from the first 4 weeks. I was hoping for a greater drop but Iâll take it. Really struggle to get 1000 cal/day. No side effects what so ever. I am a week into starting Wegovy. After reading reviews prior to starting I decided to inject into my thigh. Minimal pain at injection site once injection starts then it clears up. 1st day I had the feeling of overeating and

Took 2nd week of .5mg was fine for about 6 hour and then I started having nausea, dizziness,fatigue, vomiting, headache, low blood sugar, fast heart rate and insomnia. I will not be taking the medication again. As much as I need help with weight loss it is not worth it. I have been in bed for 3 days and does not seem to be getting any better.

I have been on this for three weeks now.  I have had not much side effects, but haven't lost any weight either.  I am unsure if this is really going to do anything.  Maybe going to the 0.5 will be more effective?  I would love to know if anyone has had the same experience as me ?

I'm on day 3  of .5mg and so far I'm very pleased with the results - I'm already down 7 pounds. The main side effect I've had is extreme moodiness, and other lesser side effects are malaise, gassy/bloating and light-headedness. I think the biggest issue I'll have on this medication is eating enough. I have set a timer to eat every two hours a really small snack because I'm just not hungry whatsoever! I will definitely keep posting my feedback and results. I feel very hopeful because I've tried everything to lose weight and absolutely nothing has worked. Thank you.
I'm on week seven at .5 mg.  I've lost 19 pounds.  I started walking on a treadmill as well.  My cravings have been greatly reduced.  Only slight side effects!!

Took my second shot yesterday. Didn't feel this one at all in thigh, first shot in stomach was painful. Side effects not as bad as I was fretting. No nausea! Bad constipation. Some headache and dizziness. Reduced appetite. Definitely not eating as much! Drinking lots of water. Down 5 pounds.

Will be taking higher dose next week. Hoping the side effects stay pretty minimal! But overall staying hopeful that I can shed all the weight off!

Extremely easy to use - barely felt injection if at all. Iâve been taking this for 2 1/2 weeks. Definitely have some constipation and bloating so that has been slightly uncomfortable. Only my first week. Nausea/vomiting has been difficult. Recommend asking your Dr for nausea meds. Headache only first couple days. And fatigue. Recommend liquid/soft diet first week to help pass nausea and help constipation. Also, SMALL PORTIONS. Shot is easy peasy, no pain! It will take getting used to and figuring out how/what to eat to reduce symptoms. I've lost 10lbs in 6 days. DRINK LOTS OF WATER!! If you're serious about losing weight, the side affects are manageable.

I started my injection last Saturday 7/24/2021- my ONLY complaint is that it took me 3 weeks and 4 pharmacies to find the first dose and despite all the appeals from myself and doctor, it will not be covered by my insurance :( I did get the 6 month card and that has been awesome, just hoping in 6 months I will be able to get the meds through insurance pay. I didn't even feel the shot at all, I put it in my upper left thigh- where I dont have much feeling anyway. I did get a slight headache later in the day, but nothing else. I woke up this morning w very little uneasiness to my stomach but it quickly went away. I was expecting the worst so this has been a blessing! I did youtube another person who is taking it and she was the same way and then the upped dosage next in line kicked her butt. I hope that isnt the case for me. I am down 5lbs since I started it, 3 of which happened overnight.

I took my 2nd injection 3 days ago and so far so good.  My doctor prescribed an anti-nausea medication but I really haven't needed it.  The only side effect so far is constipation. My appetite has been greatly reduced on just the smallest dose.  I don't have the cravings for sugar that I had before.  I've lost 4.3 lbs in only 10 days.  I'm hoping to lose 30 lbs overall so this is a great start.

My first shot was 7/15 second was 7/21. I have lost 9lbs to date. Weighing and measuring my food and monitoring carbs and sugars along with journaling my intake. No side effects. Significant reduction in appetite. Injection simple to administer.

I've been taking this medication for two weeks now. Only side effect is mild nausea a few hours after injection, but no vomiting and it subsides fairly quickly. Makes me thirsty, I drink more water. My appetite is WAY less now and i eat way less, also. Not craving sweets or carbs. Absolute BEST weight loss medication on the market today! Preventative for weight related comorbidities such as diabetes and hypercholesterolemia, etc. The price is way too expensive, but hopefully over time it can be less than $100/mo. With the promotional discount card, it's $25/mo for 6 months max. Without insurance Wegovy and Saxenda are around $1400/mo, ridiculous prices.
I started only a week ago.  No side effects but appetite is way less.
